Explore ruins, find ancient destroyed cities, discover strange abandoned sites, experience new creatures, meet new cultures, but most importantly... find out more about the ominous unknown threat that whispers in the shadows, and threatens all of the free peoples of Triple-G!

Development

Currently playtesting Zone 1: The Green Hills of Gorthicon - Players must clear the Lost Pass before the Ominous Whispers track gets to 6.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Tile Placement

name: Janosch Bildersuche
description:
From the rulebook flavour text: The lightning fast reaction game with the little tiger and his friends for 2 to 6 players ages 5 and up. - The little tiger has a party and everybody has arrived: the little bear, the good looking goose, Guenter the frog and all the tiger friends. They eat, they laugh and dance with a lot of action. Of course they make photographs, as everyone wants a picture of him/her with friends to take home. Who gets the most photographs wins. And it works like this: Roll the dice, quickly look for the pictures and grab them fast.

Janosch Bildersuche (with Janosch being an artist and author of childrens books and Bildersuche meaning picture search) consists of 25 cards, each depicting two of Janoschs characters, and 2 6-sided dice that have stickers with these characters on them. All cards are put on the table for everybody to see. The dice are rolled. The first player to find the matching card - depicting the 2 characters that were rolled - touches it with one hand, and if correct gets to keep it. After all picture cards are rolled and found the player with the most cards is declared the winner.

name: Bee Sneaky!
description:
"Each player is an ambitious bee who wants to be the big-shot of the hive by building his or her own. Hives go up in value by having wide levels and tall stacks of honey. As soon as the Wax Stash includes the predetermined number of hexagons, the game ends. Whoever has built the most valuable hive (structure of hexagons) at the end of the game becomes the Big-Shot Bee and wins the game." (From the rulebook)

Bee Sneaky! is a game of double-double-think. With a light beehive theme, the only game components needed to play the game are generic transparent plastic yellow hexagons. Each round, a player secretly places a number of hexagons he wants to add to his hive in his left hand, and a number of hexagons in his right hand that corresponds to the specific way he wants to place them: either on the base-level of the hive, or on higher levels of the hive, or in stacks of "honey." But if several players choose the same action, only the player with the least number of hexagons to place gets to play the action!

This game is currently looking for a publisher. If interested, please contact the game's designer Corin A. Friesen at strategytree@verizon.net (or send a private message to username "Ambrose" on Board Game Geek).

Components:
• 300 small transparent plastic yellow hexagons in a hexagonal travel vinyl zipper case
• 1 rulebook

Other components for optional use:
• 42 cards
- 24 action cards, 6 in each of the 4 types (Expand, Level-Up, Make-Honey, Outwit)
- 18 number cards, 6 in each of the 3 numbers (1, 2, 3)
• 6 score cards
• 6 player aids

name: Burgen der Fränkischen Schweiz
description:
Castles of the Franconian Switzerland is the exciting game of strategy and knowledge for the whole family.
The goal of this game is to conquer castles and fortresses to liberate foreign.
Players roll the dice and move their pawn and in certain boxes try to conquer the castles by answering the questions about the castles included in the game, the Middle Ages and the Knights of existence in general.
Who has occupied all the castles in the end, is the supreme lord of the castle of Franconian Switzerland, thus winning the game. Younger knights can make the event as pure dice game (without answering questions).

name: Quad Rune
description:
2-8 player word game that's all about 4-letter words.

Gameplay is simple: write down as many 4-letter words as you can think of within 30 seconds. The words you chose are based on certain criteria established by a roll of the Game Mode die, which includes 6 different game modes: Starts With, Ends With, Dual Rune, Rhymes With, Relation, and Weak Link. The first three modes are letter-based, and decided on the roll of a D20 letter die. The last three modes are word-based, and decided on the flip of a Word Card. Only 4-letter words are allowed (no plurals), and only unique words earn you a point (ie. if another player has the same word as you, neither of you earn a point for that word). First player to 44 points wins.

The game has unique custom packaging, in an engraved wooden box that measures on 3.5" x 5.5" (just a bit bigger than an index card!), and has a wood-and-glass timer, and wooden and bone-colored dice to keep with the old-world runic theme.

name: Race to Insanity
description:
Race to Insanity is best suited for 5 players. One player is known as the Active Player, and they try to perform a combination of Challenges picked by other players from cards drawn from the deck. The Active Player earns points for successfully completed Challenges during their 1 minute round of play. Here is an example of a possible combination of Challenges during one round.

Blue Challenge (Vocal Lines):  Say three times fast – Molly munched on many muffins Monday

Pink Challenge (Actions & Motions):  Hop around like a monkey

Green Challenge (Facial Expressions):  Make a fish face
Yellow Challenge (Vocal Impressions): Talk like a pirate

How many of these could you do in a minute?

name: BattleMage
description:
BattleMage is a semi-cooperative deck-building board game. Players each assume the role of a BattleMage frantically slinging spells from atop their castle's walls in an attempt to stall an endless onslaught of invading Monsters for as long as possible.

The BattleMage who achieves the most honor by best defending their homeland will be awarded the title of Grand ArchMage and win the game!

Players will collect spell cards in a classic deck-building fashion using 3 separate resources. Each spell card has an immediate effect as well as a lasting Resonance effect. These abilities are used to try and destroy an everlasting onslaught of monsters approaching the castle walls which will move toward the castle each turn as determined by the roll of dice. Defeated monsters are harvested into players' decks by the Soul Crystals they leave behind, to even further boost each player's deck during play.

BattleMage is for 1-4 players (yes, there is a solitaire play variant!) and takes 45-60 minutes to play.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Consetta and Her Wheel of Fate
description:
One player is familiar with the rules and acts as "Medium" and tells the fortunes of the other players, who must participate via various cards (there are several kinds, with numbers, symbols, and questions/answers) and their placement on an illustrated board that implements a kind of zodiac.

There is a fictional backstory of the Gypsy Princess Consetta of course, and the artwork of William Longyear is featured everywhere from the box cover to the instructions to the board and all the cards.

name: Mourinho and the Special Ones
description:
Mourinho and the Special Ones (MSO) is a trading card game based on the TV series of the same name. Two players build themselves a team of footballers and a draw deck of skills and tactics then go head-to-head against each other.

The game is played over two halves on a simplified playing area of lines (Forward, Midfield, Defense) and zones (Wing and Centre) that represent the Pitch.

When you are the attacking player, you will attempt to pass the ball around the pitch, avoiding tackles by the defending player, until you decide to try and score a goal. Skill and tactic cards are used to boost the attributes of footballers to make them better in these situations.

The winning team is the one that scores the most goals.

The game also incorporates Augmented Reality on the cards
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports

name: LTAG!
description:
If you like linguistics, syntax, or just awesomely offensive party games, this is for you!

From the games' web-site:

LTAG! is an absurd, irreverent card game based on Lexicalized Tree Adjoining Grammar
Compete and co-operate to generate offensive yet grammatical English sentences made of partial syntactic trees.
The first player to use up all of their cards wins!

Every Lexical Card in LTAG! is designed to successfully generate hilarious, deplorable, grammatical sentences by way of substitution, conjunction, adjunction, and more!

name: Ringames Words
description:
Ringames Words is a fun and innovative game of linguistic competence, where vocabulary and visual dexterity are the protagonists. Be the fastest to discover the best combination of letters to form the longest word.

The game is played on a board composed of seven concentric circles. The circles are filled with letters of the alphabet and each letter is on one of two background colours. The circles can all be rotated to help in forming words. Each player in turn has ninety seconds (sixty in the advanced game) to form the largest possible word. Words must be composed of letters with the same background colour that are in a straight line from centre to outside of the board or vice versa, or in the form of a v. Once used a word cannot be repeated for the rest of the game. The roll of a dice may require a player to take an “informative hexagon” with a goal for their turn. If the goal is met, they will score bonus points, if not, their turn is void. Scores range from one point for a four letter word to 50 points for an eleven letter word. The game ends when a player completes their twelfth word. Most points wins.

A note about playing time: it is highly dependent on the number of players and their experience with the game. The estimate of 30 minutes is for a two-player game. With the full complement of eight players, that could rise to 90 minutes.

name: Da geht der Weg!
description:
Roll & Move game with 2 dice, d6 numbered and d6 with coloured arrows;
Objective: Be the first getting out of a board - similar to a labyrinth.
- acting by turns -
All players start at the same space. Move forward according rolled number; ending on a space with arrows use second die to determine diretion to move along.
Otherwise you may decide which way to go.
First Player who escapes successfully wins.

name: Nevermoor
description:
Nevermoor is a tabletop miniature adventure/skirmish game. Players take control of a party of characters and fight through the deadly streets of Nevermoor to save the city from certain doom.
The Miniatures

Nevermoor utilizes 40mm pewter cast miniatures to represent the various characters within the game world. Each miniature is created with a mixture of hand sculpting and 3d modeling to create a true to life scale. Each character is designed by Creative Director, David Tepfer in a variety of poses and varying equipment to give each party (no matter the guild) a unique look. Initial designs, artwork, and sculpt pictures can all be found in the “Guild Models” section of this website.
The Game

Nevermoor is a small scale miniature game. Each party only consists of five models which are divided into one of three party roles: Leader, Striker, or Tank. The small scale nature of the game allows for truly deep character construction. Each character can purchase upgrades throughout the game, gaining new attacks, skill, and equipment. All of this makes a perfectly paced game whose action slowly increases until it reaches its breaking point in the final few turns!
The World

The King of Nevermoor has gone mad! A mythic plague has taken hold of the city and corrupted the minds and bodies of its citizens. The plague is revered as a gift of the gods by the infected and turned these deformed monsters into “holy” zealots. In his madness, the King has sealed off the city to cleanse the uninfected. The city’s remaining guilds have taken to the streets in attempt to liberate the city but the mass hysteria and rioting has turned the city into a war zone.

The tabletop is packed with buildings, winding streets, and claustrophobic alleys. This unique layout makes playing Nevermoor feel like a massive game of cat and mouse. Hidden traps and ambushes are favored to the open fight in Nevermoor; favoring the clever planner over the brute.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Schubse-Peter
description:
Objective:
be the first bringing home your 6 meeples
-moving by turns-
players rolls the die - moving forward during the very first beginning.
later on you may use the die to push your own meeples forward (the more at one space the better) or push back opponents' meeples.

remarks:
published during 1930's

name: Three Squares
description:
Three Squares is a simple dice and chip game for players over the age of six. The game consists of one die with various symbols and groups of three differently colored chips. Each player starts the game with a group of three chips of the same color that are "their chips". The object of the game is to win everyone else's chips. Players accomplish this by rolling the die and following the rules based on what is rolled. The die has three faces that are a simple orange square, one face with a yellow star, one face with the word "right" and one face with the word "left".
Every third square that is rolled during the game give the roller an opportunity to take a chips from someone. Every time a star is rolled the player takes a chip from someone. Rolling right or left changes the direction of play.
If a player loses all three of "their chips" they are out of the game and they must forfeit all of their chips and any others they have won to the player who took their last chip.
The winner is the player who is left with all the chips form all other players.
Setup take 15 seconds. Games typically last 20 minutes or less.

The game is similar to the 1983 dice game LCR.

name: Spass mit Zahlen
description:
The game with "Elektronikrechner" - electronic calculator.

From the publishers description:
Goal: Who can build first an uninterrupted row of tokens on the game board, from start to finish? Who has at the same time brought his end sum by clever choosing numbers near Zero, so he wins the game.
Some tactics for an even more suspenseful game: Instead of cool calculating taking risks: All results change suddenly. Giving bad numbers to the other players. Blocking another players path.
Electronic calculator: With this exciting tactical game the electronic calculator is in high demand. With its help the best solutions can be found, when the best numbers have to be chosen. Also apart from the game You get useful services by the calculator. Effortless You can calculate everything that has to be calculated in every day life. Electronic calculator from Texas Instrumets.

name: I am Providence
description:
I am Providence

1-4 players
Worker placement
Variable player powers (advanced version)

I am Providence, sets the players in Arkham. Mass and its surrounding areas.

Players will place their workers at different locations to gain types of resources that will help fight the terrors that will visit Arkham. You'll collect lore, arcana, and research resources, in addition to gaining the trust of cultists who will help usher in some of the more advanced terrors to Arkham. You must know your enemy and their plans if you wish to defeat them.

The game will have a built in time mechanic that will unleash unspeakable terrors on the town unless the players choose to confront it first.

The eldritch deck will contain 3 levels of terror which will visit the town. Each time the game is played the deck will vary, as a certain number of cards is added to each of the three levels, changing with the number of players.
Example. There are 18 level 1 terrors, in a typical game there will be only 6 in the level 1 deck. When setting up the game players will randomly choose 6 terrors and shuffle them. Ensuring that you'll always have a fresh, exciting game as you never know what horrors may come to town.

Battling an ancient evil one won't always be easy, but will undoubtably increase in difficulty as the game progresses.

When battle commences, a player will flip the top of the eldritch deck and have to have the corresponding resources to defeat the terror.
Defeating the terrors that confront Arkham will earn you valuable Elder signs (victory points) as well as possibly gaining additional resources. Encountering these ancient terrible entities won't be easy on your psyche though, defeating or even just encountering these awful creatures can affect your sanity.

Collect too many insanity cubes and one of your workers will be eliminated from the game and have to check in to Arkham Asylum.

The game progresses through all three levels of the Eldritch deck, culminating with a final battle with an Elder god.

When a player defeats the final Elder God in the deck the game ends and Arkham is temporarily safe. The player who has gained the most Elder Signs will claim victory.

In the advanced game, players will become famous personalities from the Lovecraft Mythos, gaining benefits and even possibly penalties based on the chosen characters.

I am Providence will be deeply rooted in the Lovecraft Mythos, never straying from the original source material. Many authors have continued the work of HP Lovecraft, expanding his Mythos and building a world of terror. We will focus solely on his writing and works for the base game. (Though who knows of we'll see a return to Arkham in expansions).

Artistically, I am Providence will capture the theme and essence of the late 60's and early 70's American International Pictures movie one sheets. The goal is to present I am Providence as a lost movie title in their series of films that were based on the works of Poe, though their films "The Dunwhich Horror', 'The Haunted Palace' and 'Die, Monster, Die' borrowed heavy from Lovecraft.

name: Transformers: Generation One At War
description:
"It is a world transformed, where things are not what they seem. It is a world of heroic Autobots and evil Decepticons. It is the world of, THE TRANSFORMERS!"

Hey guys, John Nemo here. Very excited to be presenting this game to everyone.

Transformers: G1 at war is a free print and play game of heavy metal war on a galactic scale. Miniatures Wargame ruleset. Players have the ability to field a full battle group of transformers, Both Autobot and Decepticon, From Optimus Prime and Megatron, to Bumblebee and Ravage.

The goal of the game is simple: Skirmish level combat. Players move there forces across the map, to fight, move, transform, and do pretty much everything you think of from a Transformer Battle.

The master game, "More than meets the eye", deals mainly with the characters released in the toyline's initial year, 1984.
categories: Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Card Counting: A Strategic Player vs. Player Game
description:
Players place bets on their own game board. Stackem up high, or place smaller bet amounts. Part of the challenge is bringing in a profit that keeps your bankroll growing. Watch out, the person next to you may just overbet the same winning number resulting in you having a smaller payday then what you should have earned. It's just like betting horses. The odds of a card being turned over are determined by the cards you see face up. The payout odds however are determined by the bet value on the winning number.

Bankrupt your rivals before the end of a round, or have the most chips at the end of a round to win the game. It's that simple!

name: Chichen Itza
description:
Introduction
Chichen itza is 2 player abstract tile laying game with a lite Mayan theme.

It is played on the spaces of a 6x6 board with 18 shared numbered tiles.

Object attain the highest score by having the most pyramids in your color along the longest unobstructed golden paths on the board.

Definitions golden paths- are unobstructed lines on the board that run from one side of the board to the other, which are formed when the board is full of pieces. From 1 to 6 such paths will form per game.

Play
One player is red the other blue. Players share 18 domino like tiles that have two pyramids red and blue affixed to one face of the tile.
Tiles are also numbered like so…

First number is Red and the second number is Blue(3,1)(3,2)(3,3)(2,1)(2,2)(2,3)(1,1)(1,2)(1,3)

First number is Blue and the second number is Red(3,1)(3,2)(3,3)(2,1)(2,2)(2,3)(1,1)(1,2)(1,3)

The 6x6 board starts out initially empty.

Next decide who plays first.

Play then alternates.

On your turn, cover two empty connected spaces on the board using one tile piece, while taking care not to leave a single empty space between the other tiles on the board.

The game ends when the board is full.

Scoring
To score a game you simply add up all the numbers on the pyramids in your color that run along either side of the golden paths and only those pyramids that are adjacent to those paths are scored.

Note: some golden vertical and horizontal paths intersect, when this happens some of your pyramids will lie along these intersections in both directions, so do not count them twice when scoring.

The player with the highest score wins.

name: Forces of Evil: Diabolical Demon Promo
description:
The Diabolical Demon preview promo for Forces of Evil provides the following abilities:
Cruelty: Slay any number of your monsters. Receive that number of influence.
Subjugation: When you recruit goblin-kin, receive one additional Goblin Shaman.

name: Crilo Ball Game
description:
Crilo is a dexterity based game for one or more players. it is played by rolling a Crilo ball over Crilo cards to gain points. The Crilo ball resembles a tennis ball, but is covered with a velcro loop texture. The Crilo cards are 15 discs with a velcro patch in the centre, each worth a different amount of points.

The goal is to get as many points as possible by getting the Crilo ball to stick to as many Crilo cards as possible.

name: Pencil & Paper
description:
The IQ game for 2/4 players, to prove your general knowledge is superior to that of the other playes.

Absorbing family game based on the TV series for 2-4 players.
Shaw Taylor as the Quizmaster with Gwynneth Tighe

Equipment: Board with the "Know All" Answer Disc, Spinner and Scoring Chart, 12 Cards (Print A, B, & C). Four Pegs, Four Coloured Counters, Four Identical Question Sheets with five sets of 50 Questions, marked Red, Green, Yellow, Blue and White.

name: Vaquero
description:
Vaquero is played on a 12x12 square grid of circles, divided into four colored quadrants of 6x6 circles each, with the central four circles of those quadrants missing and replaced with the game's logo. Each quadrant has a pattern of numbers 1-10 on its circles starting on its outer corner and also on its inner corner. Each player then has 10 numbered discs, the same colors as the board sections, and several games are described involving placing those pieces on the board and achieving an objective such as moving all the pieces from one numbered set of circles to another.

Like other games from this designer/publisher, Vaquero is an abstract strategy game system branded with a Western theme.

name: Dantes Reise durch die Hölle
description:
Dantes Reise durch die Hölle is based on the first part of Dante Alighieri's Divine Comedy — Inferno. Players start in the dark forest and walk through the circles of hell in order to reach Purgatory. To pass from one circle to the next, players must collect a "coin of clemency" in every circle. To gain these coins, they answer questions and solve tasks. Questions are about the daily life in Dante's Florence, the Middle Ages, and the creatures and sinners that players encounter during their journey. All questions are multiple choice and require no previous knowledge of the Divine Comedy; they can be answered using deduction and working with the other players.

Tasks often require cooperation, e.g., a player has to select a prominent sinner from real life and send him to an appropriate circle while the other players have to guess the circle. Players interact a lot during play, both helping and misleading one another, stealing and donating coins. Players can also use "coins of indulgence" to get favors from other players or "coins of clemency".

The player who collects all "coins of clemency" and passes Lucifer in the last circle wins.

•••

Dantes Reise durch die Hölle basiert auf dem ersten Teil der Göttlichen Komödie von Dante Alighieri, dem Inferno. Die Spieler beginnen im dunklen Wald und durchqueren alle Höllenkreise, um das Fegefeuer zu erreichen.

Um in den nächsten Kreis zu gelangen, sammeln die Spieler in jedem Kreis eine so genannte "Gnadenmünze". Sie beantworten Fragen und lösen Aufgaben, um diese Münzen zu erhalten. Die Fragen drehen sich um das tägliche Leben im Florenz Dantes, das Mittelalter und die Kreaturen und Sünder, die den Spielern auf ihrer Reise begegnen. Alle Fragen sind multiple choice und können durch Kombinationsgabe und Zusammenarbeit mit den anderen Spielern gelöst werden - es sind keine Vorkenntnisse der Göttlichen Komödie nötig. Aufgaben sind oft kooperativer Natur, z. B. muss ein Spieler einen prominenten Sünder auswhählen und in den passenden Höllenkreis verbannen; die anderen Spieler müssen den Kreis erraten. Es gibt viel Interaktion zwischen den Spielern, die sich unterstützen und in die Irre führen, einander bestehlen und beschenken. Es gibt auch ein Handelselement: die Spieler können "Ablassmünzen" einsetzen, um sich die Gunst anderer Spieler oder "Gnadenmünzen" zu sichern.

Der Spieler, der als Erster alle "Gnadenmünzen" gesammelt und Luzifer im letzten Kreis passiert, gewinnt das Spiel.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Trading

name: Kingmakers
description:
Kingmakers is set in 1560 Europe. Five powers struggle for dominance through military power, cultural and scientific prestige, far distant explorations and diplomatic back-stabbing. England, France, Germania, Spain and the Ottoman empire are all equally strong and for the moment they maintain a power balance. However, anything may disrupt this delicate state.

As a player you take the seat as chief advisor to the ruler of one of the five powers. You are the true power behind the throne. Use resources to grow the empire and make cultural progress. Send trusted emissaries and generals to other nations in order to gain influence via diplomatic trickery or military skills. Gather the best captains to explore the New world or the far east. Ally with the minor powers of Europe in order to influence them into aiding you against your enemies. Use the ruler as long as it fits your plans and find a new when they don't. Your next move will change the power balance in Europe. Make your move, but choose your actions carefully.

In brief, the game is played on a large map of Europe. Players take turns using cards for their effect or for action points (AP). With APs they may perform different actions engaging leaders of their power. Each power have a certain number of leaders with different strengths available for use. These leaders may be used as ambassadors acting on your behalf in the courts of Europe, as explorers or colonizers bringing back knowledge and treasures from distant countries, as patrons of the arts or the scientists or as military generals conquering the lands of your enemies. The power who first conquer a defined amount of key spaces in Europe or collects most victory points (VP) after a number of turns wins the game.

Components

1 Game board
108 Strategy cards
36 Conflict cards
50 Character tokens
110 Influence discs
100 Victory point tokens
5 Players screens
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Worker Placement

name: Multi-Metric
description:
Five metric games in one box that stress Main Units of metres, grams and liters. They also provide practice and drill in using the common prefixes and converting within the metric system.

The five games are designed as student-centered activities with are relatively self-checking with the use of Metric Conversion Charts.

The five games are:
- Track-Mete: Convert metric measurements of length.
- Gram-Cram: Convert metric measurements of weight.
- Litre-Land: Convert metric measurements of volume.
- Temperature-Trek: The student will visualize temperature in Celsius by matching temperature cards and picture cards.
- Multi-Metric
Players use plastic pawns to move around the game-board based on the results of the spinner, encountering questions.

name: King-High
description:
The game is played with 4 marbles on a circular playing board with 28 indentations and 5 different circles of value: 20, 40, 60, 80 and in the middle - 100 points (without indentation).

The idea of the game is very simple, each player in turn places a marble onto one of the 4 platforms on the playing board ("Prince", "General", "Captain" and Kitchen Cop") and rolls the marble (4 marbles in a turn/round). The player earns the points on the ring where the marble stops.

The player with the most points after 10 rounds wins the game.

name: Trickery The Game
description:
Object

Cards and dice mayhem! Be the player with the highest Point Total at the end of the game. Lord your victory over your opponent. Laugh cruelly.

Set Up

Trickery requires six green 6-sided dice, two non-green 6-sided dice and a Trickery Card Deck.

Six green 6-sided dice = Rolling Dice
Two non-green 6-sided dice = Dueling/Bonus Dice

Each player uses a pencil and paper to keep track of scores and Point Totals.

One player will be the official Scorekeeper. He or she will add scores to each player’s Point Total as they are awarded.

Overview

Players take turns rolling the green dice, trying to throw Scoring Combos (See “Scoring Combos”).

Scoring Combos earn Trickery Cards (See “Trickery Cards”), and rack up scores that players can attempt to add to their Point Totals.

Players protect themselves and disrupt their opponents with a host of offensive and defensive Trickery Cards.

The first player to break 5000 points goes ‘Out’ and the game enters the Endgame Round.

During the Endgame Round the remaining players each have one final turn to try and go ‘Out’ with the highest Point Total.

‘Out’ players and their Point Totals cannot be targeted by Trickery Cards.

The player with the highest Point Total at the end is declared The Winner!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That

name: Hybrid
description:
Hybrid is a gladiator game that uses 60 mm miniatures. Each player create a warrior by determining it's stats and equipping it. The miniatures are made out of plastic and use a system of magnets and hooks to make it possible to change armor and equipment between battles. This is also used to keep track of potions used during the game.

During the game each player starts with a pool of six d6 called Action Dice, these are then used to perform actions. To succeed with an action the player has to roll higher or equivalent to a roll requirement specified by either the nature of the action or by the equipment used in the action.

name: Das kleine Fussballquiz
description:
Game description from the publisher:

The small quiz line of HUCH! & friends gets sporty! Das kleine Fußballquiz is a small trivia game about soccer with 100 questions and answers. The game itself is like a notebook (with spiral binding). Each page contains 2 questions and 4 possible answers; the back side contains the correct answers with additional information.

name: Power Rangers Megaforce: Mega Battles Game
description:
This is Gosei; I’m a mentor to Zordon. I’ve been in a deep sleep for thousands of years and have awakened because a great evil has now emerged and coming! The evil Insectoids are coming to conquer Earth – it up to you Power Rangers to defeat this great evil.
Admiral Malkor, leader of the Insectoids and his two henchmen Vrak and Creepox have hidden your Power Cards. You must find them Rangers in order to defeat their army of evil Insectoids to save earth!

Starting the Game
Choose one of the five Megaforce Rangers or Robo Knight Character pawns. Place it in Gosei Command Center Space in center of the game board.
Shuffle the Villain Power Levels up and place the Villains in the pawn holders. Place each evil Insectoid Villain in their Battle Space on the board, matching the Villain pawn with picture on the board.
Shuffle and place a Power Card face down next to each of the Villain Battle Spaces.

Game Turn Summary
Roll the die and move your pawn the number of spaces shown on the game board. You may not land on the same space twice during your turn. Players may share spaces on the board, but not Battle Spaces.
Objective of the game is to defeat the evil Insectoids to obtain your Power Cards to win the game.
Under each of the Insectoid’s pawn is a number. When you move your pawn on to this space secretly look under see the Villain Power Level. Roll the die; if number rolled is higher than Villain Power Level you win the battle! Take the Power Card (if able).

Go Go Megaforce!
categories: Children's Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Variant Souls
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Variant Souls is a secret-teams-based competitive narrative game. Each player takes on the role of a champion for his world, knowing that a parallel and similarly powered champion exists on the enemy side. Use your skills and synchronize with your teammates to gain the upper hand, then crush your opposition underfoot.

Variant Souls is not a traditional storytelling game. You will not act out your character's actions; you will not need to adhere to any in-game moral code or class restrictions; and you will not need to keep your out-of-game knowledge separate from your in-game knowledge. There are no stats, no calculations, and no complex sets of dice to roll.

In the game, you play as a group hunting down legendary artifacts of power, searching for the one artifact that will give you the leverage to help your world win. Conflict is quick and brutal, so pre-planning, information, and teamwork are critical to victory.

name: What Would Who? Do?
description:
The party game What Would Who? Do? takes the familiar "What what Jesus do?" question and opens it up to every person ever, whether fictional or real.

The game consists of large Who? cards and small Duh cards; players need to supply a 20-sided die and 6-sided die for each player. On a turn, the active player flips a Who? card to reveal a sentence with a blank subject – e.g., "What would _______ do if an asteroid were spotted on a collision course with Earth?" – and six choices. The player chooses any person – alive or dead, real or make-believe, famous or known only to players – and inserts that name in the sentence. (If the active player takes too long or can't think of anyone known to all, he draws a Duh card, and uses the person on that card in the sentence.) Each player then uses his 6-sided die to secretly indicate a choice, with all of the non-active players trying to think how the active player will answer the question.

Players then reveal their answers. If no one matches the active player, no one scores points; if everyone matches, then everyone but the active player scores 2 points; if some number in between match, the correct guessers score 2 points while the active player scores 1 point for each correct guess.

Players use their 20-sided die to track their score, and the first player to reach 20 points wins!

name: Antillia and the Lost Cities of Gold
description:
Based on Spanish legends of a mythical island lost to time, Antillia and the Lost Cities of Gold puts you in control of Dr. Jack Parker – the legendary archaeologist, and his team as they venture out in search of the fabled home to the seven lost cities of gold.

Crash-landing in the deep jungles of a land overrun by vile monsters and dark magic, you and your friends must fight your way through the island’s events, collecting loot and forming alliances in an effort to escape with as much gold as you can carry.

Players will explore an unique hexagonal tile-system map as they negotiate Antillia’s many challenges and collect ancient treasures to aid them on their quest. As you progress through the game, your fate will be determined by your strategy and dice rolls; this combined with a random map creation element guarantees that no two playthroughs will ever be the same.

Players will choose one of six pre-made characters, all of which come equipped with innate abilities that will aid them on their journey. Characters are represented by their respective token on the board, and their Character Card, which will track their points, items and power-ups.

Having chosen their characters, players set off in exploration of the island to discover its hidden secrets by creating and exploring the map as the turns progress. The starting map tile is placed first with each character token on the tile. At the beginning of each player’s turns, he/she picks up and places a map tile into play, and places a special markers called an Event or Loot Tokens if the tile requests.

Events are then triggered when a player moves onto a space with an event token by drawing the appropriate number of cards from the corresponding deck, and then continues their turn as normal.

Antillia’s Event and Loot card decks will be comprised of over 170 beautifully illustrated cards.

As the game progresses, players will accumulate gold and items for defeating the many monsters and challenges on the island. Items retained in the players’ inventory spaces will each have an intrinsic gold value of bullion coin that adds to your final score. Keep in mind, other players may try to obtain your gold or loot by any means possible. Keep a sharp eye out for thieves and backstabbers.

Combat is turn based and the attack order is decided by the highest AP score when an attack is declared; attack power is determined by dice roll damage indicated by the player’s equipped weapon.

Upon vanquishing the game’s boss, a portal opens allowing all players the chance to escape the island. Those who manage to escape Antillia add up their total gold and item value by counting all gold coins earned and item value in their extended inventory. The player at the end of the game able to escape the island with the most gold value wins!

name: Laf En Flink Tijdens Hinkepink
description:
A Dutch game about the occupation of the Netherlands during World War II. The game is based on the Game of Goose.

Each player starts with four chips.
Players take turns to roll the dice and move their tokens according to the total of the dice. Landing on certain spaces could mean advancing the token further up the path, losing turns, or going back to the starting point. Along their way players can earn or lose chips.
The first player arriving on space with the dates 10 may 1940 - 05 may 1945 wins the game.

name: C'est la Guerre: Fast Play Wargame for the Age of Muskets
description:
C'est la Guerre is an adaptation of the popular De Bellis Antiquitatis (DBA) rules to the "horse and musket" era (i.e., early 18th century through the Napoleonic era).

There are several adaptations of DBA which have been made for the horse and musket period. Unlike DBA, armies are not limited to a fixed number of units (e.g., 12), instead using point values to construct approximately balanced forces of varying size. Generals and sub-generals are rated on their ability, resulting in larger command radii for more capable generals. For a single command "pip", a general is able to order all units, lines and columns within his command radius. Combat is different than DBA in that units may be disordered and take casualties resulting in degraded performance until they can rally or reform.
categories: Age of Reason, American Indian Wars, American Revolutionary War, Book, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Torontoopoly: A Cityopoly Game
description: "An entrepreneurial business and trading game". Monopoly clone for the city of Toronto,ON, Canada, where one builds not houses and hotels, but "branch offices" and "skyscrapers".
mechanics: Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Advantage Cricket
description: Advantage Cricket was a free print-and-play sports game by designer Adam Porter. It is no longer available.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Real-time, Sports
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Advantage Baseball
description: Advantage Baseball was a card-game made available for print and play in 2013 by designer Adam Porter. The game is no longer available.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Real-time, Sports
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Champions Challenge
description:
Champions Challenge

INTRO:
The time has come once again. A chance for the divided clans of Rivaland to prove who is
mightiest. Each clan will send forth their greatest warrior to compete in the Champions Challenge.
The victor will be rewarded greatly as well as claim the title of the mightiest clan throughout
Rivaland. That is of course, if there is a victor at all. Known only to the King and his closest
trustees, the Challenge is actually a real threat against the kingdom. Thus meaning it will place the
Champions in real danger. They must face deadly monsters, tricky traps, and even the threat of
each other. However, they may be forced to work together if they wish to survive.

GAMEPLAY:
The game starts by choosing the Challenge. Each challenge is played on a different Location tile
and a deck of cards with unique monsters, traps, events, and Boss Monster. Next the players choose
their Champions. There are four clans to choose from with a male and female version of each.
The Champions have unique attributes which make playing each one a bit different. On a turn,
each player has 3 Action points to spend. Actions include recovering, exploring, attacking,
making skill checks, and commanding a pet! While exploring, they will earn Challenge points for
defeating monsters and escaping traps. Each Challenge has a few events that must occur before the
Boss shows up. This can happen at anytime during the game and players might not always be ready!
Players will find powerful treasures like weapons, shields, and talismans that will make them more
powerful. Collecting as many challenge points as possible before the Challenge is completed is the
primary goal, next to surviving of course!

Clans of Rivaland:

Slayers
Shaman
Marksman
Machinist
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Math Magic
description: This game compendium uses a specialty deck of 108 cards. Each card contains two numbers and a geometric figure. Each game is designed to teach players the concepts of operations and shapes. The game comes with a booklet of twenty seven games.

name: Conflict Busters
description: This cooperative game teaches peaceful conflict resolution techniques and anger management skills. Players work together to journey to Saturn. The journey is represented by a puzzle that must be assembled in the center of the board. Players earn puzzle pieces by answering questions about conflict resolution and complete their “mission” when they have completed the puzzle. The game includes many examples of conflicts that could occur on a space voyage. Players pick questions from three decks of cards. There are two age-appropriate levels of "You Decide" cards.

name: Willkommen auf Allofall
description:
In Willkommen auf Allofall ("Welcome to Allofall"), up to four stranded space travelers try their luck escaping the horrors of the planet "Allofall", either in a cooperative or competitive version as the players prefer.

The aim of the game is simple: Board on your miniature mining vehicle, the "Rollator MK-V", leave the ship, and get to the landing point of your shuttle on the opposite side of the game board before it leaves again. On your way to the shuttle, you'll have to struggle through deserts, jungle and mountains, with your only equipment being some mining tools and a handful of food and water. You'll become acquainted with Allofall's fauna and flora, and you'll encounter friendly (more or less) aliens who either are going about doing their normal every day business or are struggling to survive on this planet themselves (and are therefore a bit resentful). Whether you fight, avoid, or fool them in order to get past them depends on you, your equipment, and their values of strength, frustration and intelligence.

•••
In Willkommen auf Allofall können bis zu vier Spieler gleichzeitig entweder mit- oder gegeneinander ihr Glück versuchen. Das Spielziel ist simpel: Erreicht mit einem Rollator (ein Bergbaufahrsystem auf Raupenketten) das rettende Shuttle, das irgendwo am anderen Ende der Karte versteckt liegt.

Auf dem Weg dahin müsst ihr euch durch karge Wüsten, dichten Dschungel und hohe Berge schlagen, mit nicht mehr als etwas Bergbauausrüstung und einer Hand voll Nahrung und Wasser. Auf dem Weg werdet ihr die heimische Fauna und Flora entdecken und auf mal mehr, mal weniger wohlgesonnene Aliens treffen, die hier auch tragisch gestrandet sind.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Fortune Tellers
description:
A game where you predict the future!
Combine action cards with player cards to make a prediction, lay it face down on the table next to you. Turn it over when it comes true, and score!

Two games are taking place at once. A guessing game where you want to predict what the other players are doing, and a worker placement game where you send your assistants to get money, more actions to predict and even more assistants.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Worker Placement

name: Spin-O
description:
Simple game in which players spin a top and attempt to hit tiny balls into the scoring area.

Each player, in turn, spins the top in the circle in the center of the box, attempting to spin so as to keep the top going as long as possible. While the top is spinning the player will drop the six colored wooden balls through the hole in the platform so that they may roll down the sides of the platform and strike the spinning top. The balls will bounce off the top in a lively manner and will fall into holes thus scoring.

If the top jumps out of the center the SCORE DOES NOT COUNT. The player loses his opportunity to score during that play. Try to spin the top so as to keep it spinning, and keep it in the center circle. A grand total score of 3000 points wins.

name: The Artifact (Project)
description:
The Artifact is a game for 2-5 players where betraying your friends and stealing from them is as important as discovering resources and exploring the cosmos.

The Artifact uses an innovative map dynamic which means every game is unique and different.
Set in the far-future and featuring startling artwork, over 100 cards, exotic locations and constantly evolving play, The Artifact is a game like no other.
Win by strategy, tactics or blind luck!

Players can choose from 8 different factions, each with their own ideology, abilities and agenda.
Everyone starts from Earth and plays location cards to build the game board and open exploration. This gets larger and more expansive every turn!
Moving around the universe, players attempt to capture Artifact Markers from different locations such as planets, derelict ships, spaceports, even Alien colonies! All the while hamstringing other players!
Using events, items, special abilities and fuel, players can fight, steal, strand or even send players in the wrong direction, all to achieve the ultimate goal; gain 4 Artifact Markers and begin the Race for the Artifact!
categories: Card Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Doctor Who: Facts & Trivia Quiz Game
description:
Amazing spinning TARDIS answer mechanism!

The Doctor is terribly clever and quick-witted - he always seems to know the correct answers, so how much do you know about Doctor Who facts and trivia? Think you can beat him?

In this fun facts and trivia question and answer quiz game, test you and your friends' knowledge about Doctor Who and learn all about this excited TV show. Turn and point the TARDIS to a question and as if by magic it will spin around and show you the correct answer.

name: Alien Assemblage
description:
In this upcoming card game based on the old dice game Beetle, you draw and play cards and hope to create an entire alien before something horrible happens.

Players have a hand of 5 cards from a deck of 108 that contains body parts, as well as actions. Draw a card from the deck, then play a card.

You can add a body part to your alien - you need to collect a body, a head, two antenna, two arms, two wings, two legs and a tail - or you can play a card that affects an opponent by stealing one of their body parts or one of their cards.

Watch out for the red cards - these must be played immediately and could wipe out your hand. And there's one card in the deck that destroys your entire alien!

name: Tar Heel Basketball Trivia
description: A variant of Trivial Pursuit where the questions are exclusively about the UNC Chapel Hill basketball team, during the Dean Smith era. Instead of collecting pie wedges, you collect rings, which you place around your Old Well playing piece. Categories are broken down by time period, general questions about UNC Basketball history, and questions about the coaching staff. Players win by collecting rings in all colors, and then moving to the picture of Dean Smith and answering one final question about the staff.

name: That's Beez Wax
description:
(from DriveThruCards)

Are you sure that you can trust your friends and family? Perhaps it’s time to put them to the test. That’s Beez Wax challenges a person’s integrity as well as their ability to cover up a lie. Player’s take turns laying cards face down in sequential order in an effort to empty their hand. Those caught lying will get buried by “The Hive.” Those falsely accused will experience sweet redemption. The player who avoids the “Stinger” and tastes the sweet nectar of victory will be forever known as King or Queen Bee.

Once a player has won a round, all other players must add up the point values of the cards remaining in their hands.

The player with the lowest score after 5 rounds wins the game.

name: Trip Hopeful Board Game
description:
"Trip Hopeful" is singleplayer board game based on the indie game from PC, "Organ Trail Director's Cut". It is a experience roleplay. The random will decide the fate of your character (with a dice). The game consist of twenty cards of event, the table-score and map (U.S. map).

You will cross the United States to find a safe settlement for win. You'll go from point to point until the end. On each dice roll will advance through these points. There will be large and small roads that will consume different amounts of gasoline and battery. There are also radioactive areas in which you can lose health. Depending on your tierada you can find places you can get a supplies as ammunition or medicines. On your way you will meet shortcuts by which you can cross but all depends on your luck with the dice. You'll dincount or count point while advance.

The game is available in Spanish and English. And soon, I'll make expansions with more maps and event cards (maybe multiplayer)

Most importantly, the game is complete and all the rules for the two language

name: Dewey's Victory: Never Beaten
description: Parker Brothers' strategy board game, "Dewey's Victory: Never Beaten" carries a bold box cover graphic showing Admiral Dewey himself. The game doubtless appealed to boys who idolized Dewey after his famous naval victory at Manila Bay during the Philippine War, in 1900.

name: Hoeren. Spielen. Radio.
description:
A promotion game by Radio Cologne (Germany). The title means listening, gaming, radio.

The game is played on a board that resembles the city map of Cologne. Players move by rolling a "pyramid die" (pyramid shaped die, each side has 3 numbers on it, the number on the bottommost side counts). Each player gets a mission card like "do cover news at site x", must move there, and gets a new one after fulfilling it. After 5 mission cards are completed a player can move back to home base. The first one completing 5 missions and returning to base is the winner.

The game board also contains yellow "program fields" where players must draw a program card and answer questions about Radio Colognes programs. If answered correctly they get a reward, if incorrectly a punishment like 1 step back. Red "chance fields" means a chance card has to be drawn and this means maybe a free turn etc.
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Lord of the Realm
description:
"Be thou Sire or Slave?"

Lord of the Realm is a fast paced Trading-Building-Conquest collectible card game that challenges your negotiation, tactics and building strategy.
You are a noble vying for domination of the Forests, Plains and Mountains with other nobles, in the fantasy realm of Everon.

You win by building up your land, getting rich by making metal, getting victory points by upgrading your buildings or by sending units to capture another’s buildings. Only the richest or strongest will become Lord of the Realm.

How to win by Victory points:
You can win upgrading most basic buildings to advanced buildings with a V symbol (victory points). You need only 5 to win, but they can be captured if not defended!

How to win by making metal:
Buildings that produce metal (coin). You need 9 coins to win. Again, if not defended these can be captured together with all the metal in them!

How to win by conquest:
Build defences and buildings that can recruit the Men, Elves and Dwarves that populate the realm. You can upgrade these troops with metal via a blacksmith or armoury!

name: Amoebelli
description:
Amoebelli is played by two, each player having six stones of black or white, on a board made of staggered alternating rows of five or six squares. (There are five rows of six squares with four rows of five squares sandwiched between them so that each square in the short rows shares a border with two squares in the adjoining long rows.) Twelve central squares are highlighted, six each in two colors; these are the starting zones for each player.

Players begin by placing their stones in the starting squares, then take turns moving and capturing each other's pieces. Pieces jump in any of six directions to an open space opposite the jumped piece, and jumps may continue in a string if more jumps are possible. Jumped pieces are removed and then added again to the board at the end of the turn, in any open square adjacent to the piece that was used to jump them. If there are no open spaces, the pieces are removed from the game permanently.

The game is lost if a player fails to have one of his own pieces on one of his starting squares at the end of his turn, or if a player finds he has no available moves.

name: Duel
description:
Duel, is a french set of miniature tactical (1 miniature represents 1 man) skirmish rules.

The game uses a creation system similar to roleplaying games as each fighter is created individually with such characteristics as strength, stamina and agility and indivual equipment.

The combat system is based on movement programming and simultaneous resolution of actions.

The rules booklet contains historical lists of units that goes from ancient times to renaissance and cover civilisations from all continents.
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Parollette
description: Parollette is a dice rolling game consisting of a dice cup, 10 traditional six-sided dice, a wood and felt dice tray for rolling, and a peg board for keeping score. Rules include four games: Lo Score, Hi Score, Parrollette, and Bottoms Up. Players roll dice to determine score and adjust pegs to record it; game is won or lost based on that variation's scoring objective.

name: Threat Level Red
description:
"The year is 2027 and the federal government of the United States, hobbled by the second great depression, is on the edge of collapse. A number of Insurgent factions have sprung up hoping to undermine the government and send the country into a state of anarchy, in the belief they stand to gain power or wealth in the coming lawlessness.

Choose your side: Become one of three insurgent factions bent on sowing chaos by launching ever greater terror events, or make one last stand on behalf of the United States. If you can stand firm and keep this country from descending into anarchy you will restore the people's faith in its government and keep the American dream alive."

Threat Level Red is a game for 4 players where three players play the role of insurgent factions attacking from within the united states, and one player takes on the role of the hobbled, fading federal government.

As an insurgent faction your goal is to increase the anarchy level in the US to 20 by launching insurgent events. Each turn begins with a hidden token deployment phase where you must secretly plant sleeper cell and insurgent event tokens in major cities across the country. Once all the insurgent player's plans are set players then take turns revealing one secret token at time. Each sleeper cell token you activate increases the action points available to you to play your event cards, but also gives the US player more information about where you are planning your next event. Do you carry out small safer operations to draw additional event cards, cell tokens, and earn resources, or do you try to go all out and launch a major, but risky offensive by playing one of your major event cards? Once your organization has grown strong enough anything is possible- from a simple bomb threat, to hacking the nation's closed circuit TV network, or for the most powerful and violent factions building the dreaded suitcase nuke, but if the american player can deduce where your next event is taking place you stand to lose everything.

As the government player you seek to foil as many insurgent events as possible. If you can foil 12 insurgent events, or survive 5 game turns without the anarchy level rising to 20 points you are victorious. Unfortunately you are understaffed and nearly out of resources to face the burgeoning threats facing the nation. You begin the game with a small number of agent units that you must allocate between the major geographic "zones" of the united states. At the start of each turn you gain a small number of reinforcements: additional agent units and counterplot cards. Your counterplot cards will let you set up wiretaps, border patrols, undercover agents. Each time it is your turn you may send up to one agent token per "zone" to investigate a face down enemy token. If you correctly select a location of an insurgent event that event is discarded and you gain 1 stability point, but if the hidden token you reveal turns out to be an enemy sleeper cell the agent will most likely be lost in the ensuing gunfight. Since you have far fewer agents then your enemies have sleeper cells if you were to send your agents in to investigate every hint of insurgent activity you would soon be out of agents and quickly overrun. So instead, watch closely, let the insurgents overextend, give them enough rope to hang themselves before making your move. If you wait too long you risk letting another terror attack slip through your fingers, but if you strike at the right time even a small handful of well-trained agents can topple these immense terror networks.
mechanics: Action Queue, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Botchee Deluxe
description:
Botchee Deluxe is a dice game where players will be attempting to create specific number patterns using one of six different modes of game play. The dice are sometimes rolled and sometimes simply used to represent a player's number. The game comes with two different plastic grids that the dice site in, allowing for customizable play and shifting of game difficulty. Most of the games play much like Suduko, with number patterns being required across rows and columns. But some of the games also allow for speed play and solo play. The entire game fits in a small plastic case, making it an easy travel game.

A few examples of the game modes of play include:

o Region: This game mode uses columns and rows in the game frame. A row and a column region extends from one side of the game frame to the other. A box region can only be located in one of the game frame corners. Players take turns selecting one of the dice and placing it in the game frame. The goal is to be the first player to complete a number sequence using one of the 3 regions.

o Speed: This game mode is all about solving the same Sudoku like puzzle using the Region play mode as quickly as possible. A stopwatch or other timekeeping device is necessary to play this game mode. The winner is the player with the best time.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Math, Number, Puzzle

name: Sailor Moon: Quest of the Guardian Card Game
description:
"The Sailor Scouts, along with the Guardians, have banded together to battle the forces of the Negaverse! Be the first Sailor Scout to send the most "Enemies" back to the Negaverse and win the game."

A children's card game where the objective is to collect "Negaverse" cards by players turning the top card of their deck over and saying the name of the character on the card out loud if there are any matching cards revealed.

There are two types of cards: Negaverse and Sailor Scout Cards. The cards are separated into decks of their type; the Sailor Scout cards which include the Sailor Scout character cards, Luna cards and Artemis cards are shuffled and distributed to every player evenly. The Negaverse Cards (back of cards are labeled "Negaverse") are kept face down in a separate pile.

Players would then countdown to reveal the top card of their deck. When a player correctly names the matching cards that are revealed, the player obtains a Negaverse card from the pile. If special "Luna" or "Artemis" cards are revealed it enables the player to make card trades with another player. Play continues until all Negaverse cards are claimed and the player with the greatest number of Negaverse cards is the winner.

name: The 8th Day
description:
The last remnants of Humanity fight a desperate resistance against an Alien invasion that has taken over Earth. A board game for 2-7 players pits a group of up to 6 marines against an enemy player who controls the Aliens. Featuring mission based play, a modular board, a campaign based skill and equipment system, and variable enemy selection that gives a new game experience every time you play.

Players alternate turns between the Marines and the Alien commander. During a Marines turn they choose between moving, firing weapons, using skills, activating Psionic or Tech powers, and destroying nearby enemy spawn locations. In between each marines players turn the Alien Commander activates a number of his Aliens based upon they type of Spawn Points he purchased at the start of the game.

Aliens vary from the melee centric but hard hitting powerhouses of the Pharid, to the robotic utilitarian legions, and finally Alien commandos sent in to personally deal with the Marine resistance.

Marine player pick from a variety of 10 total Marine Classifications ranging from the Short range centric Assault Marine and Long range specialist the Sniper to the Drone controlling Engineer and the offensive Assault Psion.

At the end of each mission the Marines pull from a requisition deck to outfit themselves with new equipment and draw from skill decks to increase the effectiveness of their Marines. These skills and new toys have a cost, they increase the Rank value of the overall Marine and contribute to the pool of Rank Points that the Alien Commander uses to purchase Alien Spawn Points to use against the Marine on their next mission.
categories: Dice, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Big Deal Card Games
description:
A boxed set of six card games:

Bang! Zoom!

Players start with six cards each, which are used to spell words. The first person to spell BANG gets a 10 point bonus. Once this occurs, when someone spells ZOOM, they get a 10 point bonus and the game ends. Points are scored for each letter used in words. The winner is the player with the most points.

Hooey

You’ve got to be sharp. You’ve got to be shifty. Announce which cards you’re laying face down. Whether you tell the truth is up to you. Any player can then question your honesty. If they’re right - you get the pile, if they’re wrong - they do! First player to get rid of all their cards wins.

Rats!

Kid's game of pure luck. Cards are dealt face down to all players. Turn up cards in rotation and put them in the center; if you turn up a Big Fat Rat (rather than a Random Rat), you get all the cards in the center, unless the next player can also turn up a BFR. Object is to collect all the cards.

Royal Fluster

Players are dealt five cards from a modified standard deck and attempt to put together a Royal Flush by drawing and discarding cards. If you discard an Ace, you must draw a Fluster card and follow the instructions, hoping not to be harmed. The first player to make a royal flush wins the game.

Spit!

Each player deals 4 stacks with 7 down and the 8th card up. Play with only one hand (right, unless left-handed). At the same time, all players turn one card from the remaining deck face up in the center to start N piles. All may add to any pile. Ignore suits and colors. Build up or down, and change directions if you want: 5-6-7-6-7-6-7-8-9, etc. Numbers make a complete circle: 10-J-Q-K-A-2-3-4. Play only one card at a time from the top of of a stack onto a center pile; do not move cards sideways to create sequences on own stacks. Keep playing until ALL have used all their card piles.

Three Throws

This game has a theme of rock-scissors-paper. It is played in two different rounds. In the first round, players take turns turning up cards on a face-down tableau. If they turn up a set of winners, these cards are taken into hand. When all of the card possible are taken, the second round begins, which is essentially a game of war between players.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Word Game
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Recognition, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Powerhouses of Wrestling!
description:
Powerhouses of Wresting! is a two-player dice game. Players take turns rolling five dice to get matching numbers (with 1s and 2s matching each other and 6s being wild). After each roll a player can decide to stop or re-roll unmatched dice, with a failure on the new roll costing a matching die.

There are a few additional rules, e.g. getting all the dice to match allows a player to go "over the top" and start over with more dice.

The rules were originally printed and distributed as "shareware." They are currently available online.

name: Triple Triplo
description:
Each player has 3 pawns of the same color. The first player to group together all 3 of his/her pawns is the winner.

Players first play turns in which they place their pawns on the board; each pawn of a single player has to be on a differently colored board space. Players then in turn move one of their 3 pawns.

There's also single a 'neutral piece' that all players get to move once during their turn.

name: Golden Pyramids
description:
Golden Pyramids is a boardgame in which players go exploring an ancient pyramid in search of treasure.

The inside of the pyramid is explored as the players go adventuring from room to room. Players will have to find their way around by placing ladders, moving mummies around, collecting keys and opening doors.

At times, all players will need to cooperate in order to get deeper into the pyramid. But when there's treasure in sight, it's every adventurer for him or herself!

Each player has two explorers with which to search through the pyramid. The main goal is of course the Kings Chamber and the treasure within it. Be warned though: the moment the Kings Chamber is discovered, the spirit of the Pharaoh will descend from the heavens in order to keep the explorers from escaping with his riches. Now the race for the exit is on as all that are still inside the pyramid will be trapped forever once the Pharaoh's spirit seals the pyramid shut!

name: El Juego de la Cultura
description:
Trivia game in which the players have to answer questions about occidental culture: History, Literature, Art, Music, Philosophy and Science.

El Juego de la Cultura (The Game of Culture) contains a board, six pawns, a die and 600 cards with questions, answers and explanations. The boardgame is sold together with the book "La cultura: todo lo que hay que saber" (The Culture: Everything you need to know or Bildung: Alles was man wissen muß in the original Edition in German) by Dietrich Schwanitz. The original edition of both the game and the book is German.

This is a very simple and old-fashioned "Roll&Move" trivia game.

The players roll the die, move the pawn and answer questions about occidental culture. The topic (History, Literature, Art, Music, Philosophy and Science) is determined by the color of the space that the pawn has moved on. The player has to choose between three possible answers. For example:
- Who is the author of "The portrait of Dorian Gray": (A) William Faulkner, (B) Charles Dickens or (C) Oscar Wilde.

The answer to the question can be found in the back of the card. There are a few spaces in the track with special rules, such as the player loses a turn (jail) or go back to Start (sarcophagus).

The first player that reaches the end of the track and responds correctly a question on a topic chosen by the other players wins.

The answer to all the questions can be also found in the accompanying book "La cultura: todo lo que hay que saber" (The Culture: Everything you need to know or Bildung: Alles was man wissen muß in the original Edition in German) by Dietrich Schwanitz.

name: Eine Reise durch das Märchenland
description:
Objective: be the first reaching finish space (field 24) -
learn more about fairy tales
- moving by turns/'Roll & Move' game
each player rolls the die & moves; ending on any space ==> follow instructions printed on lid inside
remarks:
published early 1950's

name: Der Grosse Western Treck
description:
Der Grosse Western Treck is a roll-and-move game, where players attempt to be the first to reach the target space. Each turn, a player rolls the die and moves that many spaces forward. If he ends on a special space, some event occurs.

Produced by Ravensburger.
categories: American West, Children's Game, Dice, Racing

name: Ahoi Saale abwärts!
description:
Ahoi Saale abwärts! is a roll-and-move game, where players attempt collect the most points before reaching the Elbe river. Each turn, a player rolls the die and moves that many spaces forward. If he ends on a special space, some event occurs. If he ends on a (red) victory point space, he collects one victory point.

Produced by Ravensburger; published during 1950's.
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Galaxy
description:
Galaxy is an 'Invent your own game' game by Fred Horn. It's a 100-card deck of custom playing cards with which you can design your own game.

The deck consists of the following:

- 2 'saturn cards'
- 2 'comet cards'
- 6 sets of 16 cards (96 total). Each of these cards show a combinations of 2 numbers in 2 different colors.

The colors used are red, white, yellow and blue and each has a different celestial body associated with it. Red is Mars, white is the moon, yellow is the sun and blue is the earth.

The combinations used are the following:
white and yellow
white and blue
white and red
blue and red
red and yellow
yellow and blue

Each set of 16 cards is made up of the following (matrix):
- 4 cards showing the sequence: 1/1 - 1/2 - 1/3 - 1/4
- 4 cards showing the sequence: 2/1 - 2/2 - 2/3 - 2/4
- 4 cards showing the sequence: 3/1 - 3/2 - 3/3 - 3/4
- 4 cards showing the sequence: 4/1 - 4/2 - 4/3 - 4/4
with the digits to the left of the slash always being the same color. The digits to the right of the slash as also all in the same color, but always a different color than the digit on the left (see the color combinstion mentioned earlier).

Besides these 100 cards there are also 9 white/blank cards as well as a card showing some details about the game and its designer.

name: Mechanik: Lernquiz Physik
description:
Mechanics - Physics learning trivia.

With this trivia game students can test how well they have mastered the basic knowledge on the topic and how far they have understood the key concepts of this area of physics.
For each task there are four answers to choose from - but only one is correct. Which answer is correct (and why), is shown on the backside of the card. Each player plays one of the four answer card: A,B,C or D, and all players reveal these simultanously. Then the trivia card is turned around as well to check the correct answer. Each correct answer scores a point. Player with the most points after the deck is exhausted is the winner.

name: Stoffeigenschaften: Lernquiz Chemie
description:
Material properties - Chemistry lerning trivia.

With this trivia game students can test how well they have mastered the basic knowledge on the topic and how far they have understood the key concepts of this area of chemistry.
For each task there are four answers to choose from - but only one is correct. Which answer is correct (and why), is shown on the backside of the card. Each player plays one of the four answer card: A,B,C or D and all players reveal these simultanously. Then the trivia card is turned around as well to check the correct answer. Each correct answer scores a point. Player with the most points after the deck is exhausted is the winner.

name: Der Mensch: Stoffwechsel & Körperbau – Lernquiz Biologie
description:
Human: Metabolism & Body - Biology lerning trivia.

With this trivia game students can test how well they have mastered the basic knowledge on the topic and how far they have understood the key concepts of this area of biology.
For each task there are four answers to choose from - but only one is correct. Which answer is correct (and why), is shown on the backside of the card. Each player plays one of the four answer card: A,B,C or D and all players reveal these simultanously. Then the trivia card is turned around as well to check the correct answer. Each correct answer scores a point. Player with the most points after the deck is exhausted is the winner.

name: Der Mensch: Nerven, Hormone und Fortpflanzung – Lernquiz Biologie
description:
Human: nerves, hormones and reproduction - Biology lerning trivia.

With this trivia game students can test how well they have mastered the basic knowledge on the topic and how far they have understood the key concepts of this area of biology.
For each task there are four answers to choose from - but only one is correct. Which answer is correct (and why), is shown on the backside of the card. Each player plays one of the four answer card: A,B,C or D, and all players reveal these simultanously. Then the trivia card is turned around as well to check the correct answer. Each correct answer scores a point. Player with the most points after the deck is exhausted is the winner.

name: Tennis Cards
description: Tennis Cards emulates a game of tennis, with players taking it in turns to select shots from their hand in an attempt to win the point. Each player has only a limited number of cards per game and so must be careful to balance staying in a rally with card conservation.

name: Thick as Thieves
description:
'Thick as Thieves' is a cooperative board game based on the idea that all players are working together to steal an item from a well guarded museum. You’ll have to work together to infiltrate the system, sneak past guards, and get past the alarms and locked doors. Be careful though, there isn't always honor amongst thieves. At any time, if the opportunity presents itself, a player may choose to betray everyone and steal a secondary item they've been eye-balling since before the heist even started!

Each player is a thief with different abilities moving silently (hopefully) around the museum at night dodging roaming guards and security cameras. When they reach a designated location, they attempt a challenge based on an attribute that each character has a varying amount of (Brawn, Brains, Sneak, Charm).

Once they succeed in their challenge, players get to choose a card that allows them to trigger a change in the board's circumstances. They can turn off security cameras, move guards, turn off the lights, unlock doors or turn off alarms. If everything goes smoothly, your team will work like clockwork to steal the one item you're all here for. If all goes smoothly.

Not only do the players have to work precisely, but they have to work quickly before the next guard shift comes in. As the game progresses, a deck of cards is pulled changing the position of the guards and moving the clock ever so dangerously close to the end of the game. Get your item out of the museum before the deck runs out!

name: Journey to Zion
description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that Journey to Zion is a non-authorized version of Ticket to Ride, thus it is set apart from the official entry.




From the publisher:

Recreate the trips the saints took, and score points by making the longest journeys. Perfect for the whole family.

Object: Make your way by train, ship, steamboat, handcart, or covered wagon to Zion. Be the first one to score 100 points. Points can be scored by completing a trail between two points, completing a journey card.
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Moobie
description:
UNRELEASED GAME



Note that all details for this game are preliminary. If you have information about this game, you are invited to edit this section or submit corrections.




For now only the Moobie title and other basic information is available.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Get the white!
description:
Roll the white die and your colored die. Do they match? Yes? All right, max points! No? Ok, let's use the cards!
