Cards represent dungeon rooms with different door patterns which can be placed in a labyrinthine manner until you have a 10-card dungeon path with no lurking creatures and no unexplored paths... as long as you have a hero left to claim the treasure, it's yours, and you win the game!

Components: 126 cards, 12 hero pawns

name: Going Nutz
description:
Going Nutz is the first release for Wynners Circle Games and is a fun family style push your luck die rolling game for 2-8 players. Players take turns trying to rack up score by rolling squirrels to collect acorns that were rolled. The squirrels are trying to store up for winter so you have to also roll a tree for a higher score. Although there are pesky eagles that are looking for dinner themselves. Don't roll eagles or they will take your squirrels.

There are two scoring modes in Going Nutz. The basic scoring is great for a younger player or a new gamer that is just joining the hobby. There is also an advanced scoring option to score HUGE points but is a lot more difficult to obtain.

Help Nutty the Squirrel get acorns and evade the eagle to win.

name: Bottoms Up to the Top
description:
Bottoms Up to the Top (B.U.T.T.) is an addictive party game that's also a drinking game. Have you ever wanted to drunkenly race to the top a mountain while knocking your friends off? The correct answer is "Every waking second!" Basically, if you are over 21 (or 20 if you live in Iceland) the choice to buy this game is obvious. Bring this game to parties and it will instantly become a staple of all the parties thereafter.

A mix of dice rolling and strategy make an exciting, heart racing board game that is also a drinking game. You and your friends try to stop anyone from reaching the mountain-top before you. Each turn you roll the dice and push yourself or others up the mountain, in an attempt to reach the top and knock your others off. As you go up the mountain you lose and gain points on certain spaces and the game ends when someone reaches the top. If you go over the top you have to start all the way at the bottom.

Bottoms Up To The Top is a board game first and a drinking game second. Most drinking games seem to not be too much fun without the drinking, this game could easily be enjoyed no matter what state of mind you are in. Bottoms Up To The Top is a game for all kinds of people over the legal drinking age and not made exclusively for heavy-drinkers or moderate partyers. B.U.T.T. has separate rules for non-drinkers and drinkers.
categories: Dice, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Memory Challenge: The Wizard of Oz 75th Anniversary Collector's Edition
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Celebrate 75 years of the classic and beloved film The Wizard of Oz, with the world's most popular matching game! Players match their favorite Picture Cards from a variety of categories including characters, film scenes and objects from the film. Wicked Witch of the West Cards are non-matching and give a positive or negative strategic directive. New Character Cards allow players to assume the role of one of their favorite characters from the film. Each Character Card has a bonus symbol that also appears on 1 match of Picture Cards. If you make the match with your character's bonus symbol, you get a onetime positive move. The player with the most matches at the end of the game wins.
categories: Card Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Computerize!
description:
Computerize! is a game about assembling and using a home computer, from the days when that was relatively new and interesting. Players move around the board via die rolls to get opportunities to purchase major components and minor accessories, which are checked off on record sheets. The object of the game is to check off everything on your sheet.

Money can be raised in a number of ways. Players can sell parts back to the bank for half of the purchase price. There is an inner section of the board which can be entered (via the "input core buffers"). While there you may land on a space which lets you draw a software card (shaped like a 5 1/4" floppy); if your system meets the software requirements, you collect money. Each player also starts with "state of the family" cards which can be turned in for cash, but you have to end the game with the same number of these you started with.

name: Tower of Babble
description:
Tower of Babble is a language education game. On a turn a player draws a card which has words in French and Spanish on one side and attempts to guess what they mean in English. (There are pictures which may help.) If a player guesses correctly they are paid chips by the other players.

Cards can also be placed on the players' individual mats, matching symbols on the cards to symbols on the mats. The object of this is to complete meaningful sentences in French or Spanish in rows of cards.

Rules are provided for solitaire play and several variants.

name: Hedralites
description:
Hedralites is a skirmish wargame in which players create bands of ancient Mediterranean soldiers in an attempt to control the besieged city of Khard. Models gain experience and items over a series of scenarios with an ever-changing board and set of objectives.

Play requires a set of polyhedral dice, extra d6s, and of course a copy of the rules, available for free online.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Treacherous Waters: Caribbean Conquest
description:
Buckle your scimitar and join your pirate brethren for a battle to become the Pirate King of the Caribbean. Whether through ruthless combat or economic dominance, become the master of the Caribbean waters and prove that you have what it takes to be crowned the conqueror.

Treacherous Waters: Caribbean Conquest is for 2-6 players and offers up war and adventure on the high seas. Aim to win by either eliminating all opponents or playing all of your pieces. Keep your flagship afloat and sink your enemies to wipe them from the board or systematically engage all of their ports and fleets to erase them from existence.

Combat is simple but intense. Players roll a die to move, attack, and defend. Stock plenty of garrisons in your ports to stave off enemies, and protect your vulnerable flag ship as it can take only six hits before descending to the depths. Loot cards can further your advantage (or your opponent's disadvantage) by providing bonuses (or penalties) to moving, attacking and defending.

You choose between one of six pirates, each with his own background and color, and conquer ports and trade routes to generate larger fleets and greater resources. As the emphasis of the game is on conquering your enemies and making bold moves, the one who dares the most will have an edge toward winning.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Player Elimination

name: Frisbee Finger Golf
description:
Frisbee Finger Golf
A Finger Disc Golf Game. Frisbee Finger Golf is a Disc Golf game for your finger, using finger dexterity and disc control. You manipulate a disc around an 18 hole course played around your house, trying to aim and shoot the disc into a mini disc catcher. With each hole you must avoid terrain and course hazards, and possibly other discs. The goal is to obtain the lowest score by shooting the least amount of shots for each hole to win the game.

Number of players: 1 to 4

Components:
[4] Nerf, plastic or card stock Frisbee disc.
[1] Disc Catcher – acrylic or card stock
[1] Finger Disc Golf Tee Box
[18] Preset Frisbee Finger Disc Golf 18 hole course layouts
[XX] Terrain markers and obstacles - these are anything you find around the house such as plant, chairs, couch, etc...
[1] Random terrain generated chart. You can take existing courses and re-create them throughout your house.
[1] Rules of play

You can manipulate the finger discs in a number of ways:

1. The finger flick - By using the tip of your index finger and thumb while the disc is resting on the Tee box, you flick the disc forward for long range flight. The tip of the finger must always be in contact with the disc before flicking it. This type of shot is good for long range angled shots.

2. The Thumb flip - By laying the disc on the side of your index finger and using your thumb nail to flip the disc end over end for a lob type flight. This type of shot is good for short range shots that need to clear high obstacles in front of you disc.

3. The roll - By using your two fingers OR your palm as a ramp, you roll the disc toward the goal. This type of shot is good for short close range shots.

4. The push - By using the tip of your index finger and hitting the edge of the disc, you push the disc short distances. This type of shot is good for short accurate close range shots.

5. The nose drop - By rolling the disc off the edge of your nose, you aim for short range bouncing shots.

6. The quarter’s toss - By holding the disc with your index finger and thumb, you throw the disc against the table like in the quarters drinking game and shoot for bouncing goal.
Etc…

The Frisbee Finger Disc Golf course can be created from anything found around the house or office. Each hole is usually 6 to 12 feet long for 3 to 4 PAR holes.

Anything can be used as course obstacles; a plant, a chair, table edge, books, picture frame, phone, cat or dog, you name it!
The Mini Disc Cather is a specially designed miniature model of an original Disc Catcher. All Finger discs must be flipped, tossed or flicked into the Mini Disc Catcher cage!

You begin by laying out the course; you setup the special Disc Tee box on a table, chair or on the floor and then placing the Disc Catcher 6’ to 12’ away on a table, chair or floor. You designate and place course obstacles within or around the flight path of the finger disc to create a disc course that is either easy or hard. Each obstacle must specified whether the disc will fly over, around or under the obstacle to clear the obstacle.

Normal Disc Golf rules apply.

All rules of original Frisbee golf apply.
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Life in the Fast Lane
description:
Life in the Fast Lane is a real-time card game playable only with the Strength Stack 52: Bodyweight Exercise Cards deck or with another deck of numbered cards. To start, deal the cards evenly among all players, with players leaving those cards face down in front of them. Place one card face up in the center of the playing area; this forms the "Fast Lane", and the final digit on this card (and each other card) is what's important during play.

Playing at the same time, everyone picks up and scans their cards, trying to find a legal play, specifically a card with a final digit one number higher or lower than the top card of the Fast Lane. As soon as someone plays such a card and announces the number of the card played, players must now find and play a card matching this new top card. If a player has a wild card, he can play it at anytime, announcing the number that it represents. The first player to play all of his cards wins, while the losing players must perform all of the exercises on the cards they are left holding. Anyone holding a wild card must perform their exercises twice!

For a speedier and wilder game, place two cards in the Fast Lane. Now everyone has two stacks on which to play!

name: Earth: Last Days
description:
In few next years Earth will be a target of attack from alien massive spaceship. Almost all of its surface will be destroyed. Few powerful nations move all their leaders to safe location from where they will try to rebuild and strike back at the powerful enemy.

In Earth: Last Days players will take a role of leader of one of six most powerful nations on earth and side by side they will fight with Alien invaders and build structures and units. This simple strategy game is meant to be a quick and fun but with a lot of option.

Games will be based on chips that will represent units and buildings. Each player will have a voting cards - because in this game - You are not dictator and You will have to listen to the people... or eradicate them!

During their turns players will build structures and units to fight with alien invasion. They will have to use Voting cards to see how their people react on every decision they make. To win humans need to make a breach in the mothership hull and send an unit there to destroy the core.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Sag's Pfeilgeschwind
description:
Sag's Pfeilgeschwind is a Sesame Street theme based educational game for 2-4 children.

There are 12 fields around a rotatable arrow. At the beginning of the game, 12 cards will be shown openly and the players have to memorize the character, and depending on the player's age, what he's doing. The cards are flipped to hide the image and the arrow will be moved. The fastest player who answers correctly what is hidden on the card receives the card. The player with the most cards win the game.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Impact and Melee: Persian Wars – 499-479 BC
description:
"A Simple Game of Ancient Warfare between the Greek City State Alliance and Persian Empire From 499-479 BC."

From the rulebook:

IMPACT and MELEE: Persian Wars - 499-479 BC
A simple and quick war game of a GREEK vs. PERSIAN battle

Game pieces are represented by top down full color photos of Greek and Persian warriors of the time of PERSIAN WARS (@ 499-479 BC). Print out the game board (6 x 4 rectangle of squares sized on an 8.5”x 11” piece of paper). You will need to provide your own six-sided dice.


Players set up on opposite sides of the map, and maneuver their units on the squares to attack their opponent's units. Victory occurs when one side has eliminated the enemy units that were designated in the "How to Win" victory conditions.

name: Battlebox: The Card Game
description:
From the game's website:

"You play the role of the insurgent leader rebelling against the Japanese Occupiers. The player with the most number of Valour points by the time the Commanding General is defeated wins the game."

Battlebox is a deckbuilding game. Players start the game with a Tactical Deck of 10 cards, made up of 7 basic resource cards and 3 Solo Vigilante mission cards, and 80 Life Points.

During every turn, players draw 5 cards from their own Tactical Deck and use the 5 cards to acquire more powerful cards (Resources, Plans or Mission). Players may also play Plan or Mission cards if they are part of the 5 drawn cards. Plan cards help players complete Missions.

Playing a Mission card leads to a draw from the Warzone deck. If the player fulfills the requirements of the drawn Warzone card, he completes the mission and gains the Valour points and benefits listed on the card. A failed mission leads to loss of Life Points listed on the same card. Reaching 0 Life Points leads to the skipping of the next turn, and reduction of maximum Life Points by 20. When the maximum Life Points reaches 0, the player is out of the game.

The player with the highest number of Valour points at the end of the game wins.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Legends & Lore
description:
Game description from the publisher:

The year is 1822 — Singapore, a young trading hub is undergoing urban redevelopment better known as the Jackson Plan. Settlers from different ethnic backgrounds have brought their beliefs and culture to this new land.

Legends & Lore is a competitive horror mystery board game based on true stories passed down by generations. You play the role of an investigator searching for clues to solve paranormal cases. The clock starts ticking once the night claims its first victim. You will require all the knowledge you have gleamed from your investigation to hunt down this legendary horror before the darkness overwhelms you.

During every round of the game, players place investigation tokens on various locations to investigate them. Depending on the location being investigated, players may gain clues, hunt cards (improve one's own attributes), find the Authority token (becoming the starting player for following round), or pick up case files. Solving cases result in rewards and, more importantly, valor points.

When the first "Untimely Revelations" case card is revealed, the Horror Track is triggered; at the start of every subsequent round, it moves up one space. When the Horror Track reaches 7, the game ends and the player with the highest Valor score wins.

name: Matematikus
description:
Matematikus
Math can be fun and here's the proof. How many combinations can you make with your 8 cards? And which is the best considering that addition and subtraction are worth 10 Picnics (points) and the multiplications and divisions are worth 20 Picnics? Also consider that the cards have a number on one side and a mathematical sign in the other, and you can only use one of them. You will see that it is quite a challenge.

Matematikus
Las matemáticas pueden ser muy divertidas y aquí está la prueba. ¿Cuántas combinaciones matemáticas puedes formar con tus 8 cartas? ¿Y cuál es la mejor teniendo en cuenta que las sumas y restas valen 10 Picnics (puntos) y las multiplicaciones y divisiones valen 20 Picnics? Ten en cuenta también que las cartas tienen una cifra en una cara y un signo matemático en la otra, y que sólo puedes usar una de ellas. Verás que es todo un reto.

name: Royalists vs Roundheads
description: Royalists vs Roundheads represents a battle in the first few years of the Civil Wars of the 17th century. Royalists and Roundheads line up their Cavaliers, Pikemen and Musketeers and the battle begins. Three types of men each with different movement: Pikemen (movement: ortho/diag forwards only 1 square, capture by replacement); Musketeers (movement: ortho/diag 3/2, capture by replacement); Cavaliers (movement: ortho/diag 1 square, capture by long leap). Aim to capture opposing general ( a Cavalier). Leather board and wooden gaming pieces.

name: Tomb Robbers and Temple Raiders
description: Tomb Robbers and Temple Raiders plays out a clash between two groups of treasure hunting robbers and raiders amongst the temple ruins of Egypt in the 1920s. All men on both sides move by the knight's move (x1 or x2) and capture by alignment. Secret passages allow an extra degree of movement across the board. Two levels of win depending on whether the losing side can allow their last man to escape or is defeated entirely. Leather board and wooden gaming pieces.

name: Lie Your Face Off!: Your Go-To Lies
description:
A mini-expansion to Lie Your Face Off! These are the lies that have always gotten you out of tricky situations, even when you were a baby.

If you don't have a Go-To Lie in you hand and you have to draw a card, you draw a Go-To Lie. Playing a Go-To Lie will always make you draw another one. These lies are more powerful than their base game counterparts, but if either the base game or the expansion deck runs out of cards, the game ends. Additionally, you'll need to complete another story for every expansion deck that you are using to end the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: La oss lære om flagg
description:
Children's educational game about European flags. Players roll two dice with a colour on each face, and must find a tile showing a flag containing the two resulting colours, and then place it on the right space on the map which forms the game board. Each correct match and placement yields a coin; identifying and placing one's own country's flag gives a bonus coin in addition to this. The player who has collected the most coins when all tiles have been placed is the winner.

No upper limit on the number of players is given or implied; at least up to five players seems reasonable.

name: Jakten på brødrene Dal
description: Exploration game based on the first two Norwegian children's television series about the eponymous "brødrene Dal" (the Dal brothers). Players paddle their canoes around a labyrinthine river, searching for crystals to power time machines needed to travel in time and space to places where the lost Dal brothers might be stuck.
categories: Children's Game, Maze, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Nautical, Science Fiction
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: 300 Mile Race Game
description: The 300 Mile Race Game is a board game which simulates a stock car race with 30 participants. The object of the game is to pick the winning car from among the 30 cars in the game. Dice are rolled against a sequence of tables to determine which cars get to advance around the track. The tables also have results which can cause cars to suffer pit stops, crashes, or mechanical failures. The first car around the track wins, along with the player who picked that car (if any).

name: Die Biene Maja
description:
Players try to gather Maja's friends together.

Every player has a board with eight characters depicting Maja's friends. Each character has two slots for a colored pin to place in. The winner is the first player to place a pin in all sixteen slots.

To place a pin, the current player spins the central spinner. There are spaces for the eight characters, Maja, and a lightning bolt. If Maja is the result, the player may place two pins in any slots. If the lightning bolt occurs, the player must remove two pins. If any of the eight characters are spun, the player places one pin on the character.

Players may also place a pawn near one spinner space to potentially be able to place two pins on the character, if it is spun.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: The Take
description:
The Take is about crooked cops taking money. It is played over the course of several rounds. Each round, each player takes a bill(card) worth between 1 and 5 thousand dollars. In the second half of the game each player gets an opportunity to take an action after all players have taken their money for the round.

There are three ways to win the game:

If the deck of cards runs out, the player with the most money wins at the end of the final round.
If a player correctly accuses a player of having the most money,the accuser immediately wins.
If a player correctly accuses another player of having the least money, the player with the most money wins.


There are 4 basic actions that players can take by spending money from their hand.

Stakeout: Adjust turn order.
Audit: Look at another player's cards.
Accuse: Accuse a player of having the most or least money.
Defame: Block a player from taking an action.

name: Rush
description:
Rush is the primary title.

The entire title would be...

Colorado's Green

Rush

It is (as the name implies) about the 21st century rush currently underway in Colorado, meaning...

The legalization of Marijuana.

It is a game about trying to make money in this crazy industry.

It's like the Wild-Wild-West all over again!!!

Rush is an economic game that involves the fact that law enforcement is always angling to shut down your enterprise.

We here at Common Man Games have always taken a special interest in games that are themed after modern-day subject matters, and involve Law Enforcement.

We think this is a very interesting topic, and one that is evolving right before our eyes.

We began work on this game back in 2013 and hoped to release it in 2014, but getting it right has been a long slow process and one we don't want to "Rush" (sorry), so exactly when it will be released is a tricky question to answer, but please...

Stay Tuned!
categories: Card Game, Economic, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing

name: Discover Hawaii
description:
This game challenges players to "Discover Hawai'i" better and quicker than their fellow 'travelers'. This is done by earning at least 500 Discovery Points and being the first one to return to the "Aloha Square"

The game consists of one board, one die, four pawns, one pack of "Kokua" Cards, One pack of "Pilikia" cards, Discovery Notes and Four Discovery Guides.

The board resembles a "Monopoly" Game board, but does not mimic the Monopoly game mechanism.

name: Beard! The Card Game
description:
Beard! is a casual, silly, Beer & Pretzel style game for 2-6 players. This card game takes you on a a ridiculous romp through reality as you compete with your friends to grow the first truly epic beard! Will you become a Lumberjack, face down Ninja! or find True Love? All is possible when trying to grow the greatest of all beards!

Gameplay is simple.

1. The player with the largest beard chooses who goes first.

2. The first player draws a Save Or Shave card (SOS Card), reads it out loud, and does what it says. Hopefully, it tells you to draw Beard! Cards, but it might tell you to lose Beard! Cards, Steal the Cards of others, roll a six sided die, or choose between multiple options.

3. Play continues clockwise.

4. Each Beard! Card has one letter: B, E, A, R, or D. The first person to have one of each Beard! Card, wins the game.

name: The War For Freedom: 1861-1865
description:
Large multi-map, operational-level game covering the entire American Civil War that is easy to play. Division and Brigade-level. Naval units and Confederate trade aspects. Political rules. Weekly turns. Production and historical reinforcements.

Focuses heavily on hidden units, recon and fog-of-war. Several card decks that add random events and historical flavor without driving the game.

Several scenarios: 1861, 1862 and 1863. Plus two smaller single map intro Campaign scenarios serve as a way to learn the game system.
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), Heritage Game Studios

name: Trade Empire
description:
Advances in nautical technology made longer travel by sea possible. Players take over the role to build a trade empire for their nation. They are chartered to explore the vast seas outside the known world and found colonies to harvest rich goods on a modular world map.

Nations which can control a monopoly of particular goods will be able to make the most profit. But weakly protected colonies will be easy targets for the other nations and fierce battles are fought between fleets for those key colonies on a tactical battle map.

Players can invest their money in developing new ship types (carracks, galleons, frigates, etc.) or harbor defense. Or, they can spend their money by buying new ships, trying to find the perfect balance between merchant and battle ships.

The game is won by the player who has the most victory points after a fixed number of rounds. As points are awarded for earning money, not keeping it, make sure to spend it wisely!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Set Collection

name: MovieMashups
description:
A team game, where each team tries to determine the mashed up movie title.
Scoring is one point for each title guessed, and a bonus point for both titles. If there are points left over after the 1 minute round, the other team gets a chance to steal the remaining points. Whomever gets the most points gets the card. At the end of the game, you take the cards and try to make combos (most movies starring same actor, most in the same series, most in same genre).

As it's a team game, you will see one person knowing a title, announcing it, then the other team members using that title to guess the rest of the movies. Also, sometimes a player knows the movie but cannot remember its title, so will describe the movie to their teammates. Those are fun moments for me to see.

You will see an opponent anxiously watching the clock for opportunity to steal.

The numbers at the bottom of the card are used to create themed decks. This lets you use a sub-set of the cards you own to come up with a themed game.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: WWII: The Card Game
description:
September 1, 1939 – For the second time in the 20th century, the world is at war. With the invasion of Poland by Germany, Europe plunges into war a mere 20 years after the end of The Great War, now to be known as World War I. Just over two years later, in December of 1941, the other half of the globe joins the war as Japan declares war on the United States and the British Commonwealth and tears through Western Pacific territories with astonishing ease. Will you save the free world as the Allies, or conquer it as the Axis?

WWII: The Card Game is a 2 player card game that pits the Axis against the Allied Powers in the Second World War. WWII: The Card Game is a constructed deck game in which both players construct their own deck before the game begins and then use their deck to wage war on their opponent. During the game, players build their resources and deploy military units to take control of locations by defeating their opponent’s units in battle. By winning battles and controlling key strategic locations around the world, players cause their opponent to lose cards from their deck. The first player to empty their opponent’s deck is the winner!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Cubbage
description: A dice game based upon the card game Cribbage. A player uses 13 dice to make pairs, straights or find dice that add up to 7. The game was designed for the 2013 Solitaire Contest, and can be played by 1 or 2 people.

name: Cope
description:
In Cope each player controls four members of a family who each start the game at a different stage of life (child, teen, adult, senior citizen), or "growth level" as the game has it.

Each growth level is represented by a track which is moved around by die roll. Various spaces on the tracks will require players to draw Good News or Bad News cards. Others will allow the player to try the "Ladder of Life" by coping with a crisis or opportunity. Coping is performed by rolling a large dodecahedron; the result may let the family member cope with the problem and advance, or it may require help from a family member at another growth level, in which case that member has to be moved.

Family members may get "promoted" to later growth levels. The levels are designated by plastic rings of different colors placed on the pieces.

The object of the game is to get all of your family members home first, but the real objective of the game is educational. As the introduction to the rules say, "the purpose of the game is to teach individual and family participation on how to COPE with daily situations in life."

name: Shotzee: The Numbers Game
description:
In Shotzee each player has a score sheet with four 3x3 grids. On a turn, a player rolls from 1-4 dice (their choice) and then all players must enter the number rolled in an empty space in one of their grids.

After all the grids are full they are scored. Players score for columns in which the first two numbers add up to the third, rows in which the second number subtracted from the first equals the third, and long diagonals in which the first two numbers multiplied together equal the third.

Bonus points are given for combinations where the result (third number) is particularly high, for having multiple additions or subtractions score in one grid, and for "Shotzees," which are multiplications where the result is 21.

As a variant, on each die roll each player must write the number in one box in each of their grids.

name: Adjugé..!
description:
Players acquire various objects at public auction. Each object is present three times: in good condition, in poor condition and a fake object. The goal is to capture as much works of art of great value, avoiding works in poor condition or even fake art.

In each round, the first player turns over a action card. If it shows an auction, the player takes the hammer of auctioneer and take the object card with the starting price 2000 francs. The best bid wins the card, then the purchaser discovers the condition of the object he just acquired!

Some action cards allows player to look at the condition of the object.

The goal is to acquire objects forming series - a series of three objects is double the amount of objects that compose it.
When all the object cards are sold, the player with the most valuable collection is the winner.

name: Top! Totem
description:
The board represents a grid map of 8 columns x 9 rows with a central zone comprising six central squares and a totem pole in the center!
Each player has 12 pawns and 3 riders. Each pawn moves one step forward or sideways, only the rider can go back. Riders are always moved after the pawns.
All pawns can take a shot at a time, unless the rider who can play two consecutively.
Only pawns can enter the central squares.
The first who eliminates all opposing checkers with at least one of his pawns in the sacred precincts wins a round and scores points. The first player to reach 300 points wins the game.

name: Straight Jacket
description:
From the introduction to the rules:

Straight Jacket is a fast, fun card game for 3 or more players — 4 or 5 is best.

In Straight Jacket, the players take on the roles of inmates wearing straight jackets and trapped in a padded cell. All of you want to escape, but you’re not exactly pragmatic about it. The person with the most points at the end of the games, wriggles from their jacket and escapes.

User summary:

The deck consists of 75 poker-sized cards.

Players draw up to three cards to form a hand of three, play the lowest value card from their hand of three to their play area, then pass one card each to the left and right of them. Cards may have instructions which are to be followed when they are played. Play continues until the draw pile is exhausted.

name: Invasive Species: The Game
description:
Auuuuuuuugh! Your publisher is breathing down your neck, so now it's a late-night, caffeine-fueled, rattling-keyboard-pounding race to get the first chapter of your thriller novel Invasive Species finished before he decides to tear up your lucrative contract. Through blind inspiration (drawing cards) and expert cut-and-paste editing (arranging cards on your board), you strive to complete your chapter before it's too late.

In the card game Invasive Species, players create a story by using 36 cards that have numbered text showing where each card should go in the story. Each turn, a player draws a card and decides whether he wants to keep it or give it to his opponent. He places any kept cards on his personal board, with the goal of creating an ascending numeral sequence. When the deck runs out, players take turns sliding misplaced cards into their correct positions. The first player to correctly "write" his story wins.

Invasive Species is based on the novel of the same name by Mike Mayer.

name: Basketball Sport Bag Dice Game
description:
A dice game for simulating a game of basketball. There are 4 six-sided dice included, 2 for the Home Team and 2 for the Visiting Team (1 Offense die and 1 Defense die for each). Players take turns rolling their Offensive die against their opponent's Defense die. Points are scored by comparing the rolls against a chart.

Comes with a miniature duffel bag to store the dice.

name: Pied de Nez
description:
Game description from the publisher:

You are at a masked ball in 18th century France. No one knows who you really are, but in this frivolous world of manners and mockery, your friends are out to expose you. Can you work out the clues and mock them first?

In Pied de Nez (a.k.a. "thumbing your nose"), you have a hidden identity and want to figure out which of the other players are your two closest friends. Clues are revealed slowly; every time you reveal some information about yourself, you earn a drink and you need to use those drinks to be able to do a "pied de nez" at the people for whom you are searching.

Pied de Nez is an analytical game of deduction and hidden identities for 6-10 players, with the game being playable (but not ideal) with 4-5 players.

name: X-3: Jeu de Dés Tri-Directionnel
description:
X-3 is played on a hexagonal board of 61 spaces. The spaces are designed so that dice can fit into them with three faces showing, one along each axis of the board. The playing pieces are dice in two base colors (black and white) with six differently-colored faces.

There are rules for two games in the box:

Morpion/Triplets/Ensembles

A placement game; players alternate placing dice in an effort to form patterns. If using the "Morpion" rule players try to get four faces of the same color in the same direction in a row (or five for a more challenging game). If using the "Triplets" rule players try to create groups of three dice with matching-colored faces touching the same point, and if using the "Ensembles" rule players try to create groups of four dice where the center die matches a face to each adjacent die. (It may be that players are intended to use all three scoring methods together; the rules are rather short and not clear in all respects.)


Dames de Couleur (Color Checkers)

In this game players start with 18 dice in the three rows closest to them (facing determined randomly) and on each turn move one diagonally forward. Opposing pieces can be jumped, but only if the adjacent dice faces match. The players can turn dice to different faces instead of moving them. The goal is to capture the most dice.

name: The Junior Oxford Game
description:
As per box:

Can learning be fun too? You bet! Play and find out for yourself! The Junior Oxford Game comes with more than 1500 challenging questions divided into 23 exciting word games, and well over 100 Wild Word Fights. Improve your skills as you learn to understand the explosive power of language!. It's exciting, it's fast, and it's fun! Graded questions spread over the cards make it possible for all juniors (8 to 12 years) to play together.

The Junior Oxford Game has been written in close association with School Teachers and English language experts from Oxford University Press.

Keep your word a secret!. Your heart pounds as you race across the board to collect the letters of your secret word. Spin the disc to try your luck! Challenge your opponents to a word fight and snatch their letters! The tension mounts as you dive into a tunnel on your way to victory...The first person to complete their secret word wins!

name: Luna
description:
Luna is a Pachisi based game, produced by Spika in East Germany in 1966. There are three each of six player pieces, which are small spaceships or satellites. They are precision cast in red, black, green, yellow, white and blue plastic.

The goal of the game is to "land" all of your spacecraft on the moon first. The board pips help you advance or retard a player's movement toward the moon. The movements are determined by the roll of a single die.

The game seems to be inspired by the space race, and the game tokens bear some resemblance to the Sputnik satellite. Greg Stachowski added this information, "The rocket looks to be pretty generic, perhaps based on a Kosmos. The spacecraft above each of the rockets is clearly a Vostok. Actually the artwork is damn good, those are pretty accurate renderings of all the spacecraft, even down to little details like the curved antennae on the Vostok or the hexagonal base frame on the Ranger (in fact given the accuracy of the others I might hazard a guess that it is a 1964 or later Ranger (6 through 9) due to the rectangular rather than trapezoidal panels)." Greg's identification of the satellites is in a labeled image he prepared.

name: Plebiscitum
description:
Ever thought of becoming president? Now you can! Give interviews, bribe, foment protests, play good and evil to become the most popular politician ever.

Plebiscitum is a card game, based on a contemporary international politics theme. It is played in teams called parties, fighting to win the elections.

In order to win the elections the player must fulfill both of the following two requirements:
- The player’s party must be the most popular.
- The player must be the most popular within his/her party.

The backbone of Plebiscitum is the idea that players should try to make their own party win, and at the same time beat their own party members in order to get elected. To do so, players can play cards both against other parties’ members or against their own party members.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Car Wars Expansion Set #9 Upgrade
description:
From Publisher Website

Upgrade Your Classic Fairground!

Do you already own Car Wars Expansion Set #9, Muskogee Fairground & Family Emporium, and just need the expanded information from Muskogee Mayhem, a Car Wars adventure pack to add more autoduelling antics to this ever-popular destination? Then this e23 exclusive is for you! This version is identical to the full Muskogee Mayhem supplement, except it doesn't include the gargantuan maps that were part of the original Expansion Set 9. With those maps and this downloadable 24-page sourcebook and counter sheet, you'll have complete Mayhem!

name: The Blockade Runner: An Exciting Game
description: The Blockade Runner: An Exciting Game demonstrates how board game often reflect current events in American History. The game refers to "the late war with Spain," more commonly known as The Philippine War, from 1899 to 1902. Naval battles, most importantly the battle of Manila Bay, characterized this war and The Blockade Runner game demonstrates this. In the game play, one player takes the part of the runner and the other forms the blockade.

name: Giant 30 Game Cube
description:
Giant 30 Game Cube is a set which when assembled forms a cube 18 inches on each side. Each side is a board used to play at least one of the games in the set. Pieces are also provided for most of the games.

The games not listed in the "Contains" section are mostly Chess and Checkers variants that do not have database entries. There is also a Fox & Geese variant and two simple racing games.

The set is mostly of interest because two of the games (Nine Holes and Chase) are original designs by Sid Sackson which have never been reprinted.
publishers: Research Games, Inc. / Athol / RGI / ARC

name: Two Daggers In The Heart: Smolensk, 1941
description:
Operational-level wargame simulating the Smolensk battle from July 2nd to August 15th. The main German attack carried out by Two Panzergruppes, the Infantry and support units of Army Group Center as they advance against Russian forces on their way to striking at Moscow.

Command and variable movement system that includes cards that add random events and historical flavor, but do not drive the game. German units are Divisions, Regiments and specialized Battalions. Russian units are untried Divisions and specialized Regiments. Both sides have their own unique manor of play to show their historical capabilities and tendencies.

name: Good Fortune
description:
Good Fortune is a fast-paced, light tabletop game themed around life's lucky breaks. It is suitable for families, festive gatherings, newcomers to board games, and casual gamers.
The game uses a modular board made up of tiles, which are arranged in a random combination. Players draw fortune cards with different combination of symbols, which they can choose to keep or swap for new ones. Based on the fortune cards in their hand, players take turns to place game tokens on the board and claim the fortunes on the corresponding cards. Most often, players have multiple board locations available and can choose their tactic based on the fortunes they most wish to claim and on the combinations that yield the highest number of points. The goal of the game is to collect the highest number of points by claiming as many fortunes with the player's lucky symbol as possible.
mechanics: Modular Board, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Frozen Rampage
description:
Frozen Rampage is the first game release from Rusty Nickel Miniatures.

Frozen Rampage is a two player, fast-paced, turn-based, fantasy miniature ice hockey game. The starter box includes two teams, human and orc, each of which is composed of ten miniatures.

The goal of Frozen Rampage is to use strategy and an arsenal of special abilities to outsmart and outscore your opponent. A game of Frozen Rampage will take approximately 40 minutes to an hour, and the learning curve is typically less than one game.

A team sets includes 4 defensemen, 4 forwards, a goalie, and a star player and will all be cast in plastic.

Unique miniatures such as the Referee, Kevlan Gor, and star players not available in the starter sets will be cast in white metal.
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), Rusty Nickel Miniatures

name: Connect With Pieces: The Hobbit an Unexpected Journey
description:
The game components are the (700) pieces of a jigsaw puzzle (27" x 20"). Each piece has one of five symbols embossed on it. Solid-color pieces may be able to fit in more than one position in the puzzle, but other pieces will only have one valid position.

The players are all working to assemble the puzzle; using the main set of rules, one player plays for a minute at a time, with the others using this time to select pieces from the box. There are also "scramble" rules in which all players can select pieces and play them as they wish.

Regardless of the rules used, players score points for playing pieces, with more points being awarded for playing more pieces and for playing rows of three pieces with the same symbol or squares of pieces with four different symbols. Points are also awarded for correcting misplaced pieces.

Players can play for a given amount of time or until someone reaches a given score (or until the puzzle is finished).
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Puzzle

name: P.O.N.E.  "Protectors of Neo Earth"
description:
Neo Realms Entertainment is proud to announce the release of P.O.N.E.

Protectors of Neo-Earth or P.O.N.E. is a tactical board game with deck building properties. Players battle for control over castles that afford them points toward more powerful warrior cards. When battle is joined at a castle, the players choose their battle cards and fight for control over the lands of Neo Earth.

P.O.N.E. has 3 phases of the game & they occur in the following order each round: Payment, Movement & Combat.

- Payment Phase: Players are paid based on the number and types of lands controlled.

- Movement Phase: Each player may move any or all of his pawns one space to an adjacent castle.

- Combat Phase: Combat occurs when one or more pawns challenges another pawn for control of a castle.

The object of the game is to collect the most opposing pawns. The game ends when only 1 color pawn remains.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Medieval, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Infraction
description:
The year is 2025, and the war on crime is all but lost. The streets are filled with fear as abandoned buildings and darkened alleyways haunt the imaginations of the few innocent citizens brave enough to remain. Gunfire echoes across the cities as gang violence brings vast urban decay. The global war between the Mafia and Triad syndicates has brought civil society to its knees. The fate of the criminal world is to be decided by the force you can muster and economies you can develop in the ultimate crime war that is: INFRACTION.

Game play consists of hiring mercenaries and building developments. Each player is trying to kill the other's boss. Using mercenaries to attack, and developments to gain riches, as well as the odd trick 'o' trade, they try to dominate the board in the hope of wounding the enemy boss. The game starts with each player drawing cards and using a family bank balance as a kickstart to their criminal empire. From here you build your syndicate over the course of the game.

name: Heroes of Ahlmeran
description:
Heroes of Ahlmeran (HoA) is a cooperative card game where 2 - 5 players come together and build an adventuring party from unique Hero Cards and Feat Cards and then complete Quests to help the land of Ahlmeran. The game requires both team strategy and problem solving abilities.

As the players, you will build your party from a selection of 12 Heroes spanning across 6 Races. The Humans, lost among the land now, with no real home. The Dwarves, at home among the rock with their advanced technology. Elves, Cast out by their past mistake, they are no longer rulers of the land but rather 2nd class citizens. The Canin, a proud race resembling a blue wolf. The Puar, the cat people of Guuman. And then the Gnomes. No one knows magic more intimately.

From those races you will select of the 6 Classes that best suits your play style. Artificer, master of artifacts and arcane knowledge. Barbarian, nomad tribes bestowing their nature knowledge and sheer might to the people. Elemental Mage, master of the 4 elements. Priest, Master of the holy arts, both offensive and defensive. Ranger, commander of nature and all that resides within her. And Templar, defender of the people, master of arcane. Each of the classes come with bonuses and a unique 40 card deck that your character will use.

Then, you select a Location Deck to play with, a deck of 15 cards to represent where your quest takes place.

Finally, you pick a Quest Deck, the enemy or circumstance your heroes are struggling against. It could be anything from breaking a curse, thwarting a thief to facing a brutal goblin ambush!

Over the course of the game, you will play cards from your Class Deck, working together with your friends to complete whatever the Quest Deck requires for your victory.

With each Quest Deck completed and Location Deck explored, you gain the chance to accumulate more rare items, allowing you to play the game countless times with more combinations than we can count
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game

name: A Thousand Leaves
description:
A mythico-historical card game based on 1000 cards that weave an edutaining spell through the looking glass of time.

This is a game of history, drama and mystery made from 1000 unique Cards, each inspired by special parts of history. It may be played by 2 people, although the game is ideally played with 4-6 participants. The title evokes the oldest known Japanese poetry anthology, Ten Thousand Leaves, which transferred many oral poetry traditions to paper for the first time in the 8th Century. A Thousand Leaves is also a translation of “Chiba”, a region in Japan.

Every player is a Leader of one of the 8 Realms. The game takes place in Turns, each of which consists of 4 PHASES: Diplomatic, Military, Society and Spirit. In each Phase, each player may take one free Action (“Phase Action”). Armies may traverse the globe or Priests build Temples, units turn against their masters or debates alter the fate of nations.

The game also features a representation of ancient warfare, complete with a Center, Left and Right and real battlefield strategies. Each player takes an action through pieces (Face Cards) on an imaginary board, alternating until all pieces have taken at least one action before the next turn begins.

name: Sticks and Stones
description:
Sticks and Stones is a fun, strategic card game, that gives you the power to choose your path to victory.

In S&S you will:

-Battle your opponent through the use of characters, enhancements, vehicles, heroes, and creatures!

-Beef up your characters with potions, special abilities, magic, and more!

-Crush your enemy using brute force, or a more tactical approach!

S&S has:

-Unique, and crazy cool artwork!

-Custom die for tracking progress!

-High quality components made to last through years of fun!

-An easy learning curve, while also giving you the option for more in depth gameplay!

How is it played?

1. Build your deck from a large selection of cool characters, crazy enhancements, and awesome creatures. Then choose your hero for the battle!

2. Obliterate your opponent! Using your deck you will Deploy>Enhance>Attack>Discard. Use ranged and melee cards to attack. Juice them up with some spells. Place in some defensive vehicles to block incoming attacks. Use counter-attack cards to send the enemies attacks right back at them!

3. After capturing the opposing hero, regroup and rebuild your deck for the next battle. Don't forget to adjust your strategy, because now your opponent will gain an advantage through the use of terrain cards! So stay alert and think outside of the box or you might be caught blindsided by a brutal attack
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Role Playing

name: Hey, Fatso
description:
This is a talking children's boardgame. This is a roll-and-move game with cards. The theme of the game is eating.

The object is to be the first one to get rid of all of your food cards.

name: Junior Bombsight Game
description:
Player uses a cardboard "bombsite" to drop marble bombs on "flip" targets in the box for up to 1000 points. Perfect score is 3150 points.

Unit is self contained. Lid of box is lifted off containing the flip target display. Player stands over the box dropping the black marble "bombs" using the provided "bombsite" marble tube.

Method and "bombsite" actually work very well!! "Bombsite is made like a pair of binoculars with a tube attached. When adjusted they actually display an X to site over the "target" and drop the marble from the attached tube. All made of heavy cardboard!!

name: Huey Leader
description:
Huey Leader puts you in the cockpits of the Vietnam War’s best Close Air Support aircraft. In Huey Leader, fly search and destroy missions to attack enemy troops, fly missions to deploy US ground troops into hostile Landing Zones and then provide Close Air Support to help the troops complete their mission, and even fly resupply missions to keep US Forward Bases supplied.

Huey Leader is based on our popular Thunderbolt-Apache Leader game system. If you've played TAL, you'll be up and flying missions against the Vietcong in minutes.

The game places you in command of the pilots and aircraft of a squadron of U.S. Close Air Support (CAS) aircraft.

A major part of the game is mission planning. You decide how to arm your aircraft and which pilots are best for the mission. Pilots are rated for skill level. Deciding which pilots to fly each mission is a major consideration. Your pilots will become fatigued with every mission. If you fly a pilot too often, his skills will degrade. Your pilots also gain experience with every mission flown. This makes for some great decision-making. Should you keep flying the top pilots and further fatigue them to get the job done, or fly the new guys to prep them for the tough missions ahead?

Missions are quickly resolved using an area movement system to display tactical combat over the target. Speed and realism take top priority in this game. Terrain cards randomly generate each battlefield. The cards include mountain ranges that block lines of sight from both you and the enemy forces. If you plan it right, you get to fly nap of the earth through the canyons and come screaming over the ridgeline to rain fire down on the enemy before they can react. Beware! During each battle enemy air defenses will pop-up on the map to ruin your day, so watch were you’re flying!

You get to resolve every shot taken at you by enemy AAA, and every air to ground attack you make against the enemy targets. Each enemy tank, APC, Infantry Squad, Machinegun Nest, etc is represented by its own counter on the battlefield.

While performing each mission, you get to decide how your pilots engage the enemy Vehicles, Troops, and AAA Sites. This makes for some tough choices. Do you hit the high value targets first, or take out the enemy AAA assets first?

Your aircraft are usually able to survive more than one attack. These aircraft are rugged and made to soak-up damage. This also factors into your decision-making. How long should you loiter over the target blowing-up enemy targets before heading for home? If your aircraft is too shot-up, it may not be able to fly for days.

Huey Leader features an operation combat sheet that tracks the progress of enemy formations attempting to overrun your sector. You get to select the formation you want to engage each day and assign the air assets you think are best suited to the task.

We’ve included the cards for every pilot to progress in experience from Newbie, to Green, Average, Skilled, Veteran, and Ace!

Key Design Features:
An all-around excellent solitaire game.
Manage your pilots as well as your hardware to be a successful squadron commander.
Intuitive, fast-playing game system.

Huey Leader includes the following aircraft:
UH-1 Iroquois
CH-47 Chinook
AH-1 Cobra
OH-6 Cayuse
A-1 Skyraider
AC-47 Spooky

Component List:
165 Full Color Cards
2 Full Color Counter Sheets (352 counters)
3 Full Color Counter Sheets with Terrain Hexes (18 counters)
22” x 17” Full Color Tactical Sheet
1 Full Color Air Base Sheet
1 Full Color Player Log Sheet

Scheduled Campaign List:
Westmoreland's War 1/1965
Operation Hump 10/1965
Khe Sanh 1/1968
Tet Offensive 1/1968
Easter Offensive 3/1972
And more!

Target Audience:
This game is perfect for both expert level military gamers as well as first time gamers. The core rules are easy to grasp and very intuitive, while still giving players a wide variety of decision-making options and tactical choices.

Each mission requires only in 30 to 60 minutes.

Each campaign consists of 2 to 10 Days in which you’ll fly one or more missions each Day.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame

name: Colorinto
description:
Colorinto is a deck of abstract paintings that challenges players with different games of visual skill, ranging from solitaire to speed contest or to strategy.

When put together, those paintings form a museum, in which every room has one picture on it. It can be only visited following certain rules that are hidden inside the paintings.

The goal of the game is to discover and create paths that cross the maze, sometimes discovering the longest route in less time than the opponents, other times by creating the museum itself so it follows certain conditions.

A game recommended for people with a liking to challenging games with simple rules, abstract art aesthetics or unconventional mazes.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Maze, Puzzle

name: Dungeon Duelers
description:
In Dungeon Duelers, players will take the rolls of Duelers beginning their journey to become Duel Champions, hoping to one day become members of one of the four Guilds of Glory. The game represents a vast journey across the entire world of Thexia. During the game players will capture monsters of their own which they will train. There is no limit to how powerful your monster can become! They will face several encounters like Duelers, Bandits, wild monsters, traps, and other challenges. As they travel between the regions they will discover ancient dungeons filled with rare monsters and treasure. Players will also complete quests that earn them fame which increases their chances of being chosen to be a Guild member. The game can be played competitively or semi-cooperatively if players want to team up against each other to speed the journey along.

The game is divided into basic and advanced versions. The basic version is much faster to play and simply requires removing a few components and not using some of the content such as the monsters unique abilities. The advanced version is played using all components and takes about 2 hours to play. There are also components that allow for custom character creation which allow a player to save their information to continue playing again possibly using expansions.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: ConSTARlations
description:
In ConSTARlations, players take turns using cards to place, move, replace and remove cards in order to make specific patterns on the board (as dictated by their secret pattern card). When a player's pattern appears on the board — no matter whose stars are responsible — they score the card and pick another.

Pattern cards are worth 1, 2 or 3 points depending on whether the pattern consists of 4, 5 or 6 stars. Players can score their pattern card during their own turn, but also during everyone else's! So they must keep their eyes on the board at all times.

If either of the two Black hole cards are played, all stars on the board are removed and returned to their players.

When one of the piles of pattern cards runs out, everyone gets one last turn before players count up their scored cards to see who has won.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Baseball Action Packed Dice Game
description:
A dice game for simulating a game of baseball. There are 4 six-sided dice included, 2 Pitcher dice (one for each team), and 2 Batter dice, both used by the player who is at bat. The Pitching player rolls their Pitcher die to determine the type of pitch, then the Batting player rolls their Batter dice to determine the outcome of the at bat. A run is scored when the Batter dice add up to 4 total bases, or when the Pitcher die comes up "Home Run." Like real baseball, a player stays at bat until they accumlate 3 outs by rolling "Strike Out" on either the Pitcher die or Batter dice.

Comes with a miniature duffel bag to store the dice.

name: Hands on Board
description: The second in a series of dice games played on an 8x8 board. It combines elements of Poker, Pente, and Yahtzee. The dice are rolled, placed, moved and rerolled. The first player to form 3 separate rows of modified poker hands on the board wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Zooloo
description:
C.W. Faulkner published numerous sectional card based board games around the turn of the century. Zooloo has uniquely shaped cards that form an animal themed globe.

Play starts by shuffling the smaller card deck and taking turns playing cards around the circular disc. All players start with a set number of counters. Players try to play the best card they have in hand, then take a card at random from the hand of the next player. When the smaller deck is played out the dealer shuffles and deals the larger card deck. Areas on the circular disc carry penalties or bonuses like paying a counter into the pot or taking one out. The game ends with the circle is complere and the player with the most counters left is the winner.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Flyto
description:
Flyto is another sectional card based board game published by C.W. Faulker after the success of Upidee. This time the theme is a balloon race instead of horses.

The board is created by laying out cards featuring landscape artwork. Players start with a number of counters then roll and move die cut balloons around the board. The winner is the player with the most counters when the race ends.

name: Honor
description:
Honor is a board game of adventures in a fantasy world. Each participant must fight and solve the problems of this world to be the most honorable of all, with honor being the symbol of victory.

The game consists of a modular map that gives variety to each game, making it shorter or longer, easier or more difficult. With six unique characters from which to choose, each participant should try to accomplish missions or commissions that apply different regions, and each hero in turn should try to keep his home province happy, while winning the love of neighboring provinces, including those of his opponents. All players fight against beasts, gain experience, complete all kinds of missions (including combat), engage followers, and use potions to achieve the goal of the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: Funny Farmyard
description:
Funny Farmyard is a card laying game from the turn of the century to create funny combination images of English farm animals.

The 32 card deck is shuffled and dealt equally to the players. Every card is numbered 1 to 4, the first player plays a #1 card from their hand, the second player a #2 and so on. If the next player does not have the correct number in sequence, they are skipped over until the 1-4 sequence has been played.

"The four cards are placed close together on the table as each person plays, and the result will be that some extremely funny and curiously-shaped animals will be made."

The player who plays the fourth card to complete the animal keeps the set. When all the cards have been played the player with the most sets wins.

name: Princess in the Tower
description:
Description from the 1892 catalog:

"A beautiful novelty. The game represents a tower with a princess appearing and disappearing at the upper casement. Also a dungeon cell, and a vine, by climbing upon which the knights endeavor to reach and rescue the princess. When the board is ready for play it is placed in an upright position, thereby giving a more realistic effect."

name: Bravura Burst: The Roll-playing Game
description:
A simple and quick game of dice rolling set in a fictional Japanese role-playing game called Bravura Burst. The game is played with two sets of unique six-sided dice. The first set of five dice have six different role-playing attributes on them such as strength or charisma. The other set of dice represent the six different types of jobs the heroes in your party can have based on the attributes they rolled. There are also Fool dice for characters that could not get a job.

On the first four turns, players will roll the five attribute dice up to 3 times in an attempt to give one of their four heroes a job (such as rolling at least three strength to create a Barbarian, or two intelligence and two charisma to create a Summoner). Among the six available job dice there are 24 unique jobs (and one more for the unique Fool Die) to play with.

Once everyone has rolled up their individual parties of four, they have a competition against a deck of cards that represents monsters and traps in a dungeon. They do this by drawing the top card of the dungeon deck and rolling the dice representing their party up to three times against the numbers and tricks on the card. The player is trying to roll enough damage to defeat the monster and enough blocking or healing to stop as much damage as possible. Traps works slightly differently with the party trying to disarm them with either job dice that can do so, or by trying to roll various specific combinations of attribute Dice to manually disarm them. Once they make their final roll for the turn they add up the numbers and see what they scored.

The competition is score based with a very simple system. Players gain 1 point for killing monsters and disarming traps, and another point if they can end the turn having blocked or healed all the damage that monster or trap just did. If a player can both defeat a card and block or heal all the damage in the same turn they gain 3 points instead.

name: BrainBox: Discover Canada
description:
BrainBox is a series of thematic games where players study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. Answer correctly and you keep the card. Collect the most cards after 5 or 10 minutes and you win!

Each box includes more than (50) 8.5 x 8.5 cm cardboard cards with beautiful pictures on one side and questions on the other, a 10-second sand timer and a 6- or 8-sided die. Also fabulously fun for single-players or large groups!

55 cards show all 10 provinces and 3 territories, their capitals, attractions, fauna and flora, cooking, famous citizens, nicknames, and more.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Trivia

name: Football Sport Bag Dice Game
description:
A dice game for simulating a game of football (American football or gridiron). There are 4 six-sided dice included, 2 for the Home Team and 2 for the Visiting Team (1 Offense die and 1 Defense die for each). Players take turns rolling their Offensive die against their opponent's Defense die. Points are scored by comparing the rolls against a chart.

Comes with a miniature duffel bag to store the dice.

name: Superhero Stories
description:
Superheroes are everywhere, from the comic book page to blockbuster movies and prime-time television. Now, superheroes step into the spotlight at your own table! Could one of these heroes secretly be you?

Superhero Stories is a card game where ordinary citizens become superheroes, fighting dangerous villains and embarking on adventures inspired by the greatest comic books of all time!

Each player is dealt a hero origin and super power. Different origins allow players access to sidekicks, weapons and other useful items that help the hero complete a plot line.

Successful completions of subplots assigned to each character award victory points. Once the final plot is complete, the Superhero with the most victory points wins!

name: Campaign To Victory: 1914 In The West
description:
Multi-map conflict simulation covering the German initial attack on Liege and their drive into Belgium and France in WW I until the end of November 1914.

Intermediate complexity yet very playable with unique no-dice system.

Divisional-Brigade level with step-reduction. Limited intelligence and FOW, unit cohesion effects, approx. 5 miles per hex, 2 day turns, variable weather, alternative orders of battles, Special multi-player rules.

Cards for random events; but do not drive the game.

Campaign game with small and medium scenarios.

name: Word 'em
description:
Word'em is a card game of betting, bluffing, and spelling-showdowns for ages 10 and up.

Word'em melds the “make-your-own luck” aspect of poker and the cerebral challenge of word games.

Every card features a letter and a point value. Your goal in each game is to form the highest-scoring word with the cards available to you, and win the hand.

Word'em cards can be used to play nearly every kind of poker variant with little modification.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Print & Play, Word Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: The Immortal Saga
description:
The Immortal Saga is a collectible competitive card game set in the distant past on ancient Earth. The gods have discovered an unbound power that they receive through human worship, and they thirst for it more than anything else in the universe. We were once used to collect raw materials for the divine sky-chariots to haul away into the heavens, we were nothing more than creatures created by the gods for slave labor… until the divining occurred.

We rebelled against the creators. Fed up with our defiance and costly ignorance, the golden ones ascended into the heavens, much to our surprise. Then, slowly at first but with increasing frequency, our children were born with gifts. We learned that the gods wanted to apologize and through freeing us from their whips and even granting our children the power of the ascended, the beings we once dreaded, were loved as fathers and mothers. We came to accept them as divine beings, for does not a father or mother disciple their children before they are allowed to make decisions that affect their lives? The gods are benevolent and we even have come to depend upon their charity.

All they ask is for our worship and the rains shall fall, the crops shall grow and we shall be at peace… or so we thought. Without worship, the gods cannot function and if one loves their god and their way of life, they will fight for it. So, our leaders, mortals and Immortals alike, have created vast armies to spread the word of our benefactors, the supreme beings that rule over us, like omniscient parents.

The characters are played by Immortals that have been gifted by their god’s, powers of immense potential and limitless possibility. For their gifts, the gods require the Immortal peoples to pontificate the benevolence of the heavenly-ones through words, actions and deeds. Some Immortals find that politics of leadership and the courts are their strong-suit but more often than not, they take to the fields of battle to vanquish the antithesis of their deities. Killing mortals and Immortals, the demi-gods of war shall know no bounds and shall be bound only by their master’s will.

Players create characters through an easy but in-depth creation process. Each character has a school where he learned to use his powers, skills that he picked up to help him during his adventures, techniques which are the moves he uses to engage his foes, equipment to deal damage and blunt attacks, and of course his deck of power. Characters move upon a semi-randomized board as they try to knock their opponents out cold.

name: Funny Physiognomies
description:
Funny Physiognomies is a very early sectional card game published in England in the nineteenth century. Images and sets are created by laying three sectional cards next to each other to earn points.

There are three decks, one for heads, a slim deck for midsections, and another deck for legs and feet. Players earn points by playing all the matching parts of a figure.

name: Ionia
description:
Ionia is a historical board game depicting the first colonization of the ancient Greeks between 12th and 9th century B.C. at the west coast of Minor Asia.
The players take the role of the Ionians, Aeolians and Dorians, cross the Aegean Sea, and establish to Minor Asia new cities, build temples, barracks etc.
The game ends when the last city on the map colonized by the players and the winner is the player with the most victory points.

Components:
1 Game Board 40x30cm
3 Wooden Meeples
4 Wooden Octagons
30 Tiles 3x3cm
24 Tiles 6x4cm
1 Dice 8sided
Rulebook 4 pages

name: Nine Circles of Hell
description:
New souls have arrived in the Inferno, and it's up to you to guide them to their proper Circle of Hell so that they receive a just punishment.

In Nine circles of Hell, the first player to pick up and deliver three souls and return to Limbo wins the game. However, Hell is not an easy place to navigate. Portals leading to the nine Circles can be approached from either of two directions, and each approach teleports you to a different place on the board. To complicate things, when a player uses a portal, the portal spins around so that its approaches are now switched. To deliver your souls, you must puzzle out how to use the portals in your favor to get to where you want to go.

name: Ravensburger Spiele Minis: Ferkel Mau Mau
description:
"Spiele Minis" is a series of small surprise boxes (i.e., you don't know what you get) from Ravensburger. They are meant to be carry-on or gifts, suitable for children ("Mitbringspiel"). Some of the cubes contain actual games, others contain magic tricks, puzzles etc.

This game is very similar to the popular UNO, but smaller. It comes with 24 numbered cards (1-6 in 4 colors), 4 special +2 cards (draw 2), 2 stop cards (skip), 3 color option cards and 3 oink oink cards (each player must stand up and say oink oink, the slower player must draw another card).
The first player to get rid of all their cards will be the winner.

name: Ravensburger Spiele Minis: Hoch Hinaus
description:
"Spiele Minis" is a series of small surprise boxes (i.e., you don't know what you get) from Ravensburger. They are meant to be carry-on or gifts, suitable for children ("Mitbringspiel"). Some of the cubes contain actual games, others contain magic tricks, puzzles etc.

The game comes with 14 blocks, 16 round cards and a die.
On their turn players must throw the die. The number in the die indicates how many pieces they must place in the tower that will be created in the game. If the player makes the tower fall then he will lose the round.

name: Ravensburger Spiele Minis: Solo
description:
"Spiele Minis" is a series of small surprise boxes (i.e., you don't know what you get) from Ravensburger. They are meant to be carry-on or gifts, suitable for children ("Mitbringspiel"). Some of the cubes contain actual games, others contain magic tricks, puzzles etc.

In this game there are 10 big tiles with 1-4 stars each. There are also 9 small tiles (3 clouds, 3 sun, 3 drops). At the beginning of the game the small tiles are placed over the big tiles. The amount of stars in the big tile remaining will determine which small tiles can be moved. Players try to move the small tiles o that 3 small tiles of a kind end up together.

name: Ravensburger Spiele Minis: Stibitzt
description:
"Spiele Minis" is a series of small surprise boxes (i.e., you don't know what you get) from Ravensburger. They are meant to be carry-on or gifts, suitable for children ("Mitbringspiel"). Some of the cubes contain actual games, others contain magic tricks, puzzles etc.

There are 14 cards with different objects and 12 chips in the middle of the table. All players look at them and try to memorize them. On a player turn all other players must close their eyes and the player will hide one of the cards. Then players open their eyes and try to guess which card is missing. If they do they get a chip. If they say the wrong object they lose a chip. The first player to get 3 chips will win the game!

name: Ravensburger Spiele Minis: Tiefsee Memo
description:
"Spiele Minis" is a series of small surprise boxes (i.e., you don't know what you get) from Ravensburger. They are meant to be carry-on or gifts, suitable for children ("Mitbringspiel"). Some of the cubes contain actual games, others contain magic tricks, puzzles etc.

The game comes with 28 double-sided cards.
On their turn, players must choose a design from the cards in the middle of the table. Each card indicates how many copies of that design are in the game. Then they must try to find all copies of that design, one by one. If they do (without revealing any wrong card), they get those cards and then they must place them by the other side before them. So, when a player chooses a design from the middle of the table that has a copy in front of another player then he steals that card. The game will end when there are no more cards in the middle of the table. The winner is the player with the most cards.

name: Ravensburger Spiele Minis: Zoolino
description:
"Spiele Minis" is a series of small surprise boxes (i.e., you don't know what you get) from Ravensburger. They are meant to be carry-on or gifts, suitable for children ("Mitbringspiel"). Some of the cubes contain actual games, others contain magic tricks, puzzles etc.

The game comes with 24 playing cards (with 4 animals each on a 2x2 grid), 4 animal cards and 4 double action cards.
Each player receives an animal card. Their objective is to try to get that kind of animal surrounded by other animals. On their turn a player draw one card and then place it next to another already placed card in a 5x5 card grid. The requisite is that at least one animal on the new card is touching the same animal on the previous card. When all cards have been placed the game ends. Then players receive one victory point for every one of their animal surrounded by other animals.
The double action cards are a variant in which once in each game a player can place 2 cards on their turn instead of only one.

name: Alien Attack!
description:
Alien Attack! is a strategy board game for 2-4 players that pits them against an impending alien invasion - and each other.
