Includes new vehicles, datacards, how to build your army, updated combat groups and threat values plus options for the five Peace River factions:

- Peace River Defense Force (PRDF)
- Peace Officer Corps (POC)
- Home Guard Security Force (HGSF)
- Combined Task Force (CTF)
- Paxton Sponsored Badlands Militia (PSBM)

This 32 page book is an Army List for use with a copy of the most current Heavy Gear Blitz! Core Rulebook. Miniatures, six-sided dice, and a measuring tape are required for play.

For two or more players, ages 8 and up.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Res-Q
description:
From the rules:
--==--
Res-Q is a collectable card game based of amazing real rescues carried out in New Zealand, designed by a Rescue Helicopter Pilot.

A fun part of this game is simply collecting the cards of different and unusual scenarios, all of which actually happened.

There are 8 packs, each consisting of 18 different scenarios and a Miracle card and a Good Weather card. Look for an Unusual card - there's one in every 360 cards and a Very Unusual card - there's one in every 720 cards. Collect them to increase your odds of winning.

The object of Res-Q is to save the 'patient' and thereby win cards.
--==--

Each card has 2 functions:

1. Scenario
2. Equipment, vehicles and personnel

Each player in turn chooses a scenario and the other player plays equipment etc. Then the scenario card is flipped and points allocated from the played cards. If the requisite points have been reached the scenario is successfully completed. The player who is successful takes all the cards as points.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Collectible Components, Medical

name: Brockenfahrt  Eine Reise durch den schönen Harz
description:
Objective: be the first ending on space 89
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game - roll the die, move forward & follow instructions printed on lid inside if you end on a marked space.

Remarks:
Belongs to series: "Scholz' künstlerische Spiele";
Likely published ~1920s
Movers: pewter figures

name: Dodge a Dinosaur
description: The cavemen are out hunting but there is danger around every corner. You must help your caveman to avoid danger by keeping them as far away from the T-Rex as possible! The winner is not the first person to reach the end, instead you must use a little luck and the playing cards to dodge danger and avoid reaching the T-Rex's lair.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Escaletto: Das neue Rechenspiel
description: Each player has 5 meeples. To win the game the players must get them from the spaces 1-5 to the spaces 41-45 and then roll a 1 to get them on the colored triangle. To move their meeples one space they must roll a number by which the number on the space above them can be divided. This way more than one meeple can be moved per turn. If a 1 is rolled, all five meeples can move.

name: Horch Memory
description:
Pick up two of the face-down tin cans, shake each one. If the sounds are identical, you have a matching pair, keep it, and search for the next pair.
The 12 pairs of tin cans have transparent covers, each pair contains different seeds of different size, weight (and color, though the latter does not play a big role here – one could use it also as a standard memory game for hearing-impaired people, of course). Some similar sized seeds produce VERY similar sounds, so the game is not at all easy.
The game box also contains a booklet explaining the different seeds in detail (it unfortunately does not explain the game rules, but then any one familiar with Memory games will not need any explanation).
"Horch" is kind of an old-fashioned German word for "Listen!".

name: Die Schweigende Welt
description:
The players have to move 1 meeple (diver) from the starting space to space 90. The red spaces have special meanings, which are explained in the game rules. Also explained are several facts about diving and oceanic life. The winner is the player who gets the most playing chips on the red spaces.

The game was inspired by the 1956 documentary movie "Le Monde du silence" by Jacques-Yves Cousteau and the invention of the aqualung.
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Imperium Chronicles: Heroes of the Imperium Board Game
description:
Note: This game is no longer available. It was superseded by In Harm's Way Tactics which incorporates many of the mechanics of HofI.

Heroes of the Imperium is a cooperative card/board game set in a science fantasy universe called the Imperium Chronicles. Up to five players work together as heroes on missions against the enemies of the Imperium (Solo play is also supported).

Each new game begins with players choosing from one of six hero archetypes: Assassin, Duelist, Grunt, Medic, Officer, and Psi Mage. Each hero is represented by a Stat card listing his attributes and default abilities/attacks. Each hero also has a deck of Ability cards from which the player can choose up to five. Some Ability cards are marked as "Advanced" and count as two cards. This allows players to choose fewer, but more powerful cards if they wish.

Once player have chosen their heroes and Ability cards, they select a mission to be played. Each mission description includes which enemies will be encountered and what goals the player must meet to win. An Encounter deck can also be used (especially for solo players) to randomize which enemies will be fought during the mission.

Each mission also includes a map of the game board. The board consists of several tiles that players assemble prior to the beginning of play. Paper miniatures, representing both heroes and enemies, are placed on the board and moved on a turn-by-turn basis. Each turn allows players to carry out several actions including attacking, movement, and using items. Control of the enemy side is either done by a single player who chose not to have a hero, or by hero players on a rotating basis.

Enemies in the game are grouped into three main factions: the primitive Ferans, slave-trading Ougluks, and the technologically advanced Warlock Industries. Each enemy, like the heroes, has a Stat card listing its attributes and default abilities/attacks. They do not, however, get additional Ability cards.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Sand, Oil, and Blood: Armored Combat in the 1990's
description:
From the back of the book:

A fast moving miniatures game that provides the feel of modern warfare. Land, sea and air units interact on a 3D battlefield. Armored thrusts are met by guided missiles, APDS rounds, and attack choppers. Defensive positions are pounded by aircraft and artillery, as infantry are all present. All the rules and data you need to refight Desert Storm or other scenarios are included. All you supply is miniatures, dice, and enthusiasm.

While data has been included for all of the major weapon systems of the War in the Gulf, this book is suitable for simulating modern armored combat anywhere in the world.

Includes:
- Rules for modern micro armour
- Complete rules for three dimensional combat
- Data for over 70 vehicles, 40 aircraft, and boats
- Complete combat charts and templates
- Organization charts for over 50 Allied and Iraqi units

122 page softback book

While this book includes 1980 through 2000 period weapons and vehicles, the rules can be used for any period 1914 through today. Each model represents a vehicle or fire team/squad depending upon historical organizations. 1 inch = 50m ground scale, each turn is 1 minute of movement/combat capability (really 5 minutes of time when we account for command and control). Complementary books include Mekong...Vietnam and Frontlines: Korea 1950-53, which also include the full rules.

Available from MSD Games within the Frontlines Series www.msdgames.com

name: Trolley Ride
description:
"Game of the Trolley Ride" is typical race spin and move game.
First player starting on Washington street, from the station, moves checker as shown by the indicator.
The player first completing the trip around the line, wins the game.

name: Get Wasted
description:
Get Wasted is english version of the czech most popular beer drinking game Chlastej!

Goal of the game:
You are sitting with your friends in a beautiful pub and think what the hell are we going to do? One of you challenges
everybody to a Competition the first who gets lucky at the whore house wins! Everyone is in so the point of this game is clear –
get from the pub to the whore house first and give the best performance ever. Unfortunately after those few beers the way isnt as easy as it might seem and first you need is a pass from your local pimp. This pass is also confirmation that you have enough money to pay and you can still give a solid performance. You are always leaving the pub with a full pint of beer. On your way through the fields you drink gradually from your pint.

Players rolls the dice and move on the game plan. When the game say player have to drink (usually beer).
First player in the whore house is the winner of the game.

English version Get Wasted is only translation of the popular czech game Chlastej!

name: Chetyrestan
description:
A game for 2 players by Stefano Negro.

In the Glorious Republic of Chetyrestan, Comrades are being assigned different accommodations to live in. Players are government planners giving a place to stay to everyone while trying to create a peaceful and functional city.

Components

6 City Stripes (6×1 squares). Each square is in one of the three Building colors (white, black, or green).

36 Buildings divided into:


12 Class A Flat
12 Class B Flat
12 Class C Flat


36 Comrades divided into:


12 Diplomats
12 Bureaucrats
12 Workers


8 District Tokens (2×A, 2×B, 2×C, 2×D)

1 Supervisor Token

Aim of the game

The players place/move Buildings and Comrades trying to get 4 Buildings or 4 Comrades of the same colour in an orthogonal or diagonal row multiple times to create a functional district in Chetyrograd (in order to get rewards).

name: Chain Letters
description:
FROM THE BOX:
Chain Letters is a rapid fire game base on the popular TV show. That will test your word power through three exciting rounds.


Race to build up the longest chain of words!
Booby Trap your opponent - predict their next move!
Solve the clue and guess the word to win the game!


Can you make twenty new words starting from BYTE - in just 2 minutes?

Contents:

1 pack of word cards - 600 different start words
4 score pads & pencils
4 privacy screens
1 timer
1 die
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: BrainBox: Die Welt entdecken
description:
From the publisher:
The object of the game is to win as many cards as possible in ten minutes. The first player takes a card from the Brainbox and turns the timer over. The player then has ten seconds to study the picture on the card. When the timer runs out the card is passed to player two and player one rolls the die to see which question is to be asked. The questions are on the reverse of the picture card. Player Two checks the answer by looking at the picture and if it is correct the card is given back to Player One to keep. If the answer is wrong the card is placed back into the Brainbox and the next player chooses a card. Please remember, the answer to the question is on the picture side of the card, so look carefully! The player with the most cards after ten minutes wins! If there is a tie, it's sudden death with both players choosing a card and having to answer all eight questions on the card. The player who answers the most correctly wins! For 1 player Look at the card as above for ten seconds. Then turn the card over and answer all the questions (use a pen and paper to record the answers). If all questions are answered correctly the card is kept. If any answers are incorrect, the card has to be put back in the Brainbox. See how many cards you have after five or ten minutes.

name: Piffle: An Outlandish Card Game
description:
Piffle challenges players to win obstacle cards by telling nonsense stories while using strategy to outwit opponents.

Players split into teams or play solo against one another. The
number of teams doesn't matter, but the players should sit
opposite their teammate.

Your team plays Gear, Hero, & Conflict cards to generate points
against the Obstacle.

Each time a player lays down a card they must describe a
story taking place.

Players who are the last to play a card against an obstacle defeat it.

The winner of the game is the team or person who earns 5 obstacle cards.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Number, Print & Play

name: GEMS: the mining game
description:
A fast and exciting game with a unique multi level board and operating system. about digging gems out of the board.
This is done by firstly throwing a colour dotted dice and digging the gem of that colour, after the first turn you can use the gems you have already dug to activate the board to dig various different actions, from TWO'S UP, digging a gem and the one underneath, LUCKY STRIKE, dig and two gems of the same type, ALL CHANGE, which allows you to turn the board and change which gem does which action, and you get to take two different gems of your choice, WHITE WONDER, this allows you to dig a diamond, this is the only way to get them.
This is all done with the aim to collect as many of one gem as possible which will score you more the more you have plus the diamonds which each have a fixed value. The winner is the one with the most points.

name: Das Warum-Quiz
description:
Why stars shine? Why tiger has stripes? And why the flowers smell? Can you answer these questions already? Test your knowledge on the topics: animals, environment, science and discoveries, idioms, the earth, the human body and nature.

Correct answer gives You point. There are 100 cards in this game. If the deck is exhausted the player with the most points wins.

name: Das Quiz der Tiere
description: How well do you know from the animal kingdom? Test your knowledge with your friends or your family with this exciting quiz with 100 cards. Each correct answer gives You a point. If the deck is exhausted the player with the most cards wins.

name: Rrrunter vom Bock!
description: The goal of Rrrunter vom Bock! is to occupy the center space (bock) with a meeple. The meeples move according to the roll of a die. Whenever a player gets a meeple on the bock, he gets a coin from the cash box and the meeple which previously occupied the bock, is eliminated from the game. Meeples which pass space 17 are also eliminated. Each player has 4 meeples. The player of the last meeple to occupy the bock, gets the rest of the coins in the cash box and wins the game. Meeples which get thrown out by other meeples can be brought back into the game again, if they are not thrown out by other meeples of the same color. If a meeple has passed the bock it can be brought back to the starting Point, if it gets on Space 13 or 17 (or is thrown out by an opposing meeple). The game was published in the 1930s and 40s.

name: Whooooo
description:
From the dealer catalog description:

"Only the wise old owl knows whooooo will win in the fun-filled action game for youngsters. Just roll the three marbles down the chute formed by the owl's beak for the highest score. If you're lucky you might land in the 'double score' slot ... or on 'sorry - no score.' So easy to play, kids will take to Whooooo faster than an owl can bat an eye.

Contains: Unassembled 3-D game board, 3 marbles."

name: Space-mission: Zanathar
description:
A roll-and-move race to the finish for two players, Space-mission: Zanathar incorporates two types of pieces for each player and luck-based battles on the way to the central goal of "Zanathar," where the first player to land his Command ship and two Star ships will win the game.

Each player has one Command ship and eight Star Ships. The board has each player entering from a different side and spiraling from one numbered base to another toward the central goal. What moves each player makes depends on the roll of a die. Moves include continuing forward towards the goal, combat with one of the opponent's pieces, starting over at the beginning, or overshooting the goal and re-orbiting nearby for another attempt.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Autorennen
description: The objective of this car race is to be the first player to reach the finish line. The movement of the cars is determined by a number die. On certain spaces on the track a color die is used to decide, if the result of the number die can be used or if the player has to skip the turn. On space 56 a black result on the color die eliminates the player from the game (carcrash). The game was published in the 1950s.

name: Weltraum-Station Nr. 1
description:
The objective of the game is to get 2 meeples (spaceships) from the starting area to the space station in the center of the board and back to earth on the opposite side of the board. The spaces on the board are holes. Below the board there is a rotating disk with some more holes in it. If a meeple falls in a hole it has to start at the beginning again. Whenever a meeple gets on a space of it's own color, the player has to rotate the disk in a direction of his choice. Thereby the player changes the color of the spaces and the postion of the holes, which may cause some meeples to fall back to earth. The winner is the player who is the first to get both meeples to the landing area.

The game was published in the 1950s.

name: Gold-Gräber
description: The goal of the game is to eliminate all other players and be the last with a tent on the board. To accomplish this, the players have to search for gold and steal tents from each other. The tents are moved by the roll of a die. If a tent reaches a space with an opposing tent, it's put over this tent and has captured it. Captured tents can be freed by the same maneuver. Freed and captured tents can be secured or released by taking them to one's base camp. Tents arriving at the gold claim at the center of the board get one goldnugget. For 3 nuggets a player can get a captured tent back.

name: Pinke Pinke
description:
Objective:
Using a board similar to Backgammon collect the most money after all others go bankrupt.

- acting by turns -
Roll 2 dice: correspondent to result place money on related (empty) space (2-12); if concerned space is already filled up earn that money.

Special rules: space 3 must be filled by all other player except active one; a '2' offers additional choices - split or pay. If you've collected money you may roll the dice again

A '12' lets you earn all money in between spaces 4-11, or (worst case) fill them up.

Remarks:
Game was played already during the age of the mercenaries (~1600's); 'PINKE' means money or dough (coins only).

name: Iron Maiden: The Ultimate Ed-Venture Strategy Game
description: Travel across time and space in Iron Maiden: The Ultimate Ed-Venture Strategy Game competing with other players to collect Lyrics, Tour Stops, Instruments, T-Shirts, and Albums to be the first to unlock one of the faces of Eddie, The Monster of Metal, and carry out his destiny!

name: The Game of Shopping
description:
The Game of Shopping is played with two types of cards: Money cards and goods cards. There are 35 money cards totaling $23.35. There are 16 goods cards.

Players draw money cards from pile and use the money to buy goods offered for sale. The twist is that items, or a collection of items must be bought with the exact amount. So if a player makes a partial payment "on account," then a following player can get the item by paying the exact balance due. On his turn a player may also aggregate items into a collection. The total cash in the game is exactly equal to the total value of all of the goods. The winner is the player with the highest value of goods when all goods have been bought.

name: The Mall
description:
The Mall is a money spending game. Every player starts with hefty sum which he needs to get rid off by any means possible. Buying clothes, gadgets, or simply going to the movies.

Moving is determined by dice rolling and visiting the stores, by a special roulette.

Problem is, that unlike real life, it turns out to be quite a chore, and not at all easy...
Sometimes the goods are not expensive enough, or unfortunately just on sale. Other times a simple hot dog would do the trick for your tummy, but sadly, not for your wallet.
But no matter what, you always should take care, not to win the lottery....

The game is won when a player has managed to spend all his money, or has bought enough variety of goods.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Molecula
description:
Molecula is a 2 player connection game.

The board consists of two staggered 9x9 diamond plate like grids with cells running along the outer perimeter numbered 1-2-3-1-2-3-1-2-3 etc.

Objective - One player tries to create a connected chain of his like color stones from North to South, while his opponent tries the same from East to West, whoever accomplishes this first-wins.

Play- Two players, Black and White, take turns placing two stones of their color onto empty cells and then moving a marker in sequence along the numbered track starting on any cell marked #1 following a clockwise direction.

Player 1 only on his first turn places 1 stone onto any empty cell, after this, players take turns placing 2 stones onto empty cells a distance apart equal to the number currently marked on the numbered track.

The player that first claims at least half of the cells adjacent to one of his previously placed stones gets to claim the remainder of the adjacent cells to that previously placed stone, his opponent may not play onto those cells.

Empty spaces, friendly or enemy stones may lie between the two stones placed on your turn.

Note: Only adjacent cells are considered connected, so two cells separated by a 4-pointed star are not considered connected.

name: SAT.1 Bingo
description:
Based on the short-lived German game show of the same name that ran from 1991-1992 on SAT.1 for which in turn is based on the short-lived American game show Trump Card for which in turn was based on the British game show Bob's Full House.

A player is host, the other playing against each other. Each player gets a bingo tablet which has the numbers 1-15. In the middle of the table, the chips come. There always three quizzes played. In the first round of quiz is about the four corner squares on the bingo tablet. Who could cover these fields with answer chip first, wins that round. The moderator asks a question from the question stack, the player who first gets "BINGO", then may say the solution. If you are correct, he or she is allowed to occupy a corner with a chip, the answer is wrong, the player has to suspend for one round. Once all questions have been asked a map, the next red card is drawn. Once all of the corner squared occupied, the winner gets 5 points credited, all the other players get as many pluses as they have covered chips. After the second game round begins. The chips from the first round, however, remain lying on the tablet. During the second round should you fill the middle of the first three rows of chips, also get all the players according to the number of chips on the tablet points in payroll. The winner will be credited 10 points this time. As the yellow question cards are taken. And here, the chips remain on the panel. In the third round, the game works gain similar to the previous one has here blue cards, the player must now cover all remaining fields with chips and the winner gets 20 points added to his or her account. Those who could collect the most points after all three rounds, may eventually challenge the Super Bingo round. If he or she wins the round, so doubled his/her score. Otherwise, they halved. We play with final game screen, which is a 5x5 large square with the number 1-25. Now the hourglass comes to train. The player has the task within 60 seconds to form a line of 5 fields with the chips either horizontally, vertically or diagonally. It is also worked here with the blue question cards. The player always calls the first field which he/she must prove with a chip, then reads the question before the host. If this answered correctly, a white chip is placed on the field, otherwise a black chip is placed. Now the player is called quickly to the next field on which he/she would place his/her stone.

The game ends after 60 seconds. The winner is the player who can have the most points after all four rounds.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Push Your Luck

name: Kreuz und quer durch den Verkehr
description:
Every player gets a car and has to get from the starting space at the gas station to his garage. On the way the players have to mind the traffic rules. On spaces with a blue or black disk, the player has to draw a card and must follow its instructions. The first player to reach his garage wins the game.

The game has to be been published in 1952 or early 1953 because the logo "BV Aral" was first used in 1952 and the traffic signs were revised in 1953. "Halt, Vorfahrt auf der Hauptstraße beachten" was changed to "Halt, Vorfahrt achten".
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Going Places
description:
Pack your bags for a journey across the globe!

Travel from continent to continent and visit different cities on your way around the world. But hurry up and choose the quickest route. First to return to their hometown is crowned Globetrotter!

Each player receives one Destination card to determine his or her starting position, or "hometown". Another 15 Destination cards are then dealt to each player. The goal is to plan a round trip from your "hometown" via the 15 destinations.

To aid the traveler, train stations, airports and harbors are available as a quick travel option if a player has a corresponding Compass card. The Compass cards can help or stall your trip in a number of ways, including changing the outcome of the game. A player is never safe until he or she has returned home!

Designed for 2-4 players and takes you on a different path around the world each round!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Die wilden Fussballkerle: 1, 2, 3 Rrraaaa
description:
This is a card game based on the German children's book "Die wilden Fussballkerle".

Two teams are facing each other on the pitch, symbolized by the two player pawns placed on the table. Each player simultaneously reveals a card that shows the goalkeeper or a striker of either team and a number representing the strength of that player. If the sum of the cards for one of the strikers exceeds the sum of the cards for the opposing goalkeeper the striker has scored and players now quickly need to grab the player pawn in the correct color. The fastest player receives a victory point chip. If you grab the wrong pawn you lose two chips instead.

At the end of the match the player with the most chips wins the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Novel-based

name: Walk the Plank
description:
A simple luck-based pirate-themed race game that requires some very basic map reading.

The board is a characterful map of a sea with islands and coastlines. Each player takes a list of locations and moves his or her pirate between locations in the order that they appear on his or her list. However, after arriving at a location or being caught by a fellow pirate, a player must pick up a card which may force him or her wildly off course.

The first to visit all of the locations on one's list in order is the winner.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ravenous 5
description:
Ravenous 5 is a zombie and survivor collectible card game. The game is designed to allow the player to use all Ravenous 5 cards as both a traditional Collectible Card Game and as an Expandable Card Game. There are story driven expansions that tour across North America and to the other continents, with characters and zombies unique to the Ravenous 5 world. Players can choose from 9½ factions that have their own unique strengths and weaknesses. The first Starter set will include four of the factions including:

- Civilian, which heals and defends
- Military, which deals damage and destruction
- Corporate, which plays counters and interference
- Occult, with esoteric rites that allow you to power up your zombie attacks

Ravenous 5 features stunning artwork created by a talented team of artists from all around the world.

Game play is styled to support a tournament system for local store play and the unique play style means you will never have to wait for resource cards - play is fast and furious. There are two different play modes: standard and hardcore. Standard games usually last between 10 and 15 minutes while hardcore games are between 5 and 10 minutes. A compatible online game for later release will allow harmonious play with physical stores as well as the online community.

The game is fast paced and allows players to take the roles of both survivors and zombies to battle it out in the apocalyptic world. Players takes turns playing cards in a system designed to play without requiring a player to wait for resource cards. Deck building and play strategy allow cards to be played for free or with resources from hand, deck, or locations.

Players send zombies to attack their opponents supply cache (deck) and defend their own much needed resources with their survivors. Play continues until one side runs out of supplies (cards). Players build decks of 60 cards, generally made of 30 faction cards and 30 strain (zombie) cards. There are several types of cards to choose from:

- Survivors, which makes up your defensive forces
- Zombies, to make up your offensive forces
- Locations, that allow you to gain bonus resources, and to increase the defense and attack power of your side
- Enhancements, which can add an edge to your survivors. They can include anything from skills to guns and even occult artifacts.
- Evolutions, that power up your zombies and turn them into killing machines or cunning hunters.
- Events, where survivors can perform unique custom actions that can turn the tide of battle.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Zombies

name: Riposte!
description: Fast-paced 2-player card game inspired by the sport of fencing. Players throw down 'attack' cards to move the action forward, and also move an 'pawn' game piece on the 'fencing strip' game board. Opponents try to counter with a proper defense card to steal the right-of-way and counter-attack. First player to throw down three successive attacks or to push their opponent off the end of the strip score a touch. First to 5 or 15 wins the bout. The strategy recalls real fencing, but so does the speed, sometimes giving you no time for strategy.

name: Sheep!
description: Fast-paced, light-hearted card game, where the object is to steal all the 'sheep' of one of four colors. The card you play determines who you get to steal from, and who gets to play next. The action jumps around the table between 4 players at increasingly fast speed, with no set pattern. You have to concentrate on what you're trying to steal, what everyone else is going for, and what you've got left, not to mention what card just got played.

name: Last Stand
description:
The collapse occurred in winter.

At first the losses were isolated and simple. As time progressed, the spread claimed more and with it came revolution. The Government fell shortly after, and the many who had 'just in case' emergency plans, found themselves in isolation. Some lost their minds and others simply starved.

The few of us that remain are left in a bleak and desolate landscape. Supplies are scarce and the enemy is strengthening, but we all share the will to survive. With what little hope remains, we band together and make our Last Stand.

Last Stand is a cooperative survival simulation. Players will find themselves in a massive city with dwindling resources that is slowly being overrun with Infected. During the day, players can explore and take actions. They will have many opportunities to build bases, get supplies, assign survivors, fight and make use of special abilities. When Night falls, the Infected roam, but they are not the only threat. Starvation, sickness and the loss of humanity are a few of the other dangers that await.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Enclosure, Grid Movement, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Parsimony: The Game of Money Management
description:
A game about saving money to deposit at your local credit union.

Components: four pawns, one die, four Ledger sheets (laminated heavy cardboard), one large game board, play money.

Each player starts with $1.00 in their deposit box; the game is a race to make it to the end of the 37-space track to deposit whatever money they have at the Credit Union. Boxes on the track give minor rewards and penalties of 10 or 16 cents on the way there, so the 50 cent bonus for being the first is substantial. However, players must carefully record their debits and credits in wax crayon on the erasable Ledger Sheet each turn as the 50 cent penalty for having incorrect books is also substantial.

Parsimony- a well-named game every child could enjoy: sitting quietly, taking turns, making correct notes, and hanging on to small sums of money like grim death in order to hand it over to a bank at the end of the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Panzer!
description:
Panzer! is a near-future (at the time) variant for Panzer Division that pits Chinese vs. Soviet forces. It can be considered an official variant since it is by that game's designer (and publisher).

The variant uses Panzer Division maps and most of its rules, but does add and change some rules, primarily those related to fire zones and line of sight. Rules are added for anti-tank guided missiles.

The variant includes paper counters which would need to be colored, mounted, and cut out.

Panzer! was published in Combat! #5.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Original Fußball-Würfel-Spiel
description:
A player wins the game if he hits five goals, or hits the most goals inside a prearranged time. Each player has five meeples, but plays only one meeple (ball) at a time. If he hits a goal, he uses the next meeple. The movement of the meeples is determined by a die. When a ball gets on a space of its own color it gets kicked forward along the arrow. If it gets on a space of the opponents color, it gets kicked back. The game board has two sides, a simple one and one that's more complex.

The game was made in GDR.

name: Board Game Heroes
description:
A dice battle platform for your favorite board game hero/miniature or anything you want.

OVERVIEW

Board Game Heroes is especially designed for The Game Crafter and for people who like board games and MOBA (Multiplayer-Online Battle Arena) games. This game was made similar to MOBA and also designed for board/table top gamers, especially to those who like dice battle game. Basically, this game is a platform for your favorite board game heroes/miniatures. This serves as battle arena which battles thru dice result and skill cards.

OBJECTIVE

The objective of this game is to destroy the enemy base by pushing your opponent heroes until you reach their base; Each base has 5 life points and there are 14 tiles from your starting lane up to your opponents base. Gain Mana equal to the result of your movement and draw skill card whenever you stepped on the Blue Tile, use your skill card to either advance & stall your enemy on same lane.

name: Quot
description:
The abstract strategy game Quot has one simple rule: you must control surrounding spaces to claim new ones.

The game starts by using 13 of the 20 unique two-sided mats to construct the board. You will never play the same game twice, so you will always be challenged to adapt your strategy to the layout of the board.

Each board space displays a value from zero to four. This value indicates how many adjacent spaces you must control to claim that space. Take turns competing with your opponent to take spaces that allow new moves while also limiting your opponent's options.

Quot encourages players to anticipate their opponent's moves and develop a strategy to secure the largest area as possible. If you claim enough space to run your opponent out of possible moves, you win!

name: Maineopoly
description: Produced mid-1980's as a fund raiser for Junior Achievement in the Portland, Maine area. Instead of streets, local businesses were featured with the smallest being Mr. Potato (a baked potato and fixings fast food restaurant at the Maine Mall food court) and the largest being Unum (a large insurance company). The game also substituted 'customers' and 'groups of customers' for the houses and hotels used in the normal version of the game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Winterfreuden
description:
Goal: Be the first to race to position '50' (alpine cabin)

Typical 'Snakes and Ladders'/Roll&Move game from the 1930's in Germany

Roll the die by turns and step forward - until you end on a marked space follow instructions (lid inside).
nice & cute, individually designed pawns

name: Rodel-Spiel
description:
Goal: Be the first to race to position '100'
Typical 'Roll&Move' game

Roll the die by turns and step forward - until you end on a red marked space follow instruction (lid inside)
nice & cute designed pawns

remarks:
likely published late 1900/early 1910s

name: Aus dem Weltraum zurück
description: The players go on a round trip through space. The player who is the fastest to get his three spaceships back to earth wins the game. This has not to be the Player, who is the first to bring all three spaceships back, the spaceships get points awarded accordingly to their arrival back on earth. The game is played with one die on the blue spaces and two dice on the green spaces. The red spaces are event-spaces, which are explained in the game rules.

name: Schmücke Dich fein: Negerlein!
description:
A ring toss game. The game pieces are a black head with ear hooks, and 3 x 3 (green, yellow, red - 2.7/2.0/1.2 inches) rings.

The players toss rings and try to hook them on the ears.
At the beginning players agree on victory conditions.

The instructions are on the back of the lid.

Similar to Smoking Sambo Ring Toss and The Game of Sambo

name: All About Charleston, South Carolina
description:
The object of All About Town is for players, using dice and playing pieces, to acquire 8 Travel cards by moving around the game board. You can adjust the length of the game by changing the number of collected cards required to win.

Players can acquire money from Banks and Money Spaces. Surprise Spaces allow players to draw Surprise Cards that provide money, movement, both or cause them to lose a turn. Whenever a player acquires a Travel Card, another one is turned up.

All About Town: Charleston, South Carolina appears to have been sponsored by Charleston, SC businesses. Ads for various business appear on the rulebook, Surprise Cards, Travel Cards and money, some with addresses and phone numbers to those businesses. For instance, the money features: $1 Piggly Wiggly, $5 Flower Market & Flowers Unique, $10 Mighty TMA 1250AM, $20 Whistler's, $50 The News and Courier: The Evening Post, $100 Liberty National Bank. A full Participant Listing appears on the back of the rulesheet.

Part of the All About Town family of games.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: MicroSoccer
description:
A fast-paced soccer flicking game featuring over 30 unique teams. Each team has star players with different special powers that allow players to bend the rules in their favor! In this game, players use indoor sized teams (6 players per team). This game is extremely tiny and each team is available separately in little boxes about the size of ice cubes.

Play is simple. Players take turns. On his/her turn a player may flick one if his/her pieces.

name: Hong Kong Postman Delivery Game
description: Hong Kong Postman Delivery Game, a new PostShop product designed by local designers, was developed under a cooperative workshop between School of Design, Polytechnic University and Hongkong Post. The design of Postman Delivery Game is based on the daily work of Hongkong Post postmen. To win the game, players have to deliver all the mail in hand to the corresponding destinations on the gameboard and be the first one to get back to the General Post Office. During the play, player would encounter various challenges and obstacles. The gameboard incorporates landmarks and local elements of Hong Kong, allowing you to know more about the city and Hongkong Post.
mechanics: Area Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: A Fistful of Honey
description:
A Fistful of Honey is a free one-page ruleset for old west showdowns using Eureka Miniatures' 28 mm line of teddy bear cowboy minis, The Good, The Bad and The Cuddly.

Opponents are dealt a hand of standard playing cards. The hand is played out, activating figures according to the color of the suit. Move, shoot, repeat. Movement and combat ranges are measured. Combat requires a clear line-of-sight and is decided by guessing the suit of the next card drawn.

The object of the game is to run the opposing bears out of town.

name: Maggi's Abenteuer-Spiel
description:
There are two teams (explorers and native africans). Each team has 16 chips. The chips are moved by flicking them with a small disk from one area of the game board to another. The players start in their own camp and try to get their chips into the opponent's camp. Chips which are flicked beyond the board are eliminated from the game, same as chips which are hit by opponent chips. Some areas of the board and some chips have special meanings which are explained in the game rules.

The game is over when one team can't move any chips. The team with the most points (for reaching the opponent's camp, crossing the river and chips left on the board) wins the game.

This game is an early Swiss merchandizing product of the 1940s.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Children's Game, Exploration

name: Munter immer runter!
description:
Each player gets 10 meeples. All meeples start in the center hole in the game board. At all times each Player has only 1 meeple on the board. The meeples begin on the space of their color on the inner circle and try to get to the spaces of their color on the outher circle. If a meeple gets on an occupied space, the opponent gets thrown back into the center hole to start again. When a meeple gets on a space of its own color on the outher circle, it vanishes into the hole of the same color. If there are meeples on the two other spaces of this color, they get captured and are thrown into the hole too.

The winner is the player who has the most meeples in his compartment under the game board at the end of the game.

name: Seifenkisten Rennen
description:
Objective: be the first to pass finish line.
Moving by turn/simple 'Roll and Move' game.
Each player pays entry fee before starting.
Drive through the board until you reach space 70.
If you land on a marked space follow instructions.
First gets all (prior agreed award).

Remarks:
Very similar to Motorrad-Rennen
Even (non-matching) meeples were used.
Likely published during 1930's.

name: Station FX 2
description:
The goal of the game is to travel with a rocket to the space station, from there with a spaceship to Mars or Venus and back to the space Station, change into the rocket and return to earth. The moves are determined by a die. To make this difficult, the station moves one space per game turn. The first player to return to earth wins the game.

The game was published in the 1950s or '60s.

name: Die Feuerinsel
description:
Each player gets 3 animals and starts from any 3 white spaces in the blue area. The Goal is to encircle the opponents in the yellow area so they can't move anymore. If the opponent stands on a blue space, he is put back into the blue area. If he is standing on a red space, he is put in the red area and is eliminated from the game. The last player who has at least 2 animals on the board wins the game.

The game was published in the 1930s or 1940s.

name: Superwurm
description:
Game description from the publisher:

In the beautifully designed memory game Superwurm, the young players need to find all of the animals from the popular children's book Superwurm: toad children, little beetles, bees, snails, tiny spiders and, of course, Superwurm the Superstar!

name: Was ist Was: Fußball Quiz-Spiel
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Which club won the Champions League final in 2013? What is tackling? What's part of the mandatory equipment a football player must wear? Was ist Was: Fußball Quiz-Spiel is all about important facts, exciting games and strange happenings in soccer, and whoever wants to know more about the most popular sport in the world will face exciting questions and discover informative texts.

name: Die drei ??? Kids: Spur des Drachen
description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Die drei ??? Kids: Spur des Drachen, a mysterious thief is on the loose in Rocky Beach! With his uncanny dragon mask, he spreads fear and terror. There are many suspects, and each could be the dragon — but Justus, Peter and Bob follow a hot trail and the players help to unmask the offender before he can make off with his booty.

name: Teddy Bear Game
description:
Contents:
24 teddy bear cards, 6 picnic basket picture cards, 4 picnic blanket boards,
1 color spot die

How to Play
A player rolls the color spot die and then turns over a matching card. If it is a teddy bear card or a zero, they place it on their board. If it is part of the picnic basket, they place it on the picnic basket. If there are no cards left that match the color rolled, they do not take a card.

Object
To collect the most teddy bears on your picnic blanket before the picnic basket picture is completed.

name: Crazy Cat: Verrückte Welt
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Crazy Cat: Verrückte Welt is a colorful memory game set in the world of Crazy Cat. In the game, players help Crazy Cat and her boyfriend Funny Dog find items in the desired category.

name: This is the Town of Thieves
description:
User summary:

A quick "jump out in time" card game for 3–4 players. Cards representing gentlemen thieves are wandering around the table, and players take turns either playing a new treasure on their thief, or bailing out and taking what they have. As cards can be played either face up and face down, jumping out in time is crucial. The last player gets everything that's left, which normally is good but can be devastating.

name: Was ist Was: Junior – Baustelle
description:
Game description from the publisher:

What's going on at the construction site? Houses are being built, roads paved, and concrete pumps are pouring basement walls. In Was ist Was - Junior: Auf der Baustelle, discovery tokens show excerpts of the giant building scene, and everyone searches at the same time to find excavators, wheel loaders, concrete mixers, dump trucks and more before anyone else.

name: Crazy Cat: Ab in den Eimer!
description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Crazy Cat: Ab in den Eimer!, you search in the garbage can with Crazy Cat for all sorts of fun things with which to play. Find something good? Whoosh, into the bucket! Who will be the first to fill his bucket in this collection game?

name: Majority Rules: Unrated Expansion Pack
description: The pack includes 25 questions that were created during "intense product testing" and that were not deemed appropriate for a family game or the general public either because the activities described were maybe too extreme or too sexual.

name: Crazy Cat im Müll-Versteck
description:
Game description from the publisher:

All sorts of great things wait to be found hiding in the garbage! In Crazy Cat im Müll-Versteck, you'll need to put the puzzle together and start looking for these treasures. Who will be first to discover Crazy Cat and her things among the trash?

name: Goof't
description: Up to 4 circus animals are assembled through a series of dice rolls. Each player takes a turn and rolls the dice assembling the animal out of one of the 6 cardboard sections based on the result of the dice roll. Turns can be lost if the dreaded "GOOF" side show up or if a part already used comes up. The winner assembles their complete animal first.

name: Thoth
description: Thoth is a solitaire print-and-play card game of 72 cards in which a player marshals Egyptian-themed forces to combat the gods. There are two decks - one player, one an automatic foe engine - and the goal is to acquire a minimum of 12 points by the end of 15 turns. Developing buildings are worth 2 points, Units and Resources are worth 1 point. If 12 points are collected and held by the end of any round prior to 15, the player wins.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Mythology, Print & Play
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management

name: Vîro
description:
Vîro is inspired by ideas in microbiology. In this asymmetric strategy game, one player plays as the invasive virus while the other player plays as the defending immune system.

Players alternate turns moving pieces across a hexagon grid. When pieces collide, they cancel each other out and are both removed from the board in an even exchange. The virus has the added ability of multiplying (adding additional pieces to the board) and the immune system is able to place “immunoboosters” which destroy any piece they fall on and change the playable area of the board.

The goal of the virus is to complete the infection by getting a single point to a certain point on the opposite end of the board. Blue wins if it effectively eliminates the virus from the board or permanently blocks the virus from reaching its goal point.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Game of 190
description: The Game of 190, a Bingo-like game, uses 190 cards. Each card features three rows of nine squares, with five squares in each row containing one or two letters. Ninety balls with one or two letters on them are drawn from a bag and called out, and written down on a chart. Each player has one of the 190 cards, and checks to see if any letters on the card correspond to those called out. Any that match are covered with a marker. The first player to have five markers in a row wins the game.

name: Yogi Finders
description:
From the Manufacturer:

Yogi Finders is a quick paced, fun-filled matching game that introduces players to the joy of yoga, challenges visual perception, enhances coordination, increases flexibility and sharpens observation skills. Get ready for fun. Flip over your cards to reveal a yoga pose. Quickly scan the board, find the match and hold the pose to keep the card. Be the first player to collect 10 cards and you win.

name: Awaken Destruction
description:
From the designer:

Awaken Destruction is a modern day card game that sets you and your dragon against other champions and their dragons, with the help of Government force, combat mechs, small armies and assassins as well as your own unique cards and abilities. This is a war type fighting game utilizing cards and dice. Unique game mechanics, multiple target options, independent enemies and allies and battlefield teleportation makes AD an amazing card game experience to be enjoyed by hard core card gamers as well as the casual gamer alike.

Champion abilities are totally unique to the powers they have. What does that mean? Take for example the blood champion, her power and power beasts cards will have different effects from those of different champions. She has combo type power cards where as the water champion has evolution type power cards. Another example is the fire champion having preload damage type power cards(Preload is a type of card where you use currency to determine the time or damage a card will perform before its played) where as the imagination champion will be very location specific. All that to say, skilled play will be vital to winning, not just having the best cards.

Awaken Destruction will give you all the tools you need to build a great deck to start and you compete to make them stronger. There are no additional packs to buy after the initial purchase unless a champion update comes out. Your starter deck will have the maximum number of each card your champion can have and then you can tailor it down to your style of game play. There is no random card pack selling going on in AD. If a champion update is released, you will know every single card in that update before you buy it. We feel this method allows players to spend more time playing and less time spending.

You haven't played a card game like this before. I never played TCGs prior to designing AD. When I created this, I had no idea what was already out on the market or what had come before me. I created a game I felt would be very fun to play, a skill based game that rewards a players abilitiy to think and adapt changing strategies as they play. You are not out of this game just because you are down at the moment. Cards and luck can change in an instant. Its kind of an emotional rollercoaster at times. Ive been down and out for what I thought was a no win senario and the independant enemies came in and rocked the other player and gave me that little window of hope that I was able to use to finish the match. On the other hand, I been in games where I thought I had it in the bag and and I few heals from killing bonuses and the other player was right back in the game, so you never really know how it's gonna turn out. Which is why having the ability to adapt different play styles mid-game is going to be what seperates the good players from the great ones.

name: Golden Goal
description:
Golden Goal is a new variation of the classic "roll and move" pattern: most of the squares on the board represent teams that can be owned by the players, and the special ones represent events or have special effect. Players can achieve control of the teams by purchasing them from the bank or through an auction.

Each complete round on the board represents a football game, at the end of which, the result is determined by comparing the goals scored by the players.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Politics
description:
Politics is played on a board (referred to as the political field) consisting of an outer square, and a series of inner squares of various sizes arranged within the outer square, each of them rotated 45 degrees from each other so that their corners bisect the other squares' sides. These points (24 of them) are referred to as stations. The two players have different colored pieces. There are three sizes of game piece; each player has two statesmen (large,) four politicians (medium,) and six voters (small,) for a total of twelve, referred to as that player's phalanx.

The game begins with players taking turns placing any one of their pieces on any one station. Like Mill, when a player is able to line up three of his pieces in a row, he is then entitled to remove one of his opponent's pieces, but in the case of this game, only voters may be removed in this fashion. Unlike Mill, pieces in Politics may jump and capture each other as in Checkers, in any direction, once the initial placement phase is concluded. A piece may only jump a like-sized or smaller piece. To win, one must reduce the opponent to only two pieces, or to immobilize his remaining pieces.

name: Wie Du mir: raus mit Dir!
description:
Objective:
Be the first entering target spaces with all of your tokens.

2 or 4 players; moving by turns.

Place all of your tokens (6 or 12/starting positions), roll the die and move forward with one of them according to the result. Ending on an occupied space opposing token is hit & must start again. Ending on a red space you must start again. Reaching target (opposite ground) token is safe.

Likely published during 1920/30s.

name: BrewHaha
description:
A card game of witches and potions! You are a witch of the classic green skinned, pointy hatted variety, in competition with your weird sisters for that iconic status symbol: loads of warts!

Each card is an ingredient, and the cards interact based on their colors. As you add them to your cauldron, they have various effects, and when you have all four colors present, your potion goes POOF! If you had the right stuff in there, when the fumes clear out you'll be wartier than ever. All your sisters will be jealous.

But that's not all. In the heap of entrails and goop lie some of those most dreaded ingredients: healthy vegetables! Toss them into your opponents' cauldrons to spoil what would otherwise have been an absolutely disgusting brew, or, if you've got just the right color balance, you can use them to set your potion off with only minimal side effects!

Gameplay is three rounds. Each player gets 1 poof per round and may play 1 card per turn unless a card allows otherwise. When a player has poofed, their cauldron is reheating and is closed until the next round, so they may only play cards into other players' cauldrons until then. Cards may add or remove cards from cauldrons, cause players to draw or discard cards, give or take away warts, and plenty more specific gameplay-manipulating effects.

Number of players for one deck can be 2-6, although larger numbers of players can be supported by simply mixing in an additional deck.

name: A Trip to Ingledale
description:
Children's game that appeared in the Postman Pat Annual for 1995.

It is a game for two people. One is Postman Pat and the other is Peter Fogg. There are two tracks that lead to Ingledale (space 18). It is a simple roll and move game. Each player moves on their track and must obey instructions when they land on certain spaces. First to the end of their track, wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Hexagonia
description:
Hexagonia is played on a hex-shaped board comprised of 127 smaller hexagons, seven on each side. The hexes are alternately colored red, white, and blue, except for the central hex, which is colored gold. Each player (one with black pieces, one with white) has eight pawns, four knights, two cannons, and one king. Each piece is capable of capturing enemy pieces, and has a different method of movement. The king piece cannot be captured, but can be put into check as in Chess. A player's king must be moved to the central gold hex to win the game.

According to one account, the game's inventor lived in New Zealand. The exact method for each piece's movement is currently unknown, though there is some mention of the cannon pieces moving somehow laterally.

This game is not to be confused with another Jaques game called Hexagony, which used hexes in a much different and smaller configuration, and with different pieces.

name: WWII Micro Armour: The Game – Canada in World War II
description: Miniature rules for the Second World War have tended to ignore the Canadian contribution towards the Allied victory in Europe. CANADA IN WORLD WAR II addresses this neglect. It provides both a detailed presentation of the Canadian Army's War Establishment and 13 historical scenarios drawn from some of the Canadians' hardest fought actions in both Italy and Northwest Europe. (From the back cover)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Napoleonic Warfare 1813c
description:
Miniature rules for Napoleonic Warfare 1813c by Charles Reavley.

From the rules booklet:

The object of the rules is to reproduce in a War Game the weapon capabilities and the tactics existing at the time of the Napoleonic Wars.

Ground scale is 1mm = 1 yard
Time scale is 2 1/2 minutes per period.
Game is designed for 20mm scale figures.

name: Auf ins Winterparadies!
description:
Objective: be the first, ending your round trip in Leipzig.

Simple 'Roll & Move' game, moving by turns.

Start in Leipzig, move around the board through all 4 wintersport regions (Schnierke, Oberhof, Garmisch-Partenkirchen, Cranzahl- Oberwiesenthal); ending on a marked space (number/letter) follow instructions glued into the lid).

name: The American Game of Business
description:
The American Game of Business is played on a board that is convertible from an 8x8 grid of checkered squares to an 8x10 grid of the same. There are two built-in flaps on either side that can cover up one row each, making the board 8x8, or can be opened up, resulting in an 8x10 board. Two lines through the board divide it into four quadrants.

Two players each have a variety of pieces in their own color. For the basic 8x8 game, starting positions are very similar to Chess, but with differently named pieces, including Workers, Merchants/Banking, Labor/Transportation, Agriculture/Manufacturing, Capital, and Government. Government is essentially the King piece, and to win the game, the opponent's Government piece must be “cornered,” that is, prevented from moving. The movements and capturing for the game's pieces however do not correspond exactly to those of Chess, and in some cases are governed by the four quadrants of the board. In the 8x10 game, extra Workers are placed on either side in the additional rows, as well as new Government Commission/Corporation pieces.

The game was meant to be manufactured with a cover that would rest on the flaps and the board's outer rim and seal it up with pieces inside for easy storage.

name: Grisleigh End: Estate of Confusion
description:
Grisleigh End

The Time: The 1930’s, the Golden Age of Mystery
The Place: Grisleigh End, ancestral seat of the Redmayne family.
The Goal: To inherit the vast wealth of the Redmaynes by collecting fragments of shredded wills naming you heir.
The Conflict: Opposition from other potential heirs, and the house called Grisleigh End.
The Game: A boxed boardgame developed by the Council of Creators as the first in a suite of interconnected mystery-themed games set in and around this misty manor in the Welsh borderlands.

Lord Redmayne, Baron of Grisleigh End, has passed without a clear line of inheritance. Having no children of his own issue, any claim to his rather sizable fortune must issue from his legal will. Unfortunately the Baron not only wrote many different wills in the last years of his life, it seems he tore them all to shreds. The six known claimants have been given twelve hours to prove their rights to inherit. As one of these claimants, you must search the Baron’s country manor to find fragments of the will which name you as heir.

Would that it were only that simple.

The other potential heirs are collecting their claims as well, and there’s nothing to stop them from picking up your fragments to keep you from having them. Some might even stoop so low as to steal claims you’ve already gathered! Keep in mind that opportunities also exist for collaboration, however, and that a winning strategy often includes working with your opponents when the time is right.

As if the competing heirs weren’t enough to complicate your efforts, the End itself is an ode to the many peculiarities of the Redmayne family. An ancient structure, expanded and updated haphazardly many times over the centuries, even the oldest members of the staff know only a portion of its secrets. These individuals are key to your success, providing invaluable aid not merely in collecting your claims but also in successfully traversing the dangers of the house which may at times seem an implacable opponent. For as you race from room to room, the house itself will interfere with your movement.

Grisleigh End is also a tribute to the mystery fiction and the authors who have entertained generations of readers. The artwork references hundreds of golden age mystery novels and short stories, from The Abbey Grange by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle to The Zero Clue by Rex Stout, and dozens of mystery authors represented, from Margery Allingham to Israel Zangwill.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Collectible Components, Exploration, Humor, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Set Collection, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Remonte
description: This is a horse race and the winner is the one who is the first to reach the finish line. Each player has 3 meeples (horses). There is no die to determine the movement of the meeples. Instead each player gets 3 wooden disks. At each turn each player choses between 0 and 3 disks, which he hides in his closed hand. All players reveal their disks at the same time. Each player moves one of his meeples according to the sum of the number of his own disks and those of the player on his right side. If a meeple lands on a space with a red dot, it has to start again (There are a lot of red dots!). If it lands on a red cross, it is eliminated from the game. Landing on a green space means that the meeple has prematurely reached the finish line.

name: Horoscope: le jeu
description:
In French, from the back of the box :
"Jouez avec votre signe astrologique

+ de 1000 questions, prédictions et défis

6 thèmes : Amis, Amour, Argent, Chance, Energie, Travail
Répondez, devinez, tentez la chance et...
provoquez vos adversaires : bataille de dé, bluff...
Gagnez en étant le 1er à faire le tour des 12 signes !"

In English :
"Play with your astrological sign
More than 1000 questions, predictions and challenges
6 topics : Friends, Love, Money, Luck, Energy, Work
Answer, guess, try your luck and...
challenge your opponents : dice battle, bluff...
Win the game by being the 1st to complete your round of 12 signs"
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Dortmund
description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Dortmund
- moving/acting by turns -

Each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instruction of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes;

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Dortmund. Corrects answers give economic advantages.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Voting

name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Regensburg
description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Regensburg
- simple 'Roll and Move' game, moving by turns.

Each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on, buys - if possible and/or preferable - votes;

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Regensburg.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Voting

name: Who's A Clever Dick
description:
Who's A Clever Dick: The Card Game For Real Smart Alecs!

This is a card based trivia game - one side has two questions, the other side individual letters (eg C, L, E, etc). Players take turns drawing a card and asking one of the two questions of the player to their left. If the player gets the question right, they keep the card, if they don't, the card goes back to the bottom of the deck. The goal is to spell out "CLEVERDICK" before anyone else. The only wrinkle is that there are also blank cards in the deck - no questions - and the player drawing one of these cards has to try and bluff the other player by making up a question. If they pull it off, they keep the card and take one from the player, if not, the bluff-callin' player keeps the blank and take one from the asker.

Note: "Cleverdick" is actually mild slang in the UK, the equivalent of "smarty pants", you're not actually calling someone a "dick"!

name: The Little Big Game of Bupkis
description:
The first player to reach zero, zilch, nothing - Bupkis! - wins the game. Players don't need to reach zero exactly to win. It's the only game in which zero is everything!

Bupkis is a card game played with 2 decks of cards. One deck is a regular deck of playing cards, and the other deck has from one to 3 numbers on them that range from zero (the Bupkis!) card up to 4 figures. Each number card has the four arithmetic operators (plus, minus, multiply and divide) on the bottom left with some or all of them in a darker font. The darker operators are the ones the player is allowed to use during the hand.

Each round the players are dealt 10 cards and randomly take a Number Card. The players must use the allowable operators on the Number Card to use all the Playing Cards in their hand to total the number or numbers on their card. The player who goes out receives the total of the cards left in the other player's hand as a score. The score is subtracted from the starting score of 500. The first player to reach 0 points is the winner.

name: Noggin Workshop IQ Squares
description: Noggin Workshop IQ Squares challenges players to think outside the box to solve the riddle inside of the box/square. It can be a solitaire game or played with others. When playing with others, the players race to see which player can solve the riddle first, which is actually a rebus puzzle. Play continues until a set number of cards are won by solving the rebus puzzle first. The goal is to solve as many puzzles as possible without looking at the answer.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Educational, Word Game

name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Springe
description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Springe
- moving/acting by turns.

Each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Springe. Corrects answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.
categories: Dice, Economic, Educational, Negotiation, Political, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Rubbish Game
description:
An educational board game themed around recycling and conservation, designed in Australia.

The sole mechanic is roll and move without the rolling, as each player moves exactly three spaces on each turn. Recyclable material tokens are distributed evenly between the two to four players. They move along the branches on the board. When they land on an appropriate recycling spot in their turn, they can leave a token. The first player to recycle everything wins.

The game also comes with a poster and a "Personal Pollution Meter" (printed on the box insert).

name: Teufelsrad
description: Each player gets 3 meeples, which he has to move from the starting space to the center of the game board. The moves are determined by a die. If a meeple lands on a space of another color, it has to go back to the last free space of its own color. The same happens when a meeple is thrown out by another meeple. The first player who gets all 3 meeples on the the center spaces wins the game.

name: Schwarzwald-Reise
description:
Be the first to end your round-trip at Karlsruhe. Learn more about the sights of the Black Forest.

Simple 'Roll & Move' game, moving by turns. End a turn on a marked space (considering red arrows) follow instructions.

Remarks:
Likely published early 1980's
From the box:
fir forest, relaxing valleys, vibrant/stirring life in health resorts, colourful costumes, Roman ruins, sun ripened wine, healing springs, casinos and sports

name: Spherical Chess 324
description:
Capture your opponent's last queen to win.

4 variants (4 2-D perspectives of a spherical, 3-D game):

white whole | black quartered (shown below)
black whole | white quartered
white halved N & S | black halved E & W
black halved N & S | white halved E & W
A draw is impossible.
Each player begins the game with 8 queens.
Once the last queen of either player has been captured, the game will end immediately.

The pendulum-move rule applies which dictates double-moves alternating between the two players throughout the game except for the very first move which is only a single-move by white.

All available 4-, 5-, 6-, 7- directional moving pieces can be half-promoted into pieces with 1 additional direction of movement at the cost of 3 moves.

All available 4- & 6- directional moving pieces can be single-promoted into pieces with 2 additional directions of movement at the cost of 4 moves.

All rooks (4-directional moving pieces) can be double-promoted into queens with 4 additional directions of movement at the cost of 6 moves.

All pieces capable of movement can capture by replacement any enemy or neutral pieces.

Portals connect opposite edges along all 8 geometrically-contiguous directions of linear movement possible within the square-spaced, flat 2-D gameboard.
Consequently, 8 directions of movement are available from every square-space within the flat 2-D gameboard.
Essentially, this is a spherical surface, 3-D chess variant that can be represented accurately and played well using as few or as many of the 4 available, congruent opening setups as desirable within the flat 2-D gameboard due to its exclusive usage of 2-D pieces.
This means that an entire game played via any 1 given opening setup can be completed transposed, move-by-move, into entire games played via all of the other congruent opening setups.
Notably, the naive appearance of geometrical asymmetry in 2-D between the two armies with any given opening setup is totally illusionary.
When the fact that the 2-D gameboard has no real edges in any way (i.e., continuous space), despite its flat 2-D representation to the contrary, is taken into account, the positions and available moves for all of the 2-D pieces of the white army, relative to everything (friendly pieces, neutral pieces, enemy pieces and empty spaces), are mirror-image symmetrical to those of the black army.
In reality, a 4-fold, perfect, holistic 3-D geometrical symmetry applicable to the surface of a sphere exists for this game despite the limitations due to its flat 2-D representations.

This is the disadvantage to using flat 2-D representations of a spherical-surface, 3-D chess variant.

The 2 most symmetrical, representative, opening setups (white whole - black quartered & black whole - white quartered) out of 4 available maintain perfect quadrilateral symmetry in 2-D by north-south, east-west, northwest-southeast and northeast-southwest axes.
The playing surface consisting of a finite, 2-D plane with a square-spaced, flat 2-D gameboard of 20 x 20 spaces (400 spaces total) and a square shape overall (apparently) is perfectly mapped onto the surface of a finite 3-D sphere.

[Note: The true shape overall of the square-spaced, flat 2-D gameboard is actually circular. This is not obvious. Instead, it appears to be square due to the commonplace elongation of the diagonal dimension and/or shortening of the orthogonal dimension which is the universal convention for representing them.
This implicates why a perfect mapping onto the surface of a 3-D sphere, from a circle rather than a square, is ideally suitable and achievable.]

Fortunately, the players are not required to deal with any complex, confusing 3-D curvature characteristic to a spherical playing surface.

This is the advantage to using flat 2-D representations of a spherical-surface, 3-D chess variant.

name: MicroSport Shuffle
description:
MicroSport Shuffle is a game of dexterity and skill based on popular British pub games dating back to the 15th Century.

On his turn, a player flicks four coins across a board marked with horizontal bands called beds. If a coin lands entirely within a bed (that is, without touching a horizontal line), he scores a point. Points are scored after each flick, so earlier coins may score multiple times, as long as they bumped into another bed. After his turn, the four coins are removed from the board and the game proceeds with the next player.

The object of the game is to score three points in each of the five beds. If a player lands a coin in a completed bed (where he already has three points), a point is awarded to his opponent instead. The winner is the first player to score fifteen points.
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), (Web published), Games on the Brain

name: Rogue Amongst the Peasants
description:
Once upon a time, in 2 neighboring villages at war, 1 of the peasants was not like the others...He was sent to create havoc and take out as many of the enemy inhabitants as he could unnoticed.

One day, both villages caught on to the other's sinister plot, and the manhunt to expose the traitor began! And neither village will be at peace until either the enemy's residents, or the other's rogue, is destroyed!


Includes 2 8-card decks (5 Peasants, 2 Guards, 1 Rogue per player.).


The objective of this game is to expose the other player's Rogue card, or kill all of their Peasants, before they can do the same to you. Each turn, the players draw 3 cards and each choose 1 from the other player's hand before discarding and drawing another 3 cards. Should a Peasant be revealed, nothing happens. Should a Guard show his face, your opponent gets to reveal an additional card from your hand for that turn. Should the Rogue be revealed, you win. This was designed as a very quick, as well as easy to learn, mini-game.

One final mechanic worth mentioning: should a player have their Rogue card in hand and it is not revealed that turn, both decks and discard piles are reshuffled and their opponent removes one of their Peasants from their deck.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination

name: Auf zum Schwarzwald
description:
Be the first reaching the target (Stuttgart, space 110); learn more about the black forest. Simple 'Roll & Move' game - moving by turns.

Each player has to put money into the cash box getting back play money. Start at Karlsruhe & move forward according die roll. End on a marked space, follow instructions. Learn more about the cities & places of interest of the Black Forest.

First player gets half of the money...

Remarks:
Equipped with cute pawns, die, playing board, play money.
Likely published late 1910's

name: Motorradfahrt durch Deutschland
description:
Objective: be the first to reach the target space (53/Munich).

Simple 'Roll & Move' game, moving by turns.
Move forward according die roll; ending on a marked (red) space follow instructions glued on lid inside.

Remarks:
-Likely published during 1930's
-Motorcycle meeples

name: ...And One for All! Supplement 1: Additional Rules Variants & Options
description: This two-page PDF is a menu of rules which players may selectively opt to include in game scenarios. Some rules change core game mechanisms while others specify behaviors for specific pieces in the Eureka Miniatures 40 mm Musketeer product line.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Tour
