description: The goal of the game is to move one's car from the starting space to the gas station and from there to the restaurant and back again. The first player to complete this tour wins the game. On their way, the players have to mind the traffic rules. At the traffic lights, a color die determines if it's stop or go!

name: Wer hat Vorfahrt?
description:
Each player gets a car and starts from a starting space (A-F).
The Goal is to move through both roundabouts back to ones starting place and mind the traffic rules. The first player to achieve this wins the game. The colored spaces symbolize traffic lights: yellow = stop for 1 turn, red = stop for 2 turns, green = get one additional die roll.

name: Parquet
description:
2-player abstract strategy board game of movement, sliding and stacking ... that will floor you!

OBJECT: stack three own-colour pieces on the rear-rank corner tile of the opponent. The first player to do so, is the winner.

PLAY: players alternately either move or leap one piece at a time to an unoccupied tile then slide an unoccupied tile to an adjacent void or, slide an unoccupied tile to an adjacent void then move or leap a piece. A piece may not move onto or leap over a void. Players may not slide (return) a tile to the void created immediately previous. A player unable to move / leap a piece or slide a tile, forfeits the turn.

name: Rollplay Football
description:
This is a game of football. The rules are simple. Your objective is to score more goals than your opponent and win the match!

Coaches take turns, first the attacker, then the defender. The attacker tries to move the ball between his players and score a goal. The defender tries to get the ball.

Pick your team out of 10 national teams, challenge your friends and become a world class coach!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Weg zur Schule
description:
Objective: be the first reaching space 60 (school)
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; each player rolls the die (1d6) & moves forward; ending on a red space you have to follow instructions.

remarks:
likely published during 1920/30's
on the back of the board: additional map to race (boating)
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Sports

name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Oldenburg
description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Oldenburg
- moving/acting by turns.

Each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Oldenburg. Correct answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.
categories: Dice, Economic, Educational, Negotiation, Political, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Leben in Hannover
description:
Published about the German City of Hannover.

By playing the players get to know a little bit about the city and its shops.

During each player's turn they roll a six-sided dice to move along a game-board depicting a map of Hannover. At certain spaces players can acquire cards of the shops or they can go sightseeing by following the instructions on the back of the card. Sometimes there is only information written, sometimes you have to pay an amount of money or at other times you may earn some cash.

The game ends when the last player reaches the finish space with his playing piece. The winner is the person who has acquired the most sightseeing and/or shop cards.

name: Leben in Wuppertal
description:
Published about the German City of Wuppertal.

By playing the players get to know a little bit about the city and its shops.

During each player's turn they roll a six-sided dice to move along a game-board depicting a map of Wuppertal. At certain spaces players can acquire cards of the shops or they can go sightseeing by following the instructions on the back of the card. Sometimes there is only information written, sometimes you have to pay an amount of money or at other times you may earn some cash.

The game ends when the last player reaches the finish space with his playing piece. The winner is the person who has acquired the most sightseeing and/or shop cards.

name: Leben in Würzburg
description:
Published about the German City of Würzburg.

By playing the players get to know a little bit about the city and its shops.

During each player's turn they roll a six-sided dice to move along a game-board depicting a map of Würzburg. At certain spaces players can acquire cards of the shops or they can go sightseeing by following the instructions on the back of the card. Sometimes there is only information written, sometimes you have to pay an amount of money or at other times you may earn some cash.

The game ends when the last player reaches the finish space with his playing piece. The winner is the person who has acquired the most sightseeing and/or shop cards.

name: Leben in Osnabrück
description:
Published about the German City of Osnabrück.

By playing the players get to know a little bit about the city and its shops.

During each player's turn they roll a six-sided dice to move along a game-board depicting a map of Osnabrück. At certain spaces players can acquire cards of the shops or they can go sightseeing by following the instructions on the back of the card. Sometimes there is only information written, sometimes you have to pay an amount of money or at other times you may earn some cash.

The game ends when the last player reaches the finish space with his playing piece. The winner is the person who has acquired the most sightseeing and/or shop cards.

name: Leben in Bielefeld
description:
Published about the German City of Bielefeld.

By playing the players get to know a little bit about the city and its shops.

During each player's turn they roll a six-sided dice to move along a game-board depicting a map of Bielefeld. At certain spaces players can acquire cards of the shops or they can go sightseeing by following the instructions on the back of the card. Sometimes there is only information written, sometimes you have to pay an amount of money or at other times you may earn some cash.

The game ends when the last player reaches the finish space with his playing piece. The winner is the person who has acquired the most sightseeing and/or shop cards.

name: Rette dein Leben durch Verkehrszeichenkenntnis!
description:
Save your life through knowledge of traffic signs! The players have to go from "Start" to the finish space. If the meeples get on a space with a traffic sign, the players have to follow the instructions in the game rules. On a few occations the player may turn the turntable to shorten his way. The first player to reach "Ziel" wins the game.

The game was published in the 1950s.

name: The Game of Courage
description:
Courage is a squad based wartime strategy game where players vie for control of the battlefield using custom troops, secret orders, and subterfuge. Acting simultaneously, 2-8 players take on the role of Axis or Allied forces and engage in anything from small skirmishes to epic team battles. Courage emphasizes the use of tactics and troop management over luck to win the battlefield.

The game of Courage is an accessible yet deep and intuitive strategy game designed for fast paced simultaneous play that keeps all players in the action, every turn.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Erntedankfest
description:
Goal: Be the first to reaching position '50' (Thanksgiving)

Game Play:
Typical 'roll & move' game - Roll the die by turns and step forward - ending on a marked space follow instructions glued into the lid.

Notes:
Contains pewter pawns

name: The Shivil War
description:
Free P&P game! Requirements - at least 3 A4 pieces of paper, 6 D6 and 1 D10.

The Shivilnecks have had it with being the Husk's breakfast, lunch and dinner, but they're just too tasty for the Husks to give up! So, from thereforth the Shivil War began.

Each player will need to deploy each of their 6 units one at a time, each with a custom made weapon or spell unique to that unit. It's up to the player to make the most out of their unique abilities and slay the opposition; gaining the means to secure your home territories and win the game.

- A typically round consists of 3 phases, namely:

The Recruitment Phase, in which both players choose a unit to recruit and forge them the kind of weapon or spell the player thinks will be the most useful, given the success of their Recruitment Roll. Choose wisely - you can never recruit two rounds in a row.

The Activation Phase is where most of a action takes place. Move and attack with any units you can with the hopes of slaying an enemy unit and receive it's bounty of 1 coin. Or, if the unit is already carrying a coin it's a race straight back to it's home square, where it can lock it down and finalise their role in the game.

The Purchase Phase simply lays down the opportunity to gain the upper hand via the purchase of an upgrade. Although these may seem like a novelty, some of the more useful features of the game such as the top tear weapons and routine healing. Choose wisely!
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Medieval, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Kinofune
description:
Kinofune is a tabletop ship combat game that pits players against each to blow each other up to tiny bits and pieces. It utilizes an in-teresting ship build mechanic where players pick their components from a shared resource pool of dice rolled at the start of the game. This means games will always be different since the strengths and weaknesses are randomized at the start of every game.

A winner is declared when all of the opponent's ships are destroyed. Different scenarios offer different win conditions, such as whoever earns the most victory points after 5 rounds or who can capture the mine first.

The game is also unique because of the pieces. The ships are hand-made out of wood in a tiny workshop in the USA., assembled by the one-man-team known as Alexander Shen. Because they’re made of wood, they are also completely open to endless customization op-tions.

name: Cast of Thousands
description:
Abridged excerpt from the 2008 PDF, What is Cast of Thousands?
Cast of Thousands is a dice mechanic and set of rules that players can use for "cinematic wargaming". The entire system is summed up in four points:

Roll as many six-sided dice as you wish! You must roll at least two.
A 4-6 on a dice is a success. Each extra success raises the Success Level.
Double '1's are a Mishap.
Three or more '1's are a Calamity.

name: Cast of Toys
description: Cast of Toys a one-page set of rules for battles between armies of toy miniatures, like those from Eureka Miniatures's Toytown range. It's based on Cast of Thousands by the same author. Most actions are resolved by rolling a bunch of six-sided dice and consulting a table.

name: A Cast of Thousands
description:
From the publisher's website:
At long last a game that enables you to use all the figures in your collection at once. From Cavemen to the Far Flung Future, Hollywood encompasses it all.

Promote your stars, hire your extras, shoot your films and try to make it the movie business.

User summary:
A Cast of Thousands is an unusual miniatures game in that its "combat" represents psychological confrontations, like "shouting matches". Losses cause cast members to quit and leave the movie set.

Players maneuver their director and whatever cast they can to film on a chosen set, possibly chasing off rival crews. Each successful film improves the director's and the star actor's rating (i.e., power). A player wins by getting their director to a five-star rating.

The authors' similarly named 2008 title, Cast of Thousands, is explicitly credited on the publisher's website as inspiration, but the games are substantially different from each other.

name: Ein Rheinreisespiel
description:
This is a beautiful early 20th Century game. The 60-space track takes the player along the Rhine River from Mainz to Cologne (Koln). The track includes illustrations of the many picturesque towns and sights along the way, with art by Emil Ernst Heinsdorff. The game comes with six very cute painted metal player tokens.

The game is simple: players roll a die and follow any instructions for the space on which they land, which are printed on the inside of the box. While the game is obviously suitable for children, some of the instructions to be followed seem equally suited to an adult drinking party. Landing on the famous statue of Lorelei, the player must sing a verse of "Ich Weiss nicht, was joll es bedeuten", and if any player lands on the town of Oberwesel, everyone must immediately rise and belt out a verse from a Rhein song of their choice!

The First Edition is usually dated to c. 1910, while the Second Edition (with a painting of the town of Bacharach on the box cover) dates to c. 1924.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel

name: Chee Chow: The Mystic Seven
description: Chee Chow is a competitive game of Tangrams for up to four players. Included are traditional tangram sets of seven pieces each (2 large right triangles, 1 medium right triangle, 2 small right triangles, 1 square, and 1 parallelogram) in four colors, and a number of cards with silhouetted shapes the players must try to form with their own pieces. First player to complete their puzzle wins. A book with solutions and an entertaining bogus background story are included.

name: Path of Bones
description:
From the publisher:

Path of Bones is a fast paced cinematic martial arts combat game. Hordes of troops. Powerful heroes. Exotic locales. Unparalleled action And no dice.

Path of Bones uses dominoes - "bones" - instead of dice to run its combat system. Engagements run on a two-tiered system: troops mass and press their advantage together; heroes combine their marital arts styles into devastating attacks.

The rules provide an intriguing system of simultaneous attack and defense based on the two sides of the dominoes drawn by you and your opponent. Equipment and character types provide options for over forty different types of common troops. There are thousands and thousands of ways to combine the martial arts styles from the rules to make heroes ... and a guide to customizing the system to your own tastes.

With the base rules you get nine combat scenarios:

One set allows a band of heroes to progress through a traditional Chinese story
Another sets the stage for fighting the Mongol Invasion of Japan
A set up for the epic climactic battle of the Forty Seven Ronin
Each combat scenario is playable as a stand-alone game, with options for replay value
Twenty-five pages of print-and-play terrain to support the scenarios right away


The game plays well from as few as forty to fifty figures total (both sides) up to about five hundred. It was playtested with 25-28mm figures using standard size dominoes and 15-28mm figures using mini dominoes. Bones are used to measure movement as well as resolve combat.

name: Was das Kind träumt
description:
Goal: Be the first to reaching position '40' (parents celebrating x-mas)

Game Play:
Typical 'roll & move' game - Roll the die by turns and step forward - ending on a marked space follow instructions glued into the lid. Each player has to buy play money first; ending on a red space - get one coin/ white one - pay one coin; winner gets 2/3rd, second 1/3 of the remaining cash.

Notes:
should had been published ~1905-1910 (Zeppelin drawing)

name: PAZIC (Post-Apocalyptic Zombie Infested City)
description:
You are the leader of a survivor camp on the edge of a city named Pazic. Each round you must decide whether each of your survivors will go after objectives to collect resources, enhance your camp, recruit other survivors, or attack the other camps.

Every survivor card in the deck is two-sided, and when a survivor is wounded, infected, or killed, the card can be turned over to become a zombie card, with the world slowly but surely having fewer and fewer survivors and increasingly more zombies.

The winner of PAZIC (Post-Apocalyptic Zombie Infested City) is the last camp leader to have any survivors left in his camp, whether by eliminating the other camps or creating a camp so powerful that it can continue to survive the onslaught longer than the other camps as resources and survivors become harder to find.

name: Odyssey
description: Odyssey is played by two players on a hexagonal shaped board comprised of 91 hexagons, six to each side. One side of the board is the home row for black, the opposite row is home for white. Each player begins with six pieces on the board, one on each hex of their home row, and four pieces in reserve, which may enter the game later beginning with the far right hex of the home row. On every turn, each player throws two six-side dice, and moves two of his pieces according to the outcome of each die, the number of each representing the number of hexes a piece may move. All moves are either forward or sideways (parallel to the home row.) The first player to move all ten of his pieces to his opponent's home row wins the game.

name: Tricky Trigon
description:
Tricky Trigon is a game for two, played on a hexagon-shaped lattice of triangles with 91 points, six to each side. The lines alternate in the colors red and blue, and a central section of six triangles is shaded in red. Along the outside edges of the board are alternating starting positions marked for red and blue, nine for each.

Players take turns moving one of their nine pieces towards the center of the board, where to win the game they must form a triangle with six of their stones, with at least two of those stones in the shaded central area of the board. Players move one space at a time and may trap opponent's pieces by blocking them on either side in a straight line. The trapping player then gets an extra move, and the trapped piece is removed and replaced anywhere on the outer points of the board. The first player to form his triangle wins the game.

name: Clockwork Island
description:
In Clockwork Islands players take over the role of explorers in a mysterious land with undiscovered riches and dangers. The game uses worker placement to assign crew to various tasks to include: scouting, gathering food, exploring ruins, etc. Players gather clues to determine the location of various runes that are located on the islands. The game includes hundreds of event and clue cards to ensure each game is unique.

The objective of the game is to obtain the most Victory Points by collecting various items such as legendary artifacts, ancient cultural items and even gold.

name: Ching Ching Chinaman
description:
A game of tossing balls at a target.

Stand up the figure of the "Chinaman" at the end of the table. The players are to stand at the other end. The game is to throw the balls into Chinaman's mouth.

Each player in turn throws all the balls, and score one for each that goes in the mouth.
Note:
Title belongs to English language playground rhymes, mocking or playing on the Chinese language, people of Chinese ancestry

name: The Watergate Game
description:
Typical roll and move with Monopoly mechanic based board game about Watergate scandal and US President election.

The object of the game is to be elected President. This is accomplished by accumulating a majority of the 338 electoral votes. Candidate must win 270 votes before any other players.

In turn, a player rolls the dice and moves one's pawn around the spaces on the gameboard.

name: The Game... Cocaine
description:
This game has been design to depict the lifestyle of those individuals who become involved with the drug cocaine.
Each player shall have a Coke Buyer (smaller piece) and a matching Super Narc.
Role and move around the game board, make a buy from any of four local dealers squares.
Once a purchase has be made the Coke Buyer must transport the coke card back to the starting position.
The other players can bust the Buyer carrying the coke card if with the roll of the dice they can land they Super Narc on the Coke Buyer.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Gross Jagersdorf
description: Simple free PnP hex and counter Wargame with a 7 Years War battle theme. The two sides are Prussian and Russian. Players move units and conduct combat over varied terrain. In order to achieve victory by maximizing their opponents losses while minimizing their own. Or by the seizure of geographic objectives. Player game balancing by the addition or subtraction of units is encouraged.

name: Going to the Fair
description:
Object of game:
The fun of the game is to visit the farm, and see the animals. Game teach the child the fun of fair play. This game is basically a simple spinner game; it is a race to the finish.

name: The Night Before Christmas
description:
For any number of players. Players used a spinner to race each other to the finish and collect “gift” cards along the way.
From the rules:
All Present cards are shuffled, and divided equally among the players. The players all use the same piece, spinning the indicator, and starting from Santa Claus' head-quarters, they moving the piece called Santa Claus, in turn, until he is carried over the entire road, and back to his home again.
At the end of player's move, if Santa Claus stops at a house, the player takes the presents called for, from his pack of Present cards, and lays them aside. A player may not always have all the presents called for and, in that case, he lays aside all that he can.
When a player lands on dot marked "Go Back to Fourth House", "Seminary" or "Orphan's Home" Santa Claus is placed back, as directed, and the player delivers the presents called for, and Santa Claus starts on his travels again, from that place, as before.
The player who first runs out of "Present cards" or the player who has the smallest number of "Present cards" in his hand, after Santa Claus has reached his home again, wins the game.
Components: spinner, 20 cards (pairs of 10 different), and one wood game piece (Santa Claus).
Size: 15" x 17"

More about the box design:
In the 19th century, Americans fell in love with Santa Claus. Clement Moore first published his poem “An Account of a Visit From Saint Nicholas,” which he originally wrote for his daughters, Margaret, Charity, and Mary, in 1823.
German immigrant Thomas Nast who created the familiar image of the white-bearded man in the red suit that was reinterpreted by unknown artists for these box tops. During the Civil War, Nast drew on the German tradition of Saint Nicholas for a Harper’s Weekly cover depicting Santa Claus as a “spirit of Christmas” visiting lonely soldiers in camp. The image proved to be a turning point in the popularity of Santa.

name: Auto Race Game
description:
Auto Race Game or Auto Racing Game #4289 by Milton Bradley.
Extremely simple spin and move game. First player who crossed the finish line wins the game.

Contents: 4 dials, 4 racing cars in different colors.

name: Jolly Marble Game
description:
Inside of the box opens to a 90 degree angle that depicts four acrobats with wooden cups that catch and pass a falling marble from the above mischievous looking clown. The marble then rolls down a chute to a selection of scored holes.

The one who earns the most points, wins.

Size: 19-1/2" l. x 20-1/2" h.

name: Dinx & Dragons
description:
In the late 2013 the Italian gaming club Dinx celebrated its tenth anniversary: to commemorate the event, the club gave every active member a tumbler and three customized engraved dice, whose 6-pane was replaced with the club logo.

Dinx & Dragons has been designed as a mini-game to be played with these dice. It can also be played with regular d6s.

About the game

In Dinx & Dragons players are red dragons fighting each other by claws and fangs: by rolling dice, players try to either hit the opponent or parry his blows.

Each time an attack is successful, that player steals (and possibly eats) a candy from the opponent’s pool, thus reducing his hit points.

As a player runs out of candies, he’s out of the game: the last player with candies in his pool is the winner.

name: Erika
description:
Each player gets 4 different meeples of one color: man, woman, letter and luggage. The movements are determined by a special roulette wheel. The goal is to travel from the starting spacees (1-4) to the summer vacation spots (A-D). The 1st player to get all 4 meeples to his vacation spot, wins the game.

Each spinning of the roulette wheel determines the moves of all 4 players (A-D) at once. For the different kind of meeples, there are different rules of how and when they move and what happens, when the meet each other. So for example, the woman can carry a man of any color (this symbolizes them forming a pair) and the letter causes man and woman to step a few spaces back, while they are busy with reading. Some encounters even cause the meeples to get sent back to their home to start anew.

This game most likely was published in the 1930s.

name: Battlesculpt
description:
In Battlesculpt, 2 - 8 players make a few simple choices, then create a monster out of modeling clay to do battle until only one monster remains.

Each monster has a Special Ability and a Monster Tracking Board with three columns of choices. Grab a card, choose one option from each column, sculpt your clay, and decimate your opponents.

When your monster has been squished don't worry you can still flail at any monsters who stay near your lump of smashed clay as well as throw missiles at the still mobile combatants.

name: Creature Dice
description:
In Creature Dice, players take on the role of a creature from myth and legend trying to gather victims and avoid the Monster Hunters.

As each player rolls dice to hunt, other players may join the hunt and score based on the dice kept by the active player. Keeping all players engaged regardless of whose turn it is.

Each player will be dealt a monster card which shows the types of victims it can hunt.

On your turn, you will roll all eight custom dice. You are allowed to keep as many of these dice as you'd like, but you must keep at least one.

Your first hunt (roll) is safe. If you roll three hunters on this roll, you still score all victims of your type and your turn ends immediately. No other players may score on this first roll.

If you roll fewer than 3 hunters, you may continue rolling all non-hunter dice you did not choose to hold. On this second roll and any subsequent rolls, other players score if you hold a die with their victim type on it. If at any time after your first roll you roll a total of three hunters, then your turn ends immediately and you score zero. All other players may still score on your roll, unless lock them out with a special die result that can ban them from collecting victims on your hunt.

Players' victim types overlap so that multiple players may score on the same die.

The last round begins when any player reaches the Victim (victory) Point goal (5 points per player) and the player with the most points at the end of this last round wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Skilauf
description:
Goal: Be the first to race to position '140'
Typical 'Roll & Move' game

Roll the 2 dice by turns and step forward - until you end on a red marked space follow instructions (lid inside)

Notes:
Likely published 1910/20s
Nice pawns
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Sports

name: Gelände-Prüfungs-Fahrt 2 mal um Dippersdorf
description:
Objective: be the first reaching the target (field 1) after having finished 2 circles

‘Roll and Move’ game

Ending on a marked space (red/black) follow instructions glued into the lid

Equipment: board, 6 meeples (cars), 1 die

name: Der dumme August
description:
A ring toss game -
The gamepieces are a face with a nose and 2 hooks, 8 rings (2 x red, blue, green, yellow).

The players toss rings and try to hook them on clown's nose which sticks out from the face (counts '10'). If you miss the nose and hit a hook instead (left and right side) you score a 2 or 3 points). The first player to accumulate 50 Points is declared the winner.

Instructions are printed on the back of the lid.

Notes:

Rules are written in rhyme
Likely published 1910/20's

name: Scout Trail
description:
Typical spin and move game.
Rules of the game: each player has four Scouts opposite color.. After deciding who starts first spin top and advance one Scout as many foot-prints as top indicates. Opponent then spins and Advances one Scout starting from opposite camp. Enter additional Scouts when you want to in your turn. One Scout in a square can be sent back to start over should opponent spin and land in that square. Two Scouts in a square is a guard and cannot be passed by opponent Scouts.
Friendly camp is neutral ground and is a safety zone. You may reach friendly-camp or finish by getting number large enough to reach but it is not necessary to throw 'exact number. It is advisable to form a guard wherever possible as opponent must wait to pass until you have broken your guard. Player who gets all his Scouts in opponent's camp first wins the game.

name: Durch's Ziel
description:
Two different games (board can be turned). Before players start they have to 'buy in' (money will be divided between first (1/2), second (1/3) and third (1/6) place).

1. Tourenrennen - moving by turns, be the first reaching space 90. Simple 'Roll & Move' game - ending on a marked space follow instructions (lid inside).

2. Wettrennen - acting/moving simultaneously/agree upon number of rounds. All players throw their die and move forward; ending on a coloured space (green/red/black/blue/yellow/purple) follow instructions (lid inside)

Notes:
Likely published at the end of the 1920s.

name: Prank Call
description:
Call your friends and keep them on the line to earn points and win the game. Roll the die to reveal your prank call category and your next prank call. Then stick the phone on speaker, take a deep breath, flip the timer and start dialing. Example of a challenge: before time runs out, get your caller to repeat the word 'Circus' 3 times. First player to collect five cards wins the game.

Contents: 100 cards, timer, die, rules.

name: Pleiades
description:
Pleiades, an early adaptation of dominoes to triangular pieces, was granted a patent in 1879. The game consists of a central six-pointed star piece, each point being marked on both outer edges with a number of dots from one to six, and thirty-six triangular tiles marked along their edges with numbers ranging from one to six.

To begin the game, the tiles are placed face down and shuffled, and two or more players draw an agreed upon number. The player who has drawn a tile with three sixes goes first, matching a tile to one of the central star's numbered edges. The players then take turns matching their tiles to the original in order to create a hexagon shaped star adjoining the central piece. If no match is possible, a player must pass. The player who completes the hexagonal star gets one point, and the next player begins another star by matching a tile to the central star. If no player can match a piece, that star is blocked and play begins on another. The player scoring the most points (there are a maximum of six) wins the game.

name: Race to Til Thorin
description:
A card and dice based game set in Jaime Buckley’s world of Wanted Hero.

Each player begins with a random character and weapon, and has a different quest to fulfill. In each turn they visit different locations, where they may fight fierce foes, escape terrible traps, discover wondrous treasures, trade their findings, or recruit additional characters.

Their ability to escape the perilous traps or win their opposing foes is determined by their own strength, the strength of their weapon... and a bit of luck from the dice roll.

They play until they collect all the pieces needed to complete their quest and race to take them to “Til Thorin” to win the game.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Devine qui vient dîner ce soir
description: Guess Who’s Coming to Dinner is a fun and zany party game in which players try to arrange celebrities at restaurant tables. Due to the fact that the cards become obsolete in a few years, if not months, and that a different version would be needed not only for each language, but for each country, it will never be published, so I have published it as a downloadable pdf on this website. Of course, the cards are for a French version, but if anyone finds the idea fun enough and wants to make a US version (or a version for any other country), he is welcome to do it.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Print & Play

name: GEARS
description:
THEME:
Based on the fantasy novel TRENCH WARS, players are gnome pilots about to engage in the championship finals of an extreme sport called G.E.A.R.S. (Gnomes Engaging And Recovering the Standard). Players are walked through the last moments before the bay doors open, connecting to the mainframe computer and assigning the positions of your R.A.T.s (Recon Attack Team). A high-tech feel is produced through bullet holes, digital accents and blue metal artwork, both across the game board and cards.

GAME PLAY:
Players take turns moving their team (consisting of one Champion and four R.A.T.s) to the center of the board. R.A.T.s are divided into melee and ranged fighters, each with unique and limited moving patterns and attack abilities. Your Champion may move one space in any direction and is the only character who can complete the game by grabbing the Standard.

R.A.T.s engage and run interference while your Champion navigates the battlefield. Power cards and specialty cards provide unique abilities, buffs, advantages and pitfalls which can enhance your ability to harm or hinder opponents. Fellow players can also engage in combat, assisting either attacking or defending players by discarding cards from their hands.

GOAL:
The focus is to get your Champion to the Standard first.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: GO Smiley!
description:
THEME:
The game is based on a comical aspect pulled from Jaime Buckley's "Chronicles of a Hero" series--the animated smiley face on the main character's shirt. Always revealing the true feelings of Wendell through silent expressions, this concept was applied to the comical facial expressions of the game cards.

GAME PLAY:
Based on the traditional GO FISH! rules (both US and AUSTRALIAN versions), players must ask for cards by mimicking the facial expressions contained on their card. If the player being asked does not have the expression asked for, they respond by saying "GO Smiley!" and a card is drawn. Traditional rules apply.

GOAL:
The game continues until either someone has no cards left in their hand or the stock runs out. The winner is the player who then has the most books.

GO Smiley! is also used as a memory game for children
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Deduction, Humor, Memory, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Memory, Trading

name: Stack-A-Saurus Nex
description: Players stack colored "neck bones" onto the neck of a 3D dinosaur. But when a color's not available, the player must knock one "neck bone" of that color off with the hammer. Be careful because one false move and the neck will snap, sending all the "neck bones" flying, and you lose the game.

name: BioSyndrome
description:
A free Print and Play Table Top Survival Horror War Game, it contains three different games in one: A Fantasy War Game, a Modern War Game and a role playing pen and paper version.

Features: Point based customizable armies, shooting, movement hand to hand combat all in a easy to use hard to master D8 gaming system.

Objective of the game: play one of 5 different missions featuring two or more armies pitched against each other. The 5 different missions have various objectives, a few examples being to escape from the map or to hold out against the zombie horde player for a certain number of turns. An average game starts out at around 200 - 250 points per side. The game is scalable allowing for team battles and much higher point valued games.

Items required to play: Table top, terrain, miniatures, rule book, a few D8 dice and 2+ players. No new miniatures needed!
categories: Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Essence: Im Labyrinth des Lebens
description:
Story: By treading the path through this labyrinth, the players enter the undiscovered world of their own being...

Essence: Im Labyrinth des Lebens (Essence: In The Labyrinth Of Life) transforms the card game into a board game and provides it with an atmospheric game board, which replaces the pathway cards of the base game.

By the use of two dice, the players still have the possibility to choose between two options. Newly added are actions for the centre of the labyrinth and for the encounter of meeples.

The player who reaches the centre decides if the game is continued or ends immediately. In this case, essence points are counted and the winner is determined.

The gameboard is made of tarpaulin which makes it rollable, waterproof and very durable.
categories: Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Voting

name: Hexehop
description:
Hexehop is a Halma variant that was designed to allow for players with impaired vision. Its board is a hexagonal grid of points, seven to a side, but with two points from each corner removed. Also, there are no lines connecting the inner hexagon of five points to a side with the outer portion of the board, resulting in six separate starting areas of nine points each, outside the inner hexagon. The lines and points are done in relief, and the pieces are made not only in colors but in shapes.

The game is played the same as Halma or Chinese Checkers, with up to six players taking turns moving their pieces one at a time to the opposite side of the board. Pieces may move to one adjacent point or jump another piece to a vacant opposite point. The first play to move all of his or pieces to their objective wins the game.

name: Olala!: Die lustige Käferjagd!
description:
The goal of the game is to get one's bug one time around the game board. The first to achive this, wins the game. But beware the maid Fifi! She prowls the game board and shots off the legs of the bugs. Also, whenever two bugs meet, the arriving bug bites one leg off the other bug. The Bugs can only move when they have all six legs attached. To attach a lost leg, they have to roll a 1 or 6. The game is played with 2 dice. The red one determines the movement (clockwise) of the bugs, while the blue one moves the maid counterclockwise.

The game was most likely published in the 1930s.

name: Slime Hunt
description:
Greetings, and welcome to the Slime Hunters Guild! It is our job to venture out into the wilds, track down those pesky creatures known as Slimes, and trap them in a manner that allows them to be brought back alive (alchemists, wizards, pet stores...surprisingly, there are many potential and wealthy buyers.)

Today, there appears to be an outbreak of them, which makes a great business opportunity for us! Take these "magic boxes" with you (the dice), and throw them in order to activate their trapping mechanisms. Should they result in the right symbols (roll the correct result), then they shall be baited correctly in order to attract and trap whatever Slime inhabits the area. Can you bring back a higher valued Bounty than the other hunters?

Contents:


4 Dice for trapping Slimes
32 Slime Cards
2 Instruction Cards
2 Score Reference Cards
1 Box


Gameplay Summary:

Each turn, 4 Slime Cards are drawn and placed in front of the active player. The active player must roll a certain number on the dice in order to trap one or more of them, depending on the colors drawn. If the player is unsatisfied with their dice roll, they may remove one of their dice in order to reroll all of the remaining dice and trap a higher number of slimes for the turn. Gameplay and turns continue this way until the Slime deck is completely gone through twice, then the players reference the Score Reference Card to figure up their scores and determine the winner.

Scoring:

Each Slime is worth 1 point on its own, but additional points bonuses are awarded when certain criteria are met, such as collecting 1 of each color or the most of a specific color.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Chanakya's Chakkravyuh
description:
Chanakya's Chakkravyuh is a unique learning tool in the form of a financial board game. Its main purpose is to help players from all walks of life (including common man, entrepreneurs, corporate professionals, students, educators, home makers, investors) attain financial literacy. Minimum age is 15 years and above.

Inspired by the 2000-year old wisdom of prominent Indian economist Chanakya, this game enlightens individuals on how to manage money and connect financial knowledge to resourceful opportunities, which are ever-present in today's changing world.

The player initially chooses a dream out of various dreams listed on the board. Each dream has a purchase price listed on it. In order to win the game, the player must purchase his/her pre-selected dream.

There are two parts in the game, the first is Chakkravyuh and second is Rajmarg. All players start inside the Chakkravyuh. In the first part of the game, a player may not have enough money to buy his/her dream. Chanakya's Chakkravyuh simulates real-life investment opportunities, various market scenarios, and unforeseen life situations to throw challenges that the participants have to tackle. By successfully navigating these challenges and deriving "passive income" (income where each rupee works to bring you even more rupees), participants eventually build enough income generating assets to move into the second part of the game, i.e. the Rajmarg. It is in the Rajmarg that the player can acquire their pre-selected "dream".

Even though there is no official time limit, the entire game normally lasts about 4 hours. The first player to purchase his/her dream wins the game, and that is officially the end of the game.

The experiential nature of a game-based environment makes the process of learning a lot more fun, and there is also a sense of competition among the participants.

Besides gaining financial knowledge and learning how to leverage passive income, participants will understand the real difference between an asset and a liability. Additionally, important lessons will be learned in basic accounting principles, debt financing, interpersonal communication, negotiations and joint deal-making.

No background in business or finance is required. Absolutely anyone can play this game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Team-Based Game, Trading

name: Galactic Smugglers
description:
The Antares Galaxy System is a merging inter-planetary commerce system, however, not all is blissful and peaceful in the Antares System. One Planet, Xanthar, has grown particularly powerful under the oppressive leadership of a power-hungry, ruthless and brutal ruler, T’arNak! Meanwhile, you and the other players are Free Merchant Traders, buying commodities from a Planet with a large supply and selling them to Planets in need. Now, it is getting a bit tricky and dangerous as T’arNak’s Star Legions are increasing their presence and enforcing their strict trade regulations. The citizens of the Antares System need brave, heroes like you to help them throw off the yoke of T’arNak’s oppression.

The goal of the Players, is to gain the most Star Credits (SC) before the end of the 20th Round. The Player with the most Credits is the winner. In addition, the Heroes will undertake various missions to thwart T’arNak’s operations. The game automatically ends when the first Hero successfully completes 10 of these “Special” missions. If playing solo, the goal is to survive and gain 10,000 Credits or complete 10 Special Missions.

You can find Galactic Smugglers at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net
categories: Adventure, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Heroes of Valdor: A Board Game of Fantasy Adventure
description:
HEROES OF VALDOR is a fantasy adventure board game where the players assume the roles of Heroic Characters in the savage world of Valdor, a place where three races (Human, Elf and Dwarf) have lived and fought for millennia with only a few scattered decades where peace was declared between the races. Now in the east, an invasion is occurring; an invasion by an evil and foul race of Orcs along with their minions of Goblins, Trolls, and a variety of terrifying creatures, led by their powerful and terrifying Sorcerer Overlord by the name of Valtigorn.

It is up to the Heroes to help unite the various races and tribes of Valdor in order to gather enough forces to defeat the Army of Valtigorn.

HEROES OF VALDOR, also, features the amazing Artwork of the extremely talented Mr. Devin Night.

HEROES OF VALDOR is a rich and encompassing Fantasy game that will emerge the Players into Magical and Fantasic World.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: Das Sylt-Spiel
description:
Be the first gaining 20 question cards
A simple trivia game played on a map of the German island of Sylt. Movement is decided by a die. There are four categories of questions:
A = General knowledge
K = Culture
W = Economic
P = Politics and History
Obviously, all the 250 questions in the game have some connection to Sylt.

notes: game was published in cooperation with shz (Schleswig-Holsteinischer Zeitungsverlag)

name: Noppapeli
description: In this game you try to be the first player to complete your 6-piece puzzle. The die shows you which puzzle piece you can take from the table – if it fits in your puzzle, you get to keep it!

name: Ravensburger Spiele Minis: Such Die Affen
description:
"Spiele Minis" is a series of small surprise boxes (i.e., you don't know what you get) from Ravensburger. They are meant to be carry-on or gifts, suitable for children ("Mitbringspiel"). Some of the cubes contain actual games, others contain magic tricks, puzzles etc.

This is a game similar to Mastermind but smaller. Each player receives a screen, 3 monkeys (red, blue, yellow) and a board with 6 spaces from 1 to 6.

Each round a player will hide his monkeys (in spaces 1 to 6) while the other tries to guess their location. For that the second player will place her monkeys where she thinks player 1 has his and reveal her board. Player 1 then has to say how many monkeys are in the right position and so on until she gets it right. Then the roles will be exchanged. The player that guesses the right combination in the fewest tries will be the winner.

name: Ravensburger Spiele Minis: Buchstaben-Spiel
description:
"Spiele Minis" is a series of small surprise boxes (i.e., you don't know what you get) from Ravensburger. They are meant to be carry-on or gifts, suitable for children ("Mitbringspiel"). Some of the cubes contain actual games, others contain magic tricks, puzzles etc.

The object of the game is to win as many Word cards as possible.

Each round a player will reveal one of the cards (that are placed on the table) and spin the roulette. Then all players will try to say a word that starts with the letter indicated by the roulette and that is in the concept shown by the cards. The first player to do so will win the card.

Cards can have the following categories: profession, food, vehicle, drink, country, name, plant, star, animal.

Content: 1 letters roulette, 9 word cards

name: Ravensburger Spiele Minis: Wo war's?
description:
"Spiele Minis" is a series of small surprise boxes (i.e., you don't know what you get) from Ravensburger. They are meant to be carry-on or gifts, suitable for children ("Mitbringspiel"). Some of the cubes contain actual games, others contain magic tricks, puzzles etc.

Content: 8 big cards, 8 small cards, 1 pawn, 1 die.

The big cards are placed in a circle face up. Small cards are placed in the center face down. In a turn you roll the die and advance the pawn. Then you must try to reveal the small card that matches the picture in the big card where the pawn is. If you do so you can keep the small card. If the small card is already in front of another player you take it from him. If you are the one holding the small card requested, then you win!

name: Ravensburger Spiele Minis: Duade
description:
"Spiele Minis" is a series of small surprise boxes (i.e., you don't know what you get) from Ravensburger. They are meant to be carry-on or gifts, suitable for children ("Mitbringspiel"). Some of the cubes contain actual games, others contain magic tricks, puzzles etc.

12 numbered cards in 2 colors are placed face down in the table.
On a turn you must throw 2 dice and then revealed 2 number cards. If the number and colors of the cards match the ones on the dice you receive a triumph chip. Then you place the cards face down again. If they don’t match then the other players in turn try to revealed the corresponding cards.

The game ends when a player gets 2 triumph chips.

name: Ravensburger Spiele Minis: Mausefalle
description:
"Spiele Minis" is a series of small surprise boxes (i.e., you don't know what you get) from Ravensburger. They are meant to be carry-on or gifts, suitable for children ("Mitbringspiel"). Some of the cubes contain actual games, others contain magic tricks, puzzles etc.

A player holds a cup while the others have a mouse by the tail (they are in the middle of the table touching by their noses). Then the player holding the cup rolls a die and must quickly catch the mouse of the color indicated by de die.

Only the player with the corresponding mouse can move his mouse trying to escape.

If the player holding the cup catches the mouse, they receive a victory point. If not, it is gained by the player owner of the mouse (who will have the cup now).

If another "mouse" moves its owner must move around the table in 4 feet.

The game ends when a player reaches 5 victory points.

name: Ravensburger Spiele Minis: Waschtag
description:
"Spiele Minis" is a series of small surprise boxes (i.e., you don't know what you get) from Ravensburger. They are meant to be carry-on or gifts, suitable for children ("Mitbringspiel"). Some of the cubes contain actual games, others contain magic tricks, puzzles etc.

20 pieces of cloth are placed in the middle of the table. Each player has a clothes line.

On your turn you must throw a die and you get a cloth in the corresponding color, which you hang on your clothes line. If no cloths of that color are left then you receive nothing.

If you throw a sun you must take a sunbeam and place it aside (there are 6). If the sun in the die is shining you can chose any cloth from the middle, but if its unhappy you must return one of yours to the middle (or one of an opponent if you don’t have any left).

The game ends when the sixth sunbeam is taken. The player with more cloth on his clothes line wins!

name: Bauherr
description:
Der Bauherr is a strategy and construction board game. In order to achieve the main goal of building a city, you must buy buildings by winning auctions, build and maintain them. Apart from plenty of buildings to construct, there are also orders to process and events to take care of. Der Bauherr was conceived for two players but also works with more.

Nicht komerzielles Stadt-Aufbauspiel mit Strategieelementen.
Building / City simulation.

name: Mittelalterliche Ritter
description:
Objective: gain as many cards (victory points) as possible
- acting simultaneously -
each player gets a card: 'fully equipped knight'
gamemaster draws a hidden card from the deck (incomplete knights);
first player who names the missing part gets the card
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory

name: Rot, gelb oder grün
description:
Objective: be the first completing your player board with coloured chips & learning colours.

- Acting by turns -

Choose a playerboard and throw a coloured d6; you may take a corresponding chip and place it upon an appropriate space of your board. If the die shows 'white': chip is up to your choice, with 'black' you must return a chip of your choice.

Player with a complete player-board wins.

name: Raketen-Wettfahrt
description:
Each player gets 4 rockets and a Sputnik. The moves are determined by a color die. The starting spaces are the colored dots on the rockets at the edge of the game board. The Sputnik is the last piece to start. It circles the Earth till the last rocket has arrived on its destination space. The first Player, who gets his rockets on the 4 destination spaces near his starting spaces and lands the Sputnik on earth in the center of the board, wins the game. A rocket, which lands on a space with another rocket on it, capture this rocket and releases it only when it reaches its destination space.

This game was published 1957 (launch of Sputnik 1) or up to a few years later.

name: Zambies: The Card Game
description:
2-6 Players build up defenses and toss Zambies around as weapons. Turn all your enemies into Zambie Bosses and be the last Player alive to win.

A simple game, quick to learn and quick to play. The more people you can get to play the more crazy the game becomes. The game revolves around drawing cards that consist of Zambies and Defenses. You use these cards to turn the game in your favor by blocking incoming Zambies, building up your enemies Zambies pools and once maxed, turning them into Zambies Bosses.

The Game doesn't end when you lose, Oh no, there is much more. When your Zambie pool is maxed out at 15, you collect the Zambies in your pool, and now you get to throw those Zambies at other players.

Zambies is a fast paced card game and can take 5 - 30 minutes to play.

name: Micro Quest
description:
Micro Quest is an adventure micro-game consisting of only 30 high quality cards and 30 custom meeples. Players will utilize the Market Economy and Quest Cards to gather the kings forces of highly trained Knights, Thieves, Clerics, and Mages.

Your land is under siege and the king has commanded you and your compatriots to acquire, train, and supply battle ready troops to support the war effort.

In Micro Quest, players compete for the king's favor (aka: victory points) by managing, training, and paying tribute with troops to support the king's army.
The game play consists of 3 phases:

1. Market Phase - players vie for control over the available units.

2. Quest Phase - players train their units by completing epic quests, activating powerful skills, and obtaining glory.

3. Tribute Phase - players compete in an all-out battle for the 'King's Favor' and must be careful managing units in order to pay proper tribute to the king.
mechanics: Action Queue, Open Drafting, Worker Placement
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), Goblin Army Games

name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Potsdam
description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Potsdam
- moving/acting by turns.

Each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Potsdam. Correct answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.
categories: Dice, Economic, Educational, Negotiation, Political, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Wolfsburg
description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Wolfsburg
- moving/acting by turns.

Each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Wolfsburg. Correct answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.
categories: Dice, Economic, Educational, Negotiation, Political, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Trading

name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Lüneburg
description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Lüneburg
- moving/acting by turns.

Each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Lüneburg. Correct answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Trading

name: Segelfliegerspiel
description:
Objective: be the first to pass finish line
learn more about flying a glider

- moving by turns/simple 'Roll and Move' game -

Meeples are moved according the die roll;
ending on a red space (20x) follow instructions..
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Educational, Racing, Sports

name: Lepelstronten: Het Bordspel
description:
Lepelstronten: Het Bordspel is the board game developed for the 8th anniversary of gaming club Stobbeldeen.

Using dice, players try to move their pawn to a central target as soon as possible. As soon as one of the players succeeds, the target moves, forcing the other players to change direction and try to reach the new location. During the first phase of the game, users can, instead of rolling the dice, choose to buy cards, which can be used during the 2nd phase to move faster or block other players.

The player who doesn't reach the target in time will be penalized. After a predefined number of rounds, the player who has the least penalty wins the game.

name: Gems of Agartha
description:
You and your fellow explorers have discovered the underground city of Agartha!...and its fabulous gems! Unfortunately, removing the gems has disrupted the integrity of the area, and now the whole city threatens to collapse around you! Your only hope is to work your way through the city and figure out which gems act as the keys to stop the collapse.

But be careful! The more you move throughout the city, the faster it weakens, and the sooner it will collapse...

...and if that wasn't enough! The gems are all cursed! If the you're skilled enough to survive, be sure you have the least cursed gems...or else the consequences will be swift and painful!!!


Players use deductive reasoning to establish which gems were removed from play at the beginning of the game. This is accomplished by strategically moving along a play area composed of tiles that the players may rotate, push, and move between. Rotating and pushing tiles speeds up the end of the game, so it's best to be judicious in how often you do so.

A cooperative game, if the hidden gems are not identified by game's end, then there is no winner. However, if the group does solve the mystery, then the player in possession of the least cursed gems is victorious!

name: Pretz'
description:
The kids game that matches delicious foods, and well... Matching.

Kids flip over one card at a time, looking to match type of pretzel, and flavor of pretzel. However, also in the cards are bonuses, that act like a match over-rider, for that extra edge against other players.

Game play lasts around 5 minutes, and teaches children to notice minor details.

In two player, the person with the most matches wins!
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Print & Play, Puzzle
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), (Web published), Monkey Finger Games

name: Schnecke
description:
The players choose one each of the 6 pawns and start at the snail's shell in the center of the game board. The game is played with 1 color die.

A player who roll his own color, begins the game by rolling again and moving on the spiral. On the roll of any color, the pawn advances to the next space of that color. If a player rolls his own color, he moves and may then roll and move again.
When a pawn arrives on an occupied space, it throws the other pawn out, back to the snail's shell where it must start again.

From the last spaces on the spiral, a pawn advances to one of the 6 snail heads in their own color as soon as the player rolls that color. The first player to achieve this, wins the game.

name: Spring ins Tor
description:
Objective: score as many goals as possible within a given time or
eliminate all opponent's meeples (except goalkeeper)

- acting by turns -

Players try to score by flipping a smooth disc into opponent's goal
- if a meeple (building a barrier) is hit remove it.

Notes:
Likely published early 1930's

name: Durch Oberbayern und Tirol: Ein neues Reisespiel
description:
Objective: Be the first moving up to field 83 (Munich/round trip)
learn more about Bavaria/Tirol
- moving by turns -
throw the die and move according rolled number; ending on any red marked space follow instructions.

remarks: game should had been published during 1938-40 (thats the only time artist became available)
as usual - cute pewter figures
succeeds Von München durch Oberbayern nach Tirol

name: Reise durch Großdeutschland
description:
Objective: Be the first moving up to field 60 (start: Berlin - finish: Hamburg)

- moving by turns -

Throw the die and move according rolled number; ending on any red marked number follow instructions.

Notes:
Game reflects Nazi ideology at that time
Likely published 1939/40
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel

name: Through the Locks to the Golden Gate
description: A spin and move game for two players representing ships journeying through the Panama Canal, from the Caribbean Sea to the Pacific Ocean (the Golden Gate being the strait, not the bridge which wasn't built until two decades later).

name: Dear Leader
description:
The Supreme Glorious Leader needs to be pleasured and players, as managers of Leader's pleasure teams, must provide Dear Leader with the entertainment he requires.

Dear Leader is a quick tile game in which players score points by providing Dear Leader with the entertainers he desires, but if Leader is not in the mood for the entertainers you provide, there will be executions!

Players begin each turn by taking turns drafting entertainer tiles from a central market. Using these entertainer tiles, each player creates a team of entertainers and 'sends it off' to Dear Leader. At the end of each turn, Dear Leader selects one of the 5 types of entertainers (Parades, Cinema, Dancers, Clowns, Libation). The entertainers of the type that Leader selected are scored (placed in a score pile) and the entertainers of the incorrect types are executed. Each of the 5 different entertainer types has a special ability and players can sacrifice them to affect scoring or Dear Leader's decision making.

Game ends when there are no more entertainers. Players score a point for each tile in their score pile and bonus points for having many of the same tile type in the score pile.

name: Wurf & Wort
description:
The word game Wurf & Wort challenges you to think in syllables instead of letters.

On a turn, a category card is revealed, e.g., "on the beach" or "at the airport"; each card shows a points multiplier and a few dice icons. Someone rolls these dice, then everyone tries to be the first to come up with a word that fits the category and falls within the restriction of the dice (as not all dice will be rolled each time). The number on the syllable die indicates how many syllables the word must be; the forbidden die shows which letter cannot be used in the answer; and the two letter dice show a letter that should be used in the answer along with a point value.

Whoever comes up with a valid word first scores the sum of the letter values for each appropriate letter in her answer times the points multiplier on the card, up to a maximum of ten points. If the answerer chooses an inappropriate word — or a majority of players vote down the word for being off-category — the answerer loses three points. After all 25 category cards have been played, the player with the most points wins.

name: Pele-mele
description:
Objective: be the first to complete your card by collecting/filling in matching coloured chips (4)
- acting by turns -
fill up the board: 4 x 6 coloured chips; put a chip on each corner
roll a 6d-coloured die and choose an appropriate starting position

Active player: rolls the die and chooses a direction; move until you reach an appropriate coloured space: take a chip (if there is any); if there is a smiling face: ask another player for a chip of his/her choice; sad face; give away a chip of your choice; joker: get a chip of your choice.

You loose if you have to take a fifth non-matching chip
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Wild West: Das neue Indianer und Cowboyspiel
description:
This game is for 2 players (indians & cowboys) or 2 teams with up to 3 players. After the die is cast, the meeple can move to the next space of the rolled Color in any direction. The meeples start in their camp (colored triangle) and try to get into the enemy camp. Whenever 2 opposing meeples meet on the same space, they have to fight. The outcome is determined by the color die (red or blue). The loser has been captured, but can later be rescued by his mates. When a Player gets all his meeples into the enemy camp, or captures all enemies, he wins the game

The game was published in the 1940s or 1950s.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Moneta
description: Called The Game of Moneta, or Money Makes Money. The box declares "By the author of Logomachy." The object of the game is to make the most money. Each of the 50 illustrated cards shows a coin; the denominations are: 1 cent, 2 cent, 3 cent, 5 cent, 10 cent, 20 cent, 25 cent, 50 cent, $1 (silver), $1 (gold), $2 1/2, $3, $5, and $10.

name: Silhouette Pocket
description:
Silhouette Pocket is played with a deck of cards with silhouette images.

Two cards are drawn from the deck. The first player to come up with a word that matches both cards keeps them both, and two new cards are drawn. If there are a few cards where nobody can find an acceptable combination players are allowed to build combination with cards in their own stock.

When the deck is exhausted the player with the most cards wins.

Notes:
Can be combined with other 'Silhouette' editions;
Compact design
categories: Card Game, Educational, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: Die verrückte Acht
description:
Each player has a set of 4 meeples that start in his or her corner of the board. The goal is to move the meeples around the board to the "home" section. Movement is controlled by a die. All players may capture each others meeples. Captured meeples are returned to their player's corner and must start their journey over. The winner is the first player to move all meeples "home". Since the board is outlayed like an "8", the middle space is the most dangerous!

This game is a variant of Pachisi and was published in the 1930s or 1940s.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ludusfidelis
description: Ludusfidelis is inspired by artifacts from the Museu Municipal de Penafiel. It is a game for two played an a rectangular board with a 2 x 5 grid of squares. One row of squares is empty, the other marked with "coins." Players have three pieces each of their own color or shape, and take turns rolling a die to determine how to move their pieces around the board in a counter-clockwise direction. The six-sided die has the numbers 1, 2, 3, 4, 4, and 5 on it. The squares of the board are marked with roman numerals one through ten. The goal is for a player to land all of their pieces on the squares marked with a coin.

name: Salto do Cavalo
description: Salto do Cavalo is a game for two played on a 5x5 grid of 25 squares. Each player has a one piece in a different shape or color than the other player. There are 23 neutral pieces that are also used. Play begins with an empty board but for each player being stationed in an opposite corner of the board. Players then take turns moving their piece like a Knight in Chess, and placing a neutral piece to mark where the player began their move. Players may not move onto these neutral pieces. The last player to make a move wins the game.

name: Kampf und Sieg
description:
Objective: Eliminate your opponent/
- moving/acting by turns -

Gameboard is your battlefield. You have several different military units with different qualities (range, power,...) at your disposal.
1. Place your 25 units into the red/blue marked areal.
2. Advance your units
3. Attack if enemy is within allowed range & vulnerable by your unit
4. Remove defeated units

Notes:
Likely published mid 1930's;
can be played also with more payers (even numbers/units are separated)
categories: Abstract Strategy, Wargame, World War II

name: Meta
description: Meta is an abstract game for two played on a 4x4 grid of 16 squares. Each player has four pieces of a different color or shape, one each labeled with one of these letters: M, E, T, A. Play begins with each player's pieces lined next to each other in the board's middle two rows, spelling out M-E-T-A. Players take turns moving their pieces to one empty adjacent square, vertically, horizontally, or diagonally. The first player to move all of his pieces to the furthest row and spell M-E-T-A wins the game. There are variations depending on how to start the game and whether to use the letters, and in which direction the letters should face.

name: Penim
description: Penim is a variant of Nim, played with five kinds of pieces: 11 small circles, 9 short rounded rectangles, 7 small squares, 5 long rounded rectangles, and 3 large squares. The pieces are organized into heaps and the players take turns removing the pieces until none are left. The last player to remove a piece wins the game. The rules provide for varying degrees of difficulty, with different combinations of the pieces being used and different rules for who can take what piece.

name: Achtung: Rot!
description:
The players start at the train station and try to get their car to the hotel (or reverse) as soon as possible. The first to arrive at his destination, wins the game.

The moves of the cars are determined by a die. When a player rolls a 6, he has to move the turntable under the game board one notch further with his steering wheel. This changes the traffic signs and the traffic lights. If a car arrives on an occupied space, an accident occurs and the arriving car has to head for the repair shop. Each player starts with 6 gas markers. For every 1 he rolls, he has to spend 1 marker. The markers can be regained at the gas station. If all markers are spend, the player has to withdraw from the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Apostles
description:
Apostles is a non-denominational Christian-themed card game in which players represent ministers working to edify the Christian church.

Through the management of spiritual gifts and fruit, his people become equipped for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up. In the game gifts, fruit, mission and people are represented by cards which, once established yield spiritual blessings (cards dealt at the beginning of each round), and/or souls reached, which accumulate as points for scoring at the end of the game.

The game consists of 135 cards, out of which a hand of 9 is dealt to each player. Players use the cards to establish gifts, fruit, mission or workers (by discarding cards from his hand), or save for later rounds. Gifts nurture and encourage good fruit in the church, which in turn manifest themselves in the form of mission.

As events affect the development of the church, players struggle to establish the most thriving ministry.

You can follow the game design thread here:
WIP, Apostles, Christian card game

name: Aatheuo
description:
From the designer's website (used with permission):

Aatheuo (pronounced like "off-uh-you") is a tabletop game that was inspired from my love of Uno, Scrabble, and Rummy. 2 to 4 players take turns placing tiles from their hand onto the board, creating sequences and sets or three or more tiles. You win if you are the first player to have no tiles remaining. With more than 2 players, continue playing to determine runner-ups.

The unique beauty of Aatheuo comes from the spatial-reasoning involved in re-arranging the board in any way, as long as all of the basic properties of the sequences and sets are maintained.

Aatheuo was chosen as an Official Selection in IndieCade 2012, in addition to being featured as a night game at IndieCade. There are no concrete plans for bulk physical manufacturing of Aatheuo sets, but a digital version is in pre-production.

name: Augen auf im Straßenverkehr
description:
The players start at the airfield or the train station. Each player gets some game coins and draws 2 destination cards. These destinations have to be visited on the way to the starting spaces of the opposite players. Every time a 6 is rolled, the traffic cop in the centre of the game board is rotated to change the traffic lights. If a player disobeyes a traffic rule, he has to pay a game coin. The first player to reach the finish space wins the game. The second winner is the one with the most game coins.

This game was published in the 1950s
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wir fahren mit der Eisenbahn
description:
Each player gets a train consisting of an engine and 3 cars. The players start at the station of their color and have to visit all other stations, where they leave a car on a sidetrack. Then they have to get the engine back to their home Station to win the game. When the player rolls a 1 or 4, he may adjust one of the two railroad switches. This is important because other trains can only be overtaken on parallel tracks.

This game was published in the 1930s or 1940s.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Landkreisspiel Forchheim
description:
2 different games:
objective 1: gain as many cards as possible delivering correct answers (trivia)
objective 2: gain as many cards as possible; Happy Families approach
1 & 2: learn more about the local region (Forchheim - in the North of Nuremberg)
- acting simultaneously -
active player reads the question; first player with correct answer gets the card.

Notes:
Belongs to a series of games with a strong regional (rural) focused character (contrary to 'city games');
Usually each village of the administrative district is described.

name: Legend: History of 1000 Miglia – 1928 Chrysler Type 72
description:
This promo adds the 1928 Chrysler Type 72 to the game Legend: History of 1000 Miglia.

Comes with the automobile data sheet, a pawn and a short history.

name: Paddington Photo
description: Paddington Photo is a roll and move game with a twist. The game is a small box game. It consists of a 3-piece (puzzle type) game board, 3 cardboard figures (Paddington, Mr. and Mrs. Brown) and 25 plastic chips as well as 2 colour dice. The game board has spots in red, blue yellow etc. round in a circle. In game variation one all 3 figures are placed randomly on the board. On his turn a player rolls both dice. He/she assigns each roll to a figure on the board and moves two figures according to the die roll. E.g. the dice show red and yellow: then the player must move 2 of the three figures. One on any red space, one on any yellow space. When the three figures are located next to each other a photo is shot. The player achieving the photo shot gets a chip as reward. Once a photo is completed the middle figure runs away to the opposite space of the same colour. After 20 photos are shot the game ends, player with the most chips wins. In a variation a photo is especially well taken when Paddington is in the middle. Then the player gets 2 chips for this kind of photo shot. After all 25 chips are exhausted the game ends.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Novel-based
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Landkreisspiel Ansbach
description:
2 different games:
objective 1: gain as many cards as possible delivering correct answers (trivia)
objective 2: gain as many cards as possible; Happy Families approach
1 & 2: learn more about the local region (Ansbach - in the Southwest of Nuremberg)
- acting simultaneously -
active player reads the question; first player with correct answer gets the card.

Notes:
Belongs to a series of games with a strong regional (rural) focused character (contrary to 'city games');
Usually each village of the administrative district is described.
Due to this point each game is equipped with a different no. of cards.

name: Landkreisspiel Neustadt a.d.Aisch-Bad Windsheim
description:
2 different games:
objective 1: gain as many cards as possible delivering correct answers (trivia)
objective 2: gain as many cards as possible; Happy Families approach
1 & 2: learn more about the local region (Neustadt a.d.Aisch-Bad Windsheim - northeast from Nuremberg)
- acting simultaneously -
active player reads the question; first player with correct answer gets the card.

Notes:
Belongs to a series of games with a strong regional (rural) focussed character (contrary to 'city games');
Usually each village of the administrative district is discribed.
Due to this point each game is equipped with a different no. of cards.

name: Sungem Run!
description:
Sungem Run! is part of the Rise of the Occulites Saga of games.

Sungem Run! is a 2-8 player hidden role game that utilises dice, your natural sneakiness and skills of misdirection. It takes place directly after Dawn – Rise of the Occulites and has you representing an Occulite Tribe that didn’t quite collect enough Sungems for the Long Dark. You do not need to have played Dawn previously or be aware of the Rise of the Occulites setting, but knowing the setting obviously helps with understanding the theme of the game.
